I am requesting a $1,200 loan to repair a fence and for the construction of an additional room in the second floor of my home.”

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

“Mi casa hace muchos años que se construyo, así es que con el paso del tiempo se ha deteriorado mucho me urge reparar una barda que esta por caerse y quiero también construir un cuarto en la planta alta de mi vivienda para tener más espacio para mi familia” Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para la reparación de una barda y la construcción de un cuarto en la planta alta de mi vivienda

loans.use: Repair a fence and build an additional room in the second floor of my home.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Señor Luis is 30-years-old. He is single and lives with his parents in their own home. He is the source of economic support for their family. He makes a living buying and selling all types of clothing for women, men, and children.

Luis is one of the suppliers of the stores in his city. Among the garments that he sells are: t-shirts, pants, shirts, shorts, and socks.

He is requesting a credit to be able to buy a large batch of merchandise that is being offered to him at a good price. If he succeeds in acquiring this merchandise, he will be able to offer better prices to his clients since their sales are rather high right now.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

El señor Luis tiene 30 años, el es soltero y vive con sus padres en una casa propia siendo él, el sustento de su familia. Luis se dedica a la compra y venta de todo tipo de ropas ya sea para damas, caballeros y niños.

Luis es uno de los proveedores de las tiendas de la cuidad. Entre las prendas que vende podemos citar: remeras, pantalones, camisas, shorts, medias, entre otros.

Solicita el crédito para poder comprar un lote grande de mercaderías que le ofrecieron a un muy buen precio, si el logra adquirir esta mercadería, podrá ofrecer mejores precios a sus clientes ya que en esta época las ventas son bastante altas.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing for women, men, and children

loans.name: Ruhangiz

texts.en:
Ruhangiz lives in the Saatli region in the village of Soltanabad in Azerbaijan. She is 50 years old, married, and has 4 children. Ruhangiz established her cattle breeding business in 1992. Since then, she has been successfully managing it with help from her husband and children (her daughter is pictured here). They breed cows and then sell them in the local cattle market.

Ruhangiz wants to buy more cows because she plans to expand her business. Ruhangiz applied to the Saatli branch of Normicro for a loan of $600 USD.

loans.use: To buy more cows for breeding

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Mrs. Teresa is a seamstress and sews various types of polo shirts and dresses that her neighbors and friends request from her. She has a large quantity of beautiful fabrics in her sewing workshop that she recently opened. She worked in a sewing shop before but she wanted to become more independent and thought it better to open her own business in order to feel truly content. She is single and her desire for advancement is based on her hope to offer her future family economic stability. In order to reach that goal she is already working arduously towards realizing her dream. Without a doubt, it all has a price. Stability is not created overnight. Teresa is well aware of this, and is now in need of capital in order to buy a greater quantity of fabrics in the capital where it would easier to get them.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

DOÑA Teresa es costurera y confecciona diversos tipos de polos y vestidos que le solicitan sus vecinos y amigos y tiene una gran cantidad de hermosas telas dentro de su taller de costura que abrió recientemente. Trabajaba en una taller de costura pero quiso independizarse y que mejor que abrir su propio negocio en la cual se siente verdaderamente contenta, es soltera y sus ganas de superación están basadas en ofrecer a su futura familia estabilidad económica y para alcanzar este propósito ya está trabajando arduamente con la esperanza de realizar sus anhelos.Sin duda todo tiene un precio y el forjarse estabilidad económica no se realiza de la noche a la mañana y esto lo sabe muy bien Teresa, a quien le urge un capital para comprar diversas telas de la capital en la que los podría obtener muy cómodo.

loans.use: Purchase of a greater quantity of fabrics.

loans.name: Manju

texts.en:
Manju L. is a 20-year-old woman who lives in Sanepa, Lalitpur. She lives with her father-in-law, mother-in-law and husband. Her husband is a taxi driver and her father-in-law works in a small hotel. Mrs L. is a shopkeeper.

Mrs L. opened her grocery shop two years ago to increase the quality of life of her family. She sells a variety of grocery items. She wants to further expand her business so she is requesting her first loan of Rs 10000.00 ($US175) to buy necessary grocery items for her shop.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for her shop.

loans.name: Kob

texts.en: Mr. Kob Y. is 29 and a subsistence farmer and a pig breeder in Angk Village in Kandal Province. He is married with a child who is too young to work or study. His wife Sokna Neang is a silk weaver in the local village. Mr. Kob Y. usually hires a person to work on the rice field and just waits for the revenue. Previously, he had obtained a loan from Brasac Co.,LTD to hire a person to cultivate the rice field. Last year Mr. Kob Y. had a big problem because many insects damage his rice and thus did not make enough money to pay his worker, therefore he asked for a loan to pay the wages.

loans.use: Kob would like to pay for his employee for his rice field.

loans.name: Nasim

texts.ru:
Nasim K. lives in the Rudaki region with his family. He is not married and currently lives with his parents. He and his mother have a retail business and sell women's clothing on the Kovron market. He has five years of experience in this field. Nasim wants to help his mother and also separate their vendor space. By receiving a loan he will be able to have an independent business. This will also help his family increase their income. He plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Косимов Насим житель района Рудаки. Проживает со своей семьей . Он еще не женат и поэтому живет с родителями. Вместе с матерью занимается торговлей. Торгует на рынке «Корвон» женской одеждой. Опыт работы в данной сфере 5 лет. Хочет помочь матери и кроме того отделить торговую точку. Получив кредит он сможет занятся бизнесом самостоятельно. Это поможет его семье увеличить доход семьи.Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase commodity circulation

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
Mr. Gustavo Z. is single, lives with his mother, and is a taxi driver. Gustavo is the owner of two taxi stands. He drives one of his vehicles (which he also owns) and the other is driven by a contracted driver. He tells us with pride that it was with great effort he was able to buy the two taxi stands and his two vehicles.

The loan requested will be used for the repair of his home. In the future he would like to open a mechanic shop and be a source of jobs for more people.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, a Kiva volunteer.

El señor Gustavo Z. es soltero vive con su madre, el se y es taxista. Gustavo es propietario de dos paradas de taxis. El conduce uno de sus vehículos y otro vehículo que también es de su propiedad lo conduce un chofer contratado. Cuenta orgulloso que con mucho esfuerzo logró comprar las dos paradas y sus dos vehículos.

El crédito que se le otorgo fue utilizado en el arreglo de su vivienda ya que en el futuro desea poder abrir un taller mecánico y dar fuente de trabajo a más personas.

loans.use: Expansion of home

loans.name: Yoni

texts.es:
Señor Yoni P. is married to Señora Sandra Elizabeth Roa with whom he has one daughter. Yoni used to work selling wood in the center of the country. With the little he earned he studied the art of fine and antique furniture making. This is how one day he finished his studies in carpentry and decided to go to the central hub of his country. With the little savings that he had, he rented a house for his family and bought a few machines to begin his work.

He wants to invest the loan he is requesting to buy wood for his work. Today, Yoni has a fine and antique furniture factory where he employs 20 people. His next objective is to open a sales location in Asunción.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky and John Glassmire, Kiva Volunteers.

El señor Yoni P. está casado con la señora Sandra Elizabeth Roa con quien tiene una hija. Yoni se dedicaba anteriormente a la comercialización de madera en el interior del país, con lo poco que ganaba fue estudiando lo que respecta a la fabricación de muebles finos y rústicos respecta. Fue así que un día luego de haber terminado sus estudios en la parte de carpintería decidió venir a la zona central de nuestro país. Con los pocos ahorros que tenia alquiló una casa para su familia y pudo comprar algunas maquinarias para empezar a trabajar.

El crédito que solicita desea invertirlo en la compra de maderas para realizar sus trabajos. Hoy en día Yoni tiene una fábrica de muebles finos y rústicos donde da empleo a 20 personas. Su próximo objetivo es abrir un local de ventas en Asunción.

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret F. is a 38 year old wife and mother of three kids, who are in school. She has been a food vendor for five years. She prepares and sells kenkey, a local dish prepared from milled maize and eaten with all kinds of sauces and soups. It is a delicacy many Ghanaians enjoy everyday, either as breakfast, lunch, or dinner. She also sells fried rice.

Her business is doing well and she wants to expand her operation to serve more customers. With this loan, she wants to buy more maize grains, vegetables, rice, and assorted meat. She hopes this loan will help her increase her savings to improve her family's wellbeing. She would be very grateful for that assistance.

loans.use: To buy bags of dried maize grains, rice, vegetables, and assorted meat.

loans.name: Najat

texts.en:
Najat is married with one child, who is just two months old. She is a clothes seller. She works every day from 8 am to 6 pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Najat is now looking for a loan to buy more clothes for resale in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale to expand her business.

loans.name: Vin

texts.en: Vin P., 51, is married and lives with five of her eight children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 1998, she has worked as a worker, breaking rock. Normally, she makes around US$5 per day, while her husband works growing yams to earn less than one dollar each day. Vin P. and her husband together have contacted Credit to take out a loan of US$500 to rent a yam farm and then harvest the crop. This couple will slice the yams and then dry them in the sunshine. This investment will help increase the family’s income.

loans.use: To rent a yam farm to harvest a crop.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida A. S. sells fabric and clothing at Kissi near Elmina, Ghana. Vida has received no formal education.  She is married and has 8 children. Vida has been selling fabric and clothing since 1996. She is responsible for assisting her husband with meeting the family's financial needs. She is requesting this loan to purchase additional supplies of clothing for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to help her husband in the putting up a house for the family.

loans.use: Purchase supplies of clothing for sale.

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en: Rovshan M. is a 26 year-old married man who lives with his newborn daughter and owns a small farm consisting of sheep. He lives and works in the small southern city called Bilasuvar (Tajikistan). Rovshan has been selling sheep for three years. Since sheep selling is a profitable business, Rovshan has become a very successful businessman in a very short period of time. The income has been enough to cover family needs up until now. However, his child is growing and he is expecting another child, so covering family needs has become harder. Rovshan is applying for a loan of 1200 USD to expand his activities and to purchase more sheep.

loans.use: purchase 20 sheep

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 33 años y vive con su hijo de 3 años en casa de sus padres. Ella trabaja vendiendo cosméticos desde hace 3 años, su mercadería es de las líneas más confiables y mejor cotizadas de su medio. La forma de vender de Luz es ofreciendo de casa de casa a sus amistades y vecinos, y debido al incremento de sus ventas ha decidido aumentar su capital de trabajo con prendas de vestir para llevarlas a los trabajadores del sector salud de su localidad, ya que para ella esto significa mayor garantía cuando da al crédito sus productos, además que siempre su  clientela es fija y como les vende en su centro de trabajo, siempre los ubica y conoce cuando es fecha de pago para ir a cobrar sus cuentas. Ahora Luz mira con grandes expectativas su futuro para seguir siendo el sostén de su hijo. Es la segunda vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, ella regresó a su banco comunal después de dos ciclos (préstamos consecutivos) y fue admitida porque tiene como antecedentes positivos su puntualidad y fortaleza en el trabajo en equipo. Luz esta solicitando esta cantidad para la compra de mayor cantidad de cosméticos, adquirirá estos productos al contado para que de esta manera pueda ofrecer al crédito, también comprará prendas de vestir al por mayor, para empezar, ropa interior.
texts.en:
Luz is 33 years old and lives with her parents and her 3-year-old son. For the past 3 years she has worked selling cosmetics from one of the most trusted and valuable brands available. Luz sells her products by going to the houses of her friends and neighbors. Due to her increased sales she has decided to expand her business by also selling clothing to health care workers in her area. [By selling to more clients] she will have more security when she sells her products on credit. Regardless, she has set clients that she sells to at their workplace, she knows where they are and what day she has to go collect her payments. Luz looks toward the future with the expectation that she will continue to support her son. This is the second loan cycle with MFP. She went back to her community bank after two consecutive loans and was accepted because of her previous positive experiences, punctual payments and ability to work as a team. Luz is asking for this money to purchase more cosmetics. She will buy these products at a discount and then offer them to her clients on credit. She will also buy clothing articles to sell--to start with she will purchase undergarments to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of cosmetics she sells

loans.name: Sarkis

texts.en: Sarkis is a 42-year-old married man with three children, living in Anjar in the Bekaa Valley. Sarkis owns a home-based workshop where he works at affixing precious stones on jewelry. Today and in order to improve his output quality, Sarkis is requesting $1,200 to buy a new microscope.

loans.use: Buy a microscope for his jewelry-making

loans.name: Consejo

texts.en:
Consejo a is 50 year old woman who hails from Budbudan, Hamtic, Antique. She is married and blessed with five children. She is engaged in buying and selling of fish at Dalipe market and her customers are the people of different municipalities of Antique.

Her business started with initial capital of P2,000 she got from a local moneylender. At that time she experienced hardships because of a huge interest she has to pay. This is the reason why she has to close down her business.
 
Whe she joined the ASHI microfinance program, she was able to revive her business.  She is now requesting her fourth loan  of PHP20,000 she can use to purchase different kind of fish direct from the fishpond. The purchase of different kind of fish is a great help in growing her business. She also into  buying and selling of "nipa" (local palm leaves)  hut and “bubo” (a fishing gear used to catch prawns).
 
Her aspiration in life is that her business will become successful and someday she will be called “Mayor Kuprador” -- wholesaler.  She dreams that her children will finish their studies and have stable jobs in the future.

loans.use: Additional working capital for buying and seeling fish

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: Komi K. est un jeune homme de 29 ans, célibataire sans enfants. Il est réparateur auto à Womé, un village situé à environ 130 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. il souhaite avec ce crédit acheter des outils de travail et aussi aménager son atelier pour mieux exécuter son travail et gagner la confiance de sa clientèle. Dans la vue Komi est celui qui est au milieu.
texts.en:
Komi K. is a young man, 29 years old, unmarried, and without children. He is an auto repairman in Womé, a village located about 130 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. He would like to use this loan to buy work tools and also to equip his workshop in order to carry out his work better and to earn the trust of his customers. In the photo, Komi is the one in the middle.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy work tools and to fix up his shop

loans.name: Shalom 3 & 8 Group

texts.en:
The members of the Shalom Bank of Hope have been with Esperanza International for about 6 loan cycles. They have been faithful in completing their payments and their businesses have experienced a certain amount of growth in profit and sales volumes.

Natividad M. is one of the group coordinators. She is a candy maker. She makes candy and sells it on the street. With this loan, she will buy the ingredients for making her candies such as corn, sweet potatoes, coconut, milk, and sugar.

She makes several types of candy. "Maiz dulce" which means "sweet corn," and is made with the whole grains of the corn kernels, then cooked in sweetened milk with cinnamon and cloves. "Dulce de coco" ("sweet cocoa") is either cooked in the stove or baked, and "dulce de batata" ("sweet potato") is a type of sweet potato pudding. Her candies have become well known in her area, but she would like to have a storefront in her house so that she can sell her candies there and avoid the walking.

Natividad's life is definitely not easy. Between cooking the candies and getting up early and walking the streets of Hato Mayor selling, she has very little time for herself and is often very tired from long days of work. She wants her three children (ages 11,12 and 15) to have a better life quality, which is why she is committed to suporting their education, hopefully until they become working professionals.

Please help us to continue to support this hard-working group of entrepreneurs through this Kiva loan. Thank you!

loans.use: To purchase a mill and products like corn, sugar, milk, sweet potatoes and coconut to make candy.

loans.name: José Alfonso

texts.es:
El señor José E. se dedica a laborar en la ciudad de Chinandega en el servicio de triciclo trasladando a las personas de un lugar a otro y de acuerdo con la distancia así es el cobro del pasaje.

Es de importancia destacar que hoy en día él requiere de la inversión en su triciclo y para esto ha acudido a Ceprodel porque necesita la compra de los repuestos para darle el mantenimiento respectivo al triciclo y de esta forma salir adelante en su servicio de triciclo en es sector transporte.
texts.en:
Mr. José E. works in the city of Cinandega as a bicycle rickshaw driver, transporting passengers from one place to another. He charges based on the distance traveled in the journey. José needs to invest in his rickshaw, and he'd like a loan from Ceprodel to buy replacement parts. With the necessary maintenance for his rickshaw, José will get ahead in the transportation sector.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rickshaw repair

loans.name: Ngo Thi

texts.en:
Dài Ngô Thị (2033971447) is a 52 year-old female living in the town of Sóc Sơn.  She is married and has 3 adult children. To making a living, Dài owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale.  Dài has been engaged in this business for over 26 years and earns approximately 2500000 VND a month from these activities.

In 1997, Dài joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Dài has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund which was used to purchase breeding livestock.  Dài is now requesting a new loan of 15000000 VND which will be used to purchase additional baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.  The loan will be the tenth loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  Dài plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business.

loans.use: used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is an animal keeper. She has owned a small shop in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for five years. She belongs to the Halengo 1 group loan. She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $250. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more avocados for resale. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business. Juliana is 22 years old, married, and has two children of ages 4 and 1.

loans.use: To buy more avocados for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase trade turnover

loans.name: Sied Raem

texts.en: S. Raem is the son of S. Y.. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has 5 children. He is working on the committee autocratic election and he wants to take a loan of 50000 Afghani. He is very happy for this loan process that can solve all his problems.

loans.use: For needed materials.

loans.name: Dupe

texts.en: Dupe is 40 years old and married with 3 children who are in school. Dupe sells drinks and is requesting a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She wishes to say thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Selina's Group

texts.en:
Selina N. is a hard-working and friendly lady. She has been selling fish in the Lugazi central market for 22 years. She buys her fish from the landing sites in Lugazi and Mukono and, because she has been in the business for a long time, she knows where to buy which fish and from whom. 

However, Selina says that before she sold fish, she was a farmer, and because money is hard to come by for a farmer, unless one is on a large scale, she resorted to fish selling, and has no regrets about the change. She hopes to expand her business so that she can supply fish to her fellow workers so that she can be able to sell much more. 

Selina is a widow with 6 children of her own and 4 step-children that she cares for. This requires her to work so hard. 

(Benita appeared in both subgroups of the Nakazadde group and is being considered to be a member of this one.)

loans.use: Buying more fish for resale in her business.

loans.name: Las Darianas Group

texts.es:
Provenientes del Barrio Loma Linda, el grupo Las Darianas está conformado por cuatro mujeres emprendedoras que poseen la convicción de crecer y alcanzar sus sueños con forme al trabajo y ahínco que pongan a sus vidas.

Doña María Josefina F. S., es la coordinadora del grupo, quien tiene 42 años de edad, de los cuales lleva ya siete años trabajando en la venta de cosméticos de diferentes marcas conocidas como los son Vogue y venta de prendas de plata de la línea Romanel.

Ella pretende invertir su crédito en la compra de productos que le han encargado y que no ha podido comprar por falta de efectivo suficiente.

María Agustina P. F., quien trabaja en la distribución de cosméticos de marcas reconocidas internacionalmente, Meyling Ilieltt T. B. trabaja en la venta de ropa para damas y caballeros en su zona, ella compra las piezas de contado y las coloca al crédito a un precio mayor para ganar un porcentaje viable; Y María Yamileth Z. Z. quien trabaja en la confección de ropa. Ellas son las otras tres integrantes del grupo.

loans.use: Productos que tiene encargados

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 50-year-old single man living with his brother. He owns three rental homes which provide enough income to improve the lives of his brother and himself. Today, Mohamad wants to borrow $500 for repairs and maintenance on a rental home.

loans.use: Maintenance for a rental home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria O. is married and has two children. She has received education through senior high school. Her husband is a pensioner.

Victoria sells goods such as onions and groundnuts (peanuts) at Elmina near Atabadze, which she has been doing since 2008. She uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Victoria will use the loan to buy more onions, groundnuts and other food supplies to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, She plans to save to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more onions, groundnuts and other food supplies to sell

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
El señor Armando es casado con la joven señora de nombre Mayela Yoseth Campos, ellos son padres de 3 niños todos pequeñitos, por el momento viven en la casa de sus suegros ya que en la parte posterior de la vivienda es donde Armando esta realizando la construcción de su hogar y por el momento cuenta con el apoyo de su familia política. 
El labora para una empresa reconocida a nivel estado desde hace 8 años, en el departamento de oficial de producción obteniendo muy buenos ingresos. 
Ellos aunque son una familia joven son personas muy responsables y en busca de un buen futuro, están tramitando este crédito para la colocación de la losa de concreto de su vivienda en construcción.
texts.en:
Señor Armando is married to a young woman named Mayela Yoseth Campos. They are parents of 3 children who are all very small. At the moment, they live in a house with his in-laws. In the back of that house Armando is building his house with the support of his in-laws. He has worked for 8 years as a production department official for a firm that is well-known at the state level, and he makes a very good income. They are a young family, but they are very responsible people who are looking for a good future. They are transacting this loan in order to place a concrete slab roof on their home under construction.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to put a concrete slab roof on their home under construction

loans.name: Syprose Achieng

texts.en:
Syprose O., 35, is a married shopkeeper with three children.

In her shop, which she has run for seven years, she sells household food and products such as sugar, rice flour, cooking fats, baking flour, soda mild and detergents.

She runs the operation by herself and the store is located by the side of a main road. It is a busy location, but she does face significant competition. In the future, she hopes to establish another branch of her business and become the most established shop in the area.

Syprose describes herself as hardworking and patient.

loans.use: Additional stock for store, e.g., rice, sugar, milk

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie L. is from the town of Lapasan Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 27 years old, married, and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Elvie owns and operates a a general store in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily toiletries such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Elvie has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Elvie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40,000 PHP from GDMPC. Elvie is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell in her store. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Elvie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen, and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mardy's Group

texts.en:
Mardy C. is from the village of Luna. She is 44 years old. Mardy is the group leader of a 13-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Mardy is single. To make a living, Mardy owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling personal products from Personal Collection, MSE, Sundance, BoardWalk and AVON in the local community. Mardy has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Mardy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mardy is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Mardy from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly comprised of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Narangerel

texts.en:
Narangerel is a 44-year-old single mother who lives alone in a province of Mongolia. All her children live on their own. She lives in a Mongolian traditional tent called a ger.

Narangerel has been able to support herself because of the success of her consumer goods and grocery trading business. She started her business in 2004 with working capital of 800,000 tugrug (~$560 US) which has increased to 2,000,000 tugrug (~$14,000 US) since. The increased profits are due to her good business skills and good customer service. She has cultivated very good relationships with both her customers and suppliers and believes that these relationships are the key to her success.

Narangerel would like to expand her product offerings and is therefore requesting a 1,800,000 tugrug loan in order to buy a greater variety of products to sell.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of products

loans.name: Barrio Pil Group

texts.es: El grupo “Barrio Pil“ esta representada por la señora Jajhaira Concepción y conformada por 14 miembros es un grupo responsable y dinámico que va cursando ya un tercer ciclo demostrando siempre puntualidad y responsabilidad. Todos los socios poseen sus propias fuentes D. ingreso como la venta D. libros, leche, ropa, pan y al servicio domestico, costura y mecánico. En cuanto al entorno competitivo las socias venden en la periferia D. la ciudad más que todo en su barrio y algunas veden en las ferias vecinales por lo que no tienen mucha competencia. El destino del crédito es para la adquisición D. mayor mercadería, insumos y herramientas D. trabajo como maquinas surf hiladoras, tornos y la apertura D. nuevos negocios.  En cuanto a las expectativas a futuro todos los integrantes desean mejorar sus viviendas y darles una mejor educación a sus hijos y algún día verlos profesionales algo que una mayoría D. ellos no pudo hacer por falta D. recursos y no quieren que les pase igual a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The "Barrio Pil" group is represented by Jajhaira Concepción and is maD. up of 14 members. It is a very responsible and dynamic group that is in its third loan cycle and is always punctual and responsible. All of the members have their own sources of income; for example, selling books, milk, clothes and bread, providing domestic services and working as seamstresses and mechanics. In terms of the competitive environment, the members sell in the outskirts of the city, mostly in their neighborhood. Some sell in the neighboring markets, so they do not have much competition.

The loan will be used to buy merchandise, equipment and working tools like machines for spinning thread and potter's wheels. Some of the loan will be put toward opening new stores. All of the members hope to improve their houses and proviD. their children with a better education. They hope to one day see their children working as professionals, something that the majority of them could not do for lack of resources.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Edelien

texts.en:
Edelien Y. is from the village of Solinog, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old, is married, and has two adult-aged children. Edelien owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily-use products such as powder, oil, bread, shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc., in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Edelien joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding her business. Edelien is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Coura

texts.fr: Madame Coura G. est une ancienne sociétaire de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC Ouakam, membre fondateur car elle a été parente bénéficiaire depuis le programme du micro crédit. Elle a déjà bénéficié de 11 prêts antérieurs. Elle habite à Ouakam dans le quartier de Touba à quelques mètres de la caisse. Elle est mariée et mère de 8 enfants. Son mari est un ouvrier polygame. Ses revenus s’avèrent insuffisants pour prendre en charge tous les besoins de la famille. Par conséquent elle a depuis plus de 9 ans évolue dans la petite restauration en vendant le petit déjeuner devant chez elle. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de soutenir ses enfants et de prendre en charge une grande partie de ses besoins personnels. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs pour renforcer son activité car elle envisage d’acheter les produits qui lui permettent de préparer son petit déjeuner et de les stocker. Ces denrées sont le sucre, le petit pois, etc. Les prêts consentis auprès de l’institution lui ont permis de noter un certain avancement dans son activité et d’avoir une certaine stabilité sociale.
texts.en:
Mrs. Coura G. is a long-time member of the bank U-IMCEC Ouakam, a founding member since she was a main beneficiary of the micro-credit program. She has already profited from 11 previous loans. She lives in Ouakam in the neighborhood of Touba, several meters from the bank. She is married and the mother of eight children. Her husband is a manual laborer and polygamous. His income proves insufficient to cover all of the needs of the family. Consequently, for over nine years she has developed a small restaurant, selling breakfast in front of her home. Her profits allow her to support her children and take responsibility for a large part of her own personal needs. She is asking for a loan of 100,000 frs to reinforce her business, as she plans to buy products that allow her to prepare her breakfast and back-stock these goods. These products are sugar, peas, etc. The loans from the institution will allow her to achieve a certain advancement in her business and a certain social stability.

Translated from French by Carolyn McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to strengthen working capital

loans.name: Yareysi María

texts.es:
La Joven Yareysi María Z. Z. es una joven del Municipio de Condega y se dedica a la venta de ropa variada de segunda en su casa de habitación.

Ella solicita un financiamiento en Ceprodel para la compra de varias pacas de ropa de segunda y así ofrecer un mejor surtido de ropa tanto para adultos como para niños. El la empezó con este negocio con el objetivo de aumentar sus ingresos, empezó vendiendo ropa en pequeña cantidad y solo a para adulto y al ir teniendo mas demanda ella fue aumentando su producto.

Ella tiene aproximadamente un año de tener este negocio y lo atiende todos los días  desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde  a veces le ayuda su hermana a atender el negocio. Ella se dedicaba  a las labores de estilista antes de tener este negocio.

Yareysi Z. espera que con la compra de más pacas de ropa de segunda aumenten sus ventas y satisfaga la demanda de los clientes y así ir aumentando más su negocio.

Yareysi Z. es soltera y no tiene hijos, su hermana vive con ella.

Este es el crédito numero  2 que ella tiene en Ceprodel en un periodo de dos años y estos crédito le han ayudado positivamente ya que le hay permitido crecer en su negocio de venta de ropa mejorando sus ingresos mensuales.
texts.en:
Yareysi María Z. Z. is a young woman from the municipality of Condega who makes a living selling a variety of second-hand clothing out of her home. She is requesting the loan from Kiva partner Ceprodel to purchase various bundles of second-hand clothing so she can offer a larger stock of products for adults as well as children. She started the business with the goal of increasing her income, and she started out selling small quantities of clothing only for adults and as demand increased she also increased her products. Yareysi has had the business approximately one year and tends to it every day from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m., and sometimes her sister helps her. Previously, Yareysi made a living as a hairstylist. She hopes that with the purchase of more second-hand clothing she can increase her sales and satisfy her customers' demand, and thus grow her business more. Yareysi is single and doesn't have children, and her sister lives with her. This is her second loan through Kiva partner Ceprodel over two years, and her previous loan helped her grow her business and increase her monthly income.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bundles of second-hand clothing

loans.name: Teresa Gaby

texts.es: TERESA ES CLIENTE YA RECURRENTE CON UN EXCELENTE HISTORIAL CREDITICIO, CUENTA CON UN STATION WAGON TOYOTA EL CUAL LO TRABAJA DIARIAMIENTE, CUENTA CON SERVICIO ESCOLAR Y A SU VEZ BRINDA SERVICIO DE TAXI Y COLECTVIO EN LA RUTA SAN JOAQUIN – CERCADO DE ICA, TIENEN UNA HIJA A SU CARGO YA QUE LOS DEMAS SON MAYORES E INDEPENDIENTES, SOLICITAN FINANCIAMIENTO PARA INVERTIR EN SU CASA YA QUE ES HUMILDE Y DESEAN COMPRAR TRES MODULOS PRE FABRICADOS YA QUE SE ACERCA EL INVIERNO, TAMBIEN NECESITA HACER MANTENIMIENTO A SU HERRAMIENTA DE TRABAJO.
texts.en:
Theresa is a repeat customer with an excellent credit history. She has a Toyota station wagon that she puts to work on a daily basis. She's got a school transportation business as well a taxi and van service on the San Joaquin Route near Ica. They have one daughter at home, as the rest are grown up and on their own. They're requesting a loan to invest in their house; it's modest and they want to buy three pre-fab modules for it since Winter is coming. They also need to do some maintenance on their vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Madalena

texts.pt:
Madalena Massepula nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique tem 53 anos de idade viuva e mãe de 2 filhos de 36 e 32 anos de idade que já constituíram suas famílias. Não estudou porque os pais não tinham condições e abandonaram na e cresceu na casa dos avós. 
Vive na casa própria e não sustenta ninguém seus filhos já são maiores de idade.
Nunca sai de cidade onde nasceu. Tem um negocio próprio há mais de 35 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 3.200.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e tem ajuda dos seus filhos. Poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BARCLAYS).
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seu irmã que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 7º empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimentos, chapas de zinco e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção sua casa. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 6.000.00mt, 5.000.00mt, 6.000.00mt, 7.000.00, 10.200.00mt e 10.600.00mt todos para a mesma actividade.
No futuro deseja solicitar mais empréstimos para a conclusão da sua obra.
texts.en:
Madalena Massepula was born in Boane District, Maputo Province, in Southern Mozambique. She is 53 years old, a widow, and the mother of two children who are 36 and 32 years old, and who already have their own families. She never studied because her parents were without means, and left her to be raised by her grandparents. She lives in her own home, and has no other dependents since her children are already adults. Madalena never left the city where she was born. She has owned her own shop for more than 35 years. She has no employees, and earn around 3200 MZN per month, which she uses for household expenses along with help from her children. She saves a little in her (Barclay's) bank account. She has never taken out loans through other banks, and learned about Hluvuku through her sister who is also a client of the organization. This is her 7th loan, in the amount of 10,000 MZN, that she plans to use to purchase construction materials (cement, galvanized roofing, and others) to continue building her house. The earlier loans were for 6,000, 5,000, 6,000, 7,000, 10,200 and 10,600 MZN, all for the same purpose. In the future she wishes to apply for further loans to complete her work.

Translated from Portuguese by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials (cement, galvanized roofing, others)

loans.name: United Family Group

texts.en:
Wesseh T. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called United Family.  He is 38 years old, single, and has three children who range from 8 to 1 and a half years old.  Wesseh was unable to attend school due to poverty.

For three years, Wesseh has been selling torchlights and batteries.  His business is located on Broad Street in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. He started his business with 1,800 Liberian dollars and now has an operating capital of 8,000 Liberian dollars. He says that customers get attracted to his business because of the quality goods he offers. 

Wesseh's dream is to move from selling on the street into a big shop in the future.  He plans to use his 9,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 45,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more torchlights and batteries for his business.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Wesseh is the one holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more torchlights and batteries.

loans.name: Maguette

texts.fr: Maguette D. est une femme de 26 ans elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de MONTAGNE-SUD depuis le 28 mars 2008 et a 3 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit et n'a jamais eu de difficulté lors de ses remboursements. Elle a fait de belles performances dans le Banc Villageois par rapport à son niveau d'épargne au bout d'un an et demi. Elle est vendeuse de légumes et de poisson frais, son nouveau prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité en augmentant sa quantité d'achat de légumes et de poissons frais. Ainsi elle pourra augmenter ses revenus financier et prétendre participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Maguette D. is a 26-year-old woman, married, and the mother of three children.  She has been a member of the Banc Villageois de MONTAGNE-SUD since March 28, 2008.  She has benefited from a loan three consecutive times and has never had problems when repaying.  She has a great record at the Banc Villageois relative to her level of savings after a year and a half.  Maguette sells vegetables and fresh fish.  She will thus be able to increase her revenues and aspire to take part in improving her family's living conditions. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying and selling vegetables and fresh fish

loans.name: Akhmadaga

texts.en: Akhmadaga A. is a 57-year-old man who has been breeding cattle in the small village of Sabirabad since 1988. Akhmadaga is married and has four children who are grown adults. He sells cattle to the local butcher shops and residents. He has applied for a 1000 AZN loan to purchase two cattle and fodder. Akhmadaga has already successfully completed his first loan from AqroInvest through KIVA and he wants to state his appreciation to everyone who supported his business.

loans.use: to purchase two cattle and fodder

loans.name: Mrs. Oeun Sem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
In Prek They village in Kandal province a group of eight people have selected Mrs. Oeun S. as a village bank president. They all will use a small piece of the loan for different purposes to improve the condition their businesses. 

Mrs. Oeun Sun is 59 years old. She is a mother of three children, two of whom are seamstresses in garment factory, while the other is attending a local public school.  She and her husband, Mr. Lang S., are farmers own a small piece of the land to grow crops to sell to support their family. 

Now they have some problems because their field has infertile soil and it is far away from irrigation. So to improve production, Mrs. Oeun S. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Zamier Group

texts.en: Sultan Bibi is the leader of Zameir Group. She lives in District 1 in the city of Jalalabad. She is 60 years old and married with 4 children. She runs a business making quilts. Currently her husband has some financial problems; therefore, she wants to take out a loan to purchase some rolls of cloth, cotton and thread to sew quilts to sell to receive a good income in order to support her husband and children. She would like to thank both AFS and Kiva lenders for their effective process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: to purchase some rolls of cloth, cotton and thread to sew quilts

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet  lives in the Kyebando neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has four children who are in school. She does not take care of any additional family members. She lives in a home that she rents which does not have access to electricity nor piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

Juliet has a business selling retail goods at the market, she sells good like sugar, match box,bars of soap and packets of salt and has been in this business for six years. She works five days out of every week. She is requesting a loan of 150,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to increase her  stock buy buying cartons of salt, boxes of soap and  big packets of match box. 

The main business challenges for Juliet include transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to invest more capital in her business and gain more profit for her family. 


About MCDT SACCO:
This loan is administered by MCDT SACCO, a savings and credit institution that uses the Grameen Bank model of solidarity lending. MCDT's cooperative structure also affords clients the opportunity to own shares of the organization and benefit from its financial performance.

The mission of MCDT SACCO is to provide sustainable financial services to the lower strata of Uganda's poor, especially women, for their economic and social development. For more on MCDT SACCO, please see our partner page, and join our lending team, Friends of MCDT SACCO.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of salt, boxes of soap,half abag of sugar and packets of match box

loans.name: Unidos Para Vencer 3 Group

texts.en:
Yamirkys is the coordinator of her group Unidos para vencer 3 (Unite to succeed). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her child. She says that her most difficult challenges are to work hard in her new project she just started and improve it (it is a small private school). In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying teaching others.

Yamirkys is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She has had her business for four months, starting with some savings. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying paints and other stuff to remodel the structure. She will use the profits to buy a bed and invest in the school by saving. Her dreams are to become a professional in education and improve her business until the project is a success.
 
This Esperanza associate began with us because she needed funds to continue investing in the school so her dreams could come true, She said 'I thought though Esperanza I can achieve and I can be more productive and be a bless to others' and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production, the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To remodel the school structure

loans.name: Benedicto

texts.es: Benedicto, de 40 años, vive en su casa que es propia, junto a su hijo Elio de12 años, habitan en una tranquila localidad de la sierra central del Perú. Este hombre trabajador se dedica a las labores agrícolas desde muy joven, y con el transcurrir de los años aprendió todas las técnicas necesarias para obtener una buena producción, es por eso que en la actualidad siembra arvejas y papa. Cuida con esmero sus cultivos, y luego de un tiempo recoge toda su producción de calidad, y lo traslada hasta el mercado mayorista de su ciudad donde la comercializa a buenos precios, que le permiten obtener una buena calidad de vida. Lo que no le gusta es que muchas veces trabaja solo, porque su hijo estudia, aunque le ayuda en lo que puede, pero cuando es tiempo de cosecha contrata los servicios de operarios que le facilitan la labor. Como es un hombre emprendedor tiene grandes planes para el futuro, y uno de ellos es sembrar en mayor cantidad para mejorar sus ganancias, además quiere comprar algunas cabezas de reses. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP, y esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando, y también esta muy satisfecho con el desempeño de su grupo, pues esta integrado por personas responsables y solidarias. Benedicto tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de semilla de arveja y abono, pues necesita mejorar su producción para la siguiente siembra.
texts.en:
Benedicto is 40 years old and lives in his own home with his twelve year old son Elio. His house is located in a peaceful town in the central mountains of Peru. This hardworking gentleman has been farming since he was a young man. Over the years he learned the necessary techniques that would help him achieve good production. Benedicto currently grows peas and potatoes. He looks after his crops with great care and takes his entire harvest to the wholesale market in the city, where he is able to sell his products at good prices. This enables him to achieve a good quality of life. What he dislikes the most is working alone because his son is in school, although he tries to help whenever he can. During the harvest season, he hires laborers to help facilitate the work. Being an entrepreneur, he has great plans for the future, one of them being planting in larger quantities so that he can generate more income. In addition, Benedicto would like to acquire a few heads of cattle.

This is his fourth loan with MFP. Benedicto is extremely grateful to everyone who made this loan possible because it will allow him to continue working. He is also very pleased with the accomplishments of his group since the members are responsible individuals who are supportive of one another. Benedicto plans to invest the money in the purchase of several sacks of seeds for planting peas, as well as compost, so that he can improve his production for the next planting.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sacks of compost & seeds for planting peas

loans.name: Uranchimeg

texts.en:
Uranchimeg G. is 41 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in Hovd province in western Mongolia. She and her family live in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her older daughter attends a university while her younger daughter goes to a local secondary school. Her husband is a craftsman who makes various kinds of wood products.

 Uranchimeg operates a firewood-selling business with the help of her husband at a local market in her town. She started her business as a local coal and firewood market in 2003. She purchases her firewood from the same local market where she resells it so there are no transportation costs. She also began another business in May of this year where she sells used clothing. Her firewood sales increase during winter time.

 She is a friendly and hardworking person who says "I hope to one day save up enough money to expand my used clothing business." Uranchimeg is requesting a 700,000 MNT loan to purchase more wood and coal at wholesale prices to sell for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase more wood and coal

loans.name: Efelia

texts.en: Efelia R. is from the village of Flores, Naguillan, Isabela. She is 31 years old. Efelia is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Efelia sells fish in the local community. Efelia has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 1,400 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Efelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Efelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Efelia is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Efelia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Solecitos De Nopalillo Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama “Solecitos de Nopalillo” ya que en la región, el principal cultivo es nopal y tuna y, solecitos, porque en el amanecer se refleja el nacimiento de un nuevo día y la esperanza de una nueva cosecha. 
La foto fué tomada en la casa de la Sra. Patricia López V., integrante  del grupo el cual está ubicado en Hidalgo y vemos hacia atrás parte de la comunidad. Patricia se dedica a la venta de zapato por catalogo desde hace dos años, tiene 42 años de edad, estudio la primaria y es casada con tres hijos.
Solicita su préstamo para la compra de zapato, y se siente alegre al momento de solicitar su préstamo pues así podrá tener una gama más amplia de modelos y adquirir nuevos catálogos, espera algún día tener su propio local y ofrecer un mejor nivel de vida a su familia.
Las otras integrantes son:
Nicolasa Hernández C.	Venta de chalupas
Lina Castelán H.	Venta de artesanías
Carmelita A. A.	Venta de  Fuller
Ofelia León V.	        Venta de bisutería
Ángela López V.	        Venta de calzado
Patricia López V. 	Venta de calzado
Yesenia M. L.	        Venta de chalupas
Amada V. C.	        Venta de tamales
A. C. G.	Venta de Stamhome
Miriam López M.  	Venta de calzado
Erika A. H. 	Venta de calzado
Silvia H. V. 	Venta de dulces
texts.en:
This group is called “Solecitos de Nopalillo” (Little Cactus Suns) because the main crop in the region is cactus and prickly pears and “solecitos” because every dawn means new hope for a good harvest.

The photo was taken at Mrs. Patricia López V’s house, a group member, located in Hidalgo; we can see part of the community in the rear of the photo.  Patricia has sold catalogue shoes for the past two years.  She is 42 years old, finished elementary school, is married and has three children.

She is asking for funds to buy shoes.  At the moment of requesting the loan she is happy because she will be able to acquire a wide variety of styles and new catalogues.  She hopes someday to have her own store and offer a better standard of living for her family.

The other group members are:

Nicolasa Hernández C.		Chalupa (typical snack in central México) sales
Lina Castelán H.		Crafts Sales
Carmelita A. A.		Fuller brand cosmetics sales
Ofelia León V.			Costume Jewelry sales
Ángela López V.	        		Shoe sales
Patricia López V. 		Shoe sales
Yesenia M. L.	        		Chalupa (typical snack in central Mexico) sales
Amada V. C.	        		Tamales sales
A. C. G.		Stanhome brand catalogue sales
Miriam López M.  		Shoe sales
Erika A. H. 		Shoe sales
Silvia H. V. 		Candy sales

loans.use: To buy shoes.

loans.name: Aura Rosa

texts.es: Aura Rosa, habitante de  Nva Guinea,  es una mujer muy trabajadora y progresiva, su familia esta conformada por su esposo y 1 hijo de 18 meses de edad, su esposo trabaja como conductor de camion recibiendo ingresos mensuales que constribuyen al bienestar del hogar y de la familia; Aura tiene establecido su pequeño negocio de pulperia el que es su principal actividad economica, esta solicitando su primer credito para imcrementar el inventario de su pulperia y diversificar los tipos de productos ofertados, de manera que pueda brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y que su negocio sea mas rentable y asi poder tener oportunidades de crecer a nivel economico, espera ser beneficiada con el fondo KIVA para poder hacer realidad su sueño, en su comunidad la consideran como, una persona responsable y trabajadora.
texts.en: Aura Rosa lives in Nva Guinea. She is a hardworking, progressive woman. Her family consists of her husband and an 18 month old son. Her husband works as a truck driver and receives a monthly salary which contributes to the well being of the family and the home. Aura has started a small grocery business which is her primary economic activity. She is requesting her first loan to increase her inventory and diversify the types of products that she offers so that she can offer a better service to her customers and make her business more profitable. In this way, she will have opportunities to increase her economic standing. She hopes to receive the KIVA loan so that she can realize her dream. In her community, she is considered to be a responsible and hardworking person.

loans.use: To buy goods for her business

loans.name: Enhbadrah

texts.en: Enhbadrah L. is 46 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the traditional nomadic housing tent. His wife works as a nurse at the children's hospital and their oldest son is a college student. Enhbadrah started his business in raw-materials trading, then he changed it to trousers selling. He owns a stall at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market, where he operates his business. Once or twice a month he purchases his goods from China. Enhbadrah wants his children to get a good education. He is requesting a 2,000,000 Mongolian tugriks loan to purchase more goods.

loans.use: To purchase more goods

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah B. lives in the single neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 3 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (twin brother’s children).   

Sarah has a business of a retail shop selling cosmetics.  She has been in this business for 6 years, and she works 6 days out of every week.   Sarah   sells her products at the market, by means of retail.   

Sarah has requested for a loan of 500000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cosmetics and cream relaxers.  The main business challenges for Sarah include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and also start  importing cosmetics.    

Sarah lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and cream relaxers for resale

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa A. sells Fante kenkey (fermented corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves) in Elmina. She is divorced, has four children and is responsible for the well-being of her home. Her loan will be used to buy more maize to prepare kenkey for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more maize to prepare kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Rosa Haydee

texts.es:
Doña Rosa, una señora trabajadora D. 57 años D. edad, resiD. en Jiquilisco departamento D. Usulután, vive con su esposo y un nieto, ella se dedica a la venta D. mariscos, tiene ya 17 años D. dedicarse a esta actividad, este negocio lo aprendió desD. niña pues se creció en una isla cercana a Jiquilisco.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra D. mariscos ya que desea tener más producto a disposición D. los clientes ya que en este tiempo D. navidad las ventas tienden a aumentar, con esta ayuda podrá ofrece variedad D. mariscos frescos y tendrá la oportunidad D. ver que sus ventas aumenten y recibir mejores ingresos.
Las aspiraciones D. ella, es aumentar sus ventas, para poder ayudar a su familia con mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Rosa is a hard-working, 57 year-old lady.  She lives in Jiquilisco, in Usulután department, with her husband and a grandchild.  Her business is selling seafood.  She has been in this business for 17 years now.  She learned the business as a young girl because she grew up on an island near Jiquilisco.

Rosa is requesting a loan to buy seafood since she would like to have more available for her customers as her sales tend to increase over the Christmas period.  With this help, she will be able to offer a variety of fresh seafood and she will have the opportunity to see her sales increase and to make more income.

Rosa's aspiration is to increase her sales so that she can help her family by providing more income.

loans.use: To buy seafood

loans.name: Donatha

texts.en: Donatha owns a business selling food crops. She is 36 years old and married with 4 children aged between 2 and 13 years old. Her husband works as a soldier. Donatha has been selling food crops for 10 years. She decided to request this loan to buy more peanuts, sorghum, wheat flour, millet and soybeans to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to increase her sales. She would like to be a supplier of these food crops in the future.

loans.use: to buy more food crops to sell

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe B. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 43 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Fe owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in her local community. Fe has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2000, Fe joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to purchase additional fish to sell. Fe is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her eighth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ibrahima Bao

texts.fr: Monsieur Ibrahima Bao T. habite à Camberene. Il est d’abord électricien. Ensuite il évolue dans le secteur de l’élevage. Il capitalise une expérience  de 5 ans dans ses  activités. Il est membre du guichet de Camberene depuis aout 2009. Il sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs destiné à l’achat de bétail afin de démarrer une nouvelle campagne. Ce financement lui permettra d’accroitre ses revenus et de mieux gérer ses  besoins personnels.
texts.en: Mr. Ibrahima Bao T. lives in Camberene. First, he is an electrician. In addition, he raises livestock. He has five years of experience in his work. He has been a member of the Camberene branch since August 2009. He is seeking a loan of 100,000 of West African Francs in order to purchase livestock and start a new cycle. This loan will allow him to increase his revenues and better provide for his needs.

loans.use: Increasing business capital

loans.name: José Ramón

texts.es:
En el municipio de Granada, Departamento de Granada, labora el señor José Ramón A. L. , el cual tiene 3 años de laborar como Fontanero en una empresa ubicada en la misma zona. Es acompañado solo depende cuatro personas del cual está compuesto su núcleo familiar.

Actualmente tiene la necesidad de realizar mejoramiento de vivienda en su casa de habitación y por tal razón visita las oficinas de CEPRODEL para realizar dicho mejoramiento, considera que de esta forma estará dándole un hogar digno a su familia ya que quiere que ellos crezcan saludablemente.
texts.en:
José Ramón A. L. works in the municipality of Granada, located in the department of Granada. He has been working for three years as a plumber in a business located in this zone. He is married, with four people making up his family unit. 

Currently, he needs to realize the improvement of the house in which he resides and for this reason he visits the offices of CEPRODEL to be able to realize this improvement. He believes that in this manner he will be giving his family a decent home because he wants them to grow up healthy.

loans.use: Housing improvement.

loans.name: Feruza

texts.ru: Очелдиева Феруза проживает в районе Шахритус. Ей 41 год. Она замужем. Имеет 4 детей. У нее среднее образование. Она более 5 лет занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Она разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит просит для закупа скота. Феруза хочет расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en: Feruza O. lives in the Shahrituz district.  She is 41 years old, married and has 4 children.  She has a secondary education.  Feruza has been involved in animal husbandry for over 5 years.  She breeds livestock at home for future sale.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of livestock.  Feruza wants to expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba K. sells provisions and food items at Korfofordo near Jukwa in Cape Coast.  Araba has a junior high educational background. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a mason. Her business is just a year old, so she needs a loan to expand her provision business. She adds her income to that of her husband to settle the household expenditures. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Tiessiri, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 41 ans, 3 enfants et vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Wakoro, préfecture de Dioïla ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de savon, de l’arachide, de condiments et des tubercules.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Tiessiri sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire. 
MARIAM B. compte acheter deux sacs de savon local avec les fabricants du village et les environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes à la maison et au marché, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  70 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce de savon.
texts.en: The women of the Tiessiri group, all married, are 41 years old and have 3 children on average, and all live in expanded traditional families in the Wakoro village, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through parental, neighborhood and friendship ties.  They sell soap, peanuts, spices and tubers.  The women of the Tiessiri group are on their fourth group loan.  Mariam B. expects to buy two bags of local soap from the producers of the village and surrounding areas.  She makes her sales from her home and at the market, for cash and credit, to a customer base made up of men and women.  She plans to make an average monthly profit of 70,000 FCFA which will be used to make loan payments and contributions to social ceremonies, while the rest will be reinvested in her soap business.

loans.use: to purchase soap.

loans.name: Madame

texts.es: Madame tiene 21 años, vive con sus hijos pequeños en casa de sus padres. El trabajo que realiza es la elaboración de prendas tejidas a base de crochet o palillos, desde entonces durante todo el día se dedica a tejer a mano, ella muy tranquila lo realiza en su casa. En este medio año de experiencia ha demostrado talento para tejer, y se ven reflejada en las bellas prendas que elabora, eso le da mucha ventaja ya que sus clientes solicitan de dichas prendas  y el precio varia de acuerdo al esfuerzo que le dedico cada tejido, así como de los diseños y colores con que están hechos. Se siente muy satisfecha con la actividad que realiza, por ello desea tener un taller de tejidos ya sea de manera artesanal o industrial, y para conseguirlo seguirá trabajando en este rubro con la misma dedicación que siempre pone en su labor. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de pertenecer su pequeño banco comunal que sabe que le servirá bastante para el desarrollo de su negocio, se animó a formar parte de su grupo por recomendación de sus familiares que tiene una experiencia de crédito grupal y agradece a las personas que serán gestoras de su crédito. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de lana al por mayor.
texts.en:
Madame is 21 years old and lives with her young children in her parents' home.  Her business is crocheting and knitting clothes.  She spends all day knitting by hand and is very relaxed carrying out her work at home.  In the six months she has been in this line of work she has shown a talent for knitting which is reflected in the beautiful clothes that she makes.  This is of benefit to her as customers request her clothes and the price varies in accordance with the effort that she puts into each item as well as the designs and colors of the items.

Madame feels very satisfied with the work that she does and would like to own a knitting workshop where she can either hand knit or machine knit.  In order to achieve this, she will continue working with the same commitment that she always puts into her work.

This is Madame's first loan from MFP and she is very happy to belong to her small community bank because she knows that it will be useful to her in making progress in her business.  She joined her group on the recommendation of some family members who have experience with group loans.  She is grateful to the people who will help to fund her loan.  She will use the loan that she is requesting to buy yarn wholesale.

loans.use: to buy yarn wholesale

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Phan S., age 44, is married and resides in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean Temples.  S. and her husband sell grilled chickens and bread, earning an income of about 5 USD per day.  Each month, the family has to spend 75 USD on food and 15 USD on other necessary expenses.  S. is requesting a loan of 800 USD to purchase cosmetic products for her children to resell.  This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products for her children to resell

loans.name: Vann

texts.en:
Vann S. is a 40-year-old woman who lives in Siem Reap province. She doesn’t have a life partner as she divorced from her husband years ago. 

She sells meat in a small kiosk along the street for earning a profit. Vann S. has been running her selling business since 2003, and she has a lot of regular customers who come to buy her meats in her wooden kiosk. 

Vann S. is now running her business very well because she sells her meats at reasonable prices and she also has good communication while selling. 

In order to increase her income, Vann S. seeks a US $500 loan to purchase additional meats to sell.

loans.use: to purchase additional meat to sell.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es: Haydee tiene 22 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo en casa de sus padres. Hace más de 2 años que se dedica a la venta de animales, en donde los alimenta en un tiempo determinado hasta alcanzar el peso que necesita para ser vendidos. Por tanto siempre cuida de u alimentación así como de su aseo, ya que tiene que limpiar cada cierto tiempo su establo. Para ella es muy importante estos cuidados por que sino podría sufrir perdidas de sus animales y eso le da desventaja en el negocio. Al margen de su actividad, no descuida su hogar ni sus hijos. Ella pide su ayuda para que pueda intensificarse en la ganadería y así obtener una estabilidad económica. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, considera que los consejos que le dan su grupo comunal le han enseñado a ser mas prudente en sus gastos, y por tal esta agradecida por la confianza que le han dado. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en compra de carneros.
texts.en: Haydee is 22 years old. She lives with her husband and son in her parents' house. For more than two years, she has been dedicated to selling animals, for which she feeds them for a set time until they reach the weight required to be sold. So she always takes care of feeding and cleaning them since she has to clean the barn from time to time. For her, this care is very important since without it she could suffer losses of animals and this would be a disadvantage for her business. Besides this work, she does not neglect her home or her children. She is requesting your help so she may expand her livestock and obtain economic stability. This is her second loan with MFP. She considers that the tips that her community group have given her have taught her to be more prudent in her expenses and she is thankful for the confidence they have given her. With the loan she is requesting, she will invest in the purchase of rams.

loans.use: to purchase more rams.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is 51 years old and married. She has 6 children. Lucita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy piglets and feeds. Lucita has been raising pigs for 4 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lucita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feeds.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La Sra Lidia, casada con el señor Rody quien es también de profesión comerciante, ellos  tienen una hija en edad escolar. La misma vive en una casa de alquiler, hace ya 12 años.
Es comerciante y se dedica a comprar y vender ropas nuevas y seminuevas, que adquiere por fardos y los trae de la ciudad de Foz de Iguazu(Brasil, también compra en su domicilio, su esposo cuenta con vehículo  propio y también realiza las ventas en forma ambulante por los distintos barrios de Asunción y por el interior del país.
Al principio sólo utilizaban su propio capital el cual era muy pequeño, eso impedía que pudieran acceder a comprar muchas mercaderías, entonces un día conversando con una vecina quien ya es cliente de la Fundación, esta le recomendó acudir a la Fundación para que pueda retirar un crédito y de esa manera invertir en su pequeño negocio.
