Siguió el ejemplo de su amiga y desde entonces  ha mejorado su nivel de ingreso, accede a mejores precios de costos, y actualmente está  inviertiendo en una nuevo proyecto que es la compra de medicamentos para venderlos en las despensas, aprovechando la venta en forma ambulante que realiza su esposo.
Con el credito podra mejorar la calidad sus mercaderias y poder obtener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Lidia is married to Rody, and they are both merchants.  They have a school-age daughter.  They have lived in a rented house for 12 years.

She buys and sells new and gently used clothes.  She gets them in bundles, and she gets them in the city of Foz de Iguazu, Brasil.  She also buys at home.  Her husband has his own vehicle and also sells in an itinerant manner in the different neighborhoods in Asunción and in the interior of the country.

At first they only used their own capital, which was very little.  This stopped them from being able to buy a lot of merchandise.  Then, one day she was talking to a neighbor who is a client of the Fundación.  The neighbor recommended that she turn to the Fundación in order to be able to take a loan as a way of investing in her small business. 

She followed her friend’s example, and from then on she has improved the level of her income.  She has access to better prices, and she is currently investing in a new project.  The project is the purchase of medications to sell at pantries.  This will be taking advantage of her husband’s itinerant manner of selling.

With the loan she will be able to improve the quality of her merchandise, and she will be able to get more income.

loans.use: to buy clothes in order to improve her stock, and to offer a greater variety of merchandise.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is 37 years old and lives in Lopoc, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 5 children. Jocelyn has a business selling snacks, earning about PHP 1,500 each month. Jocelyn has a requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase raw ingredients to prepare her snacks. Jocelyn has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Jocelyn would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snacks

loans.name: Quyen

texts.en:
Quyen, a 30-year-old married woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a truck driver. Quyen earns an income to support her family by operating a general store in front of her house. The products that Quyen sells include shampoo, toothpaste, and snack foods. She has been running her store for 10 years.

Quyen requires a loan to repair her store and purchase more basic products, such as toiletries and snack foods, to stock her store and offer a better range of products to her customers. She hopes that will permit her to earn more income and save money for family emergencies.

loans.use: to repair her general store and purchase basic goods to stock the store

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida, who is 49 years old, is from the province of Isabela. Imagine Isabela as a place of several hills, streams and lakes, which are still present as the remains of a broken ecology. Aida is married and owns a sari-sari store (community-based store) as it is commonly called in their bario (village). .

Aida started working with one of her sister's stores. She closed her business and so Aida decided to set herself to pursuing the business. She happily enjoyed doing the business and now is making gradual progress. She works alone in her store from 8 in the morning until 10 in the evening retailing food products. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy products like spices and soft drinks to sell in her store. With the help of this loan, she will do her best to improve her income. In the future, she would like to finish building her stall for more convenience to her customers.

loans.use: to buy products like spices and soft drinks to sell in her store.

loans.name: Blanca Libia

texts.es:
Blanca es una mujer emprendedora que tras su separación se dio a la tarea de trabajar como independiente para salir adelante, desde entonces se ha dedicado a la venta de comidas rápidas fuera de su casa, lo que hasta ahora le ha permitido cubrir los gastos del hogar. 

Actualmente Blanca necesita de un préstamo para comprar algunos insumos como salsas, carnes frías y algunos platos y vasos desechables para vender sus productos, así podrá ofrecer mayor variedad y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Blanca is an enterprising woman, who following her separation took on the task of working for herself in order to move ahead in life.  Since then, she has worked selling fast food from her home, which so far has allowed her to cover her household expenses.

Currently, Blanca needs a loan to buy several supplies, such as sauces, cold meats, and several disposable plates and cups for selling her products.  In this way she will be able to offer more variety and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as sauces, cold meats and disposable plates and cups.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol nació en la ciudad de Urubamba (Cusco, Perú) y tiene 30 años de edad. Ella tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo. Actualmente, ella vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. Ella se dedica a la venta de chicharrones de pollo y su puesto de venta está ubicado frente a su casa ósea en la calle. Ella sale a vender a las 6 de la tarde y se recoge a las 9 de la noche. Ya son seis meses que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al esfuerzo que pone en su trabajo. Ella también tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio donde vende productos de primera necesidad. El crédito que requiere Marisol es para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo bolsas de arroz, bolsas de azúcar y pollo. 

El Banco Comunal “Señor de los Milagros de Urubamba” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad de Urubamba (Cusco, Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Marisol was born in the city of Urubamba (Cusco, Peru). She is 30 years old. She has a common-law husband, with whom she has one child. She currently lives in the same city where she was born, and she also carries out her economic activities there. She works selling fried pieces of chicken, and her sales stand is located on the street in front of her house. She goes out to sell at 5 in the evening, and she packs up at 9 at night. She has operated this business for six months already, and it is going very well for her, thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She also has a small grocery store in her home, where she sells basic necessities. The loan which Marisol needs is to buy merchandse such as bags of rice, bags of sugar, and chicken.  

The communal bank “Señor de los Milagros de Urubamba” ["Lord of the Miracles of Urubamba"] meets every thirty days in the city of Urubamba (Cusco, Peru). Cusco is known as an area with a lot of tourism and business; it is also well-known for its traditional festival of Inti Raymi, and because one of the seven wonders of the world, Machu Picchu, is found here.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as bags of rice, bags of sugar, and chicken.

loans.name: Vilma Del Carmen

texts.es:
Vilma, vive con su esposo, no tienen hijos, ella se dedica a la administración D. una tienda, donD. ofrece productos D. consumo, el cual lo tiene desD. hace 5 años con la ayuda D. su esposo.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra D. mercadería, aceite, huevos, pan, detergentes, gaseosas, jugos, mejorar el inventario comprando D. los productos que son demandados por los clientes.
El objetivo D. Vilma es que su tienda perdure por mucho tiempo, mejorarla cada día, que la condición económica D. su familia también mejore.
texts.en:
Vilma lives with her husband, and doesn't have children.  She runs a store, where she sells products for daily use.  She has had the business for 5 years, with her husband's help. 

She is applying for a loan to buy merchandise: cooking oil, eggs, bread, detergents, soft drinks, juices; to improve her inventory by buying the products her customers are asking for. 

Vilma's goal is to have her store last a long time, and improve every day; so that her family's finances also improve.

loans.use: To buy merchandise: cooking oil, eggs, bread, detergents, soft drinks, juices.

loans.name: Mwandege Group

texts.en:
Arafa is in her early 30s, married, and has one child who attends school. She has been a tailor since 2002.  She works from 9 a.m to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Arafa's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to purchase more sewing items for her business. Her dream is to one day be able to fully take care of herself and her family.

Arafa will share this loan with her loan group, which has a total of 21 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to purchase more sewing items.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha  de 34 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Desde hace dos años aproximadamente Bertha se ha dedicado a la venta de abarrotes (todo tipo de productos que se utilizan diariamente como: leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, huevos) frutas,v erduras y bebidas, su negocio lo ha colocado en su misma casa para su seguridad, con las ganancias por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos familiares.

Para poder  implementar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 500 nuevos soles para comprar más mercaderías para abastecer su negocio, con el único ideal de que su negocio se amplie y tenga más productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes;  con el dinero que gane podrá cubrir su préstamo y sus obligaciones de su casa.  Bertha es una persona dedicada y trabajadora que se preocupa por tener más comodidades en su hogar para su familia.
texts.en:
Bertha is 34 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and children. The only service they receive is electricity. Bertha resides in the rural section of the District of Tambogrande in the Department of Piura. This area is known for having businesses involving farming, livestock breeding, and handicrafts.

For approximately two years, Bertha has been selling groceries of all types that are used on a daily basis such as milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna, and eggs. She also sells fruits, vegetables, and beverages. Her business is located in her home for her own safety. The income from selling her products is used to cover all of the family expenses.

To keep her business in operation, Bertha is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 PEN in order to buy more merchandise to restock her business. Her only ideal is to see her business grow and have more products to offer to her customers. The money she earns will cover her loan and her household obligations. Bertha is a dedicated and hardworking woman who is concerned about having a more comfortable home for her family.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to restock her business.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet, 40 years of age, is married and thankful because they had been blessed with one child. She has been operating a retail store in their village for almost four years. Her monthly income is 1,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) and she is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase bread, coffee, sugar, canned goods, instant noodles and soft drinks to sell. 

She hopes to further expand her business to generate higher profits and to sustain her family's daily needs. She would like to continue taking out loans and hopes that Kiva lenders will extend their assistance to her in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bread, coffee, sugar, canned goods, instant noodles and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en: Oyunchimeg is 43 years old and lives with her husband and three kids in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her husband is a herder, her elder two kids are college students, and the younger one is a student. She sews at home. She sews deel, a Mongolian traditional clothing, and t-shirts. After joining a sewing group in 2009, not only has her income increased, but she has also learned to sew a long range of products. Now that her demand is high, she needs to buy new machinery in order to increase the speed and quality. She is requesting 400,000 MNT to buy new sewing machinery.

loans.use: To buy new sewing machinery

loans.name: Ezra

texts.en: Ezra is a 35-year-old man married with three children living in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to educate his children and have a sound business. He has been a coffee dealer for the last 12 years and has progressed despite the challenge of coffee price fluctuations. Ezra needs the loan to buy coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy coffee to sell.

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.es: El señor Victoriano  que actualmente es solicitante nació  en la comunidad Qollpa del Municipio de Pocona a 150 Km al sur de la ciudad de Cochabamba, viven con su esposa que cuenta con una vivienda rustica con paredes de adobe y techo de calamina. La actividad a que se dedica el solicitante es la agricultura que produce los siguientes productos papa, maíz, haba y cereales, las siembras realizan en la parcelas heredades de sus padres de esposo/a. El presente crédito está solicitando para comprar los insumos agrícolas para mejorar sus ingresos en los próximos años y de esa manera obtener la calidad de viva en su familia, como semillas y abono.
texts.en: Victoriano who currently is a borrower was born in the community of Qollp in Pocona Municipality 150 kilometers south of the city of Cochabamba.  He lives with his wife in a rustic abode with adobe walls and a plywood roof.  He is a potato, corn, lima bean and cereal farmer.  He plants on land inherited from his and his wife’s parents.  The loan he’s asking for at present is to buy farm supplies like seeds and manure to improve income in the coming years to obtain quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies, seeds and manure.

loans.name: Séwrou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Séwrou est âgé de 30 ans. Il est marié et père d’un enfant de un an. Il évolue dans le secteur
de la pêche  depuis 10 ans. C’est une activité qu’il a hérité de son père. Mais il est très intéressé par l’aspect lucratif de l’activité ce  qui lui permet d’assurer la survie de sa famille. Il est sociétaire  du guichet de la localité ou il habite depuis septembre 2010. Il sollicite un crédit de 100 000 prévu pour l’agrandissement de sa pirogue. Ce financement pourra donc  l’aider  a accroitre ses recettes et  améliorer le bien être  de sa famille.
texts.en:
Monsieur Séwrou is 30 years old. He is married and has a one-year-old child. He has been working in the fishing industry for 10 years. He inherited this business activity from his father. He is particularly interested in the lucrative aspect of the business, on which his family survives. 
 
Monsieur Séwrou has been a member of the local branch of UIMCEC since September 2010. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 XOF to enlarge his canoe.  This funding could help him to increase his income and improve the well being of his family.

loans.use: to enlarge his canoe.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima is a married woman with 12 children, all of whom are adults. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past ten years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. Mwanalima dreams of establishing another business of selling clothes and shoes in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase stock for her retail shop: bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock for retail shop: bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Chyngyz

texts.ru: Чынгыз  36-летний фермер. Чынгыз, как младший сын, согласно кыргызским традициям,  живет со своими престарелыми родителями и заботится о них. В поисках  средств дохода для своей семьи, в 2007 году Чынгыз начал свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве. Благодаря упорству и настойчивости Чынгыза, его хозяйство на сегодняшний день насчитывает 30 голов баранов и 6 голов коров, приносящее около 9,000 сом (KGS)в месяц от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов. Также, он обрабатывает 1 га земли, где выращивает фасоль и многолетние травы. В сезон, Чынгыз предоставляет услуги тракториста во время полевых работ.  В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Чынгыз обратился в компанию «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Чынгыз планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Chyngyz is 36 year-old farmer.  As the youngest son, he lives with his elderly parents and takes care of them, according to the Kyrgyz tradition.  In search of sources of income for this family, Chyngyz started his animal husbandry and farming business in 2007.  Thanks to his tenacity and persistence, his business now has 30 heads of sheep and 6 heads of cattle, yielding about 9,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of dairy and meat products.  He also works on one hectare of land, where he grows beans and multi-year herbs.  Chyngyz also provides tractor driving services for field work during the season.  In order to further increase his livestock headcount, he requested a loan in the sum of 80,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase livestock.  Chyngyz plans to invest the profit from this loan into further increasing his livestock quantities.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto is 52 years old, married and lives in the Philippines. He operates a service-based business providing transportation services to local community member. He has been doing this for three years and earns 5,000 PHP per month from this work. He has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to repair his existing vehicle in order to offer a better service.
In 2011, Alberto joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. In the future, he hopes to gain double his current income from his business and see his children finish their studies.

loans.use: to repair his existing vehicle.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a single man who owns a house with electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees for his siblings. 

Alex has been operating as a vegetable farmer for the past 4 years. He sells vegetables and potatoes from his farm to vegetable grocery owners and to neighbors. He faces a major challenge of seasonality. Alex dreams of owning a big farm in the future.

Alex plans to use this KES 50,000 loan to purchase a water pump and pipes to irrigate his farm. He decided to join Yehu to get capital to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase a water pump and pipes to irrigate his farm.

loans.name: Vasile

texts.en: Vasile is a farmer in the rural Moldovan village of Gradiste, where he is an active community member and strives to be involved in organizations and projects which serve the agricultural sector. He is the director of the local milk-collection cooperative which enables the area’s 75 small milk producers to combine their output and sell it on the regional market. Vasile himself owns three cows and wants to buy a one more now to work towards his goal of seven animals, which will allow him to have a steadier supply of milk, both for his family and for sale. For this he needs a loan.

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Dorice

texts.en:
Dorice is married and has 3 children who are going to school. She started her business in 2000 with funds from her husband. Since then, she received a loan which enabled her to expand her business. She is educated to level 7.

Given the funds, she wants to buy materials to stock her shop and sell both retail and wholesale.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Sayaad Zia

texts.en:
S. Zia lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and he has a retail food shop in the main city of Kabul. He has good experience because he has been a shopkeeper for 10 years.

He wants to take a loan and buy some items for his shop such as newpapers, packets of crisps and packets of sweets. This is important for his shop because there is a rush on newsagents in the city. He wants to expand his business and make good use of this loan. He is sure that he can do it.

loans.use: Expand business by buying new items for sale

loans.name: Soa

texts.en: Mrs. Soa T. is 38 years old and lives with her husband (pictured here because Soa T. was unavailable), and their 7 children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She is a recycler and typically makes about 3 USD per day in income, while her husband is a welder, and can makes up to 10 USD each day, which is a big help for their family’s savings. Currently, her husband needs more tools, and a loan would allow him to service a larger number of clients and customers.

loans.use: To purchase welding tools for her husband to facilitate his business.

loans.name: Abdul Hamid

texts.en: Abdul Hamid lives in district 13 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is a young and single boy. He lives with his father and mother, and he is supporting them. He is a shopkeeper. He has a small mobile shop where he fixes mobile phones and also sells new mobile phones. He wants to expand his business, so he wants to take an individual loan to buy a variety of mobiles to expand his inventory and make a good monthly income for his family.

loans.use: To buy new kinds of mobile phones

loans.name: José Salvador

texts.pt:
José Salvador S., single, father of a young child, has a stand in the Xipmanine market in Maputo, Mozambique where he sells cosmectics and beauty supplies. José has paid previous loans timely and in full, and has seen considerable improvement to his business since he joined the program, in 2005. He plans to use his 5th cycle loan to buy more supplies for his business.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer.

José Salvador S. tem23 anos de idade, é solteiro e pai de um filho. Tem uma banca no mercado Xipamanine e vende diversos produtos de beleza(cosméticos). Entrou para o programa em Setembro de 2005 com um empréstimo inicial de 8.000MT. Vai para o 5º ciclo e pretende um empréstimo de 20.000MT para pagarem em 6 meses. O cliente tem se comportado muito bem no reembolso dos empréstimos e teve um crescimento do negócio considerável.

loans.use: Stock increase

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es:
Rebeca is a single mother of small children to whom she wants to teach the value of education as the best avenue for success. She hopes that when they grow up, they'll be hard-working and successful so that she can be proud of the effort that she's making now to earn enough money to send them to school. With that goal in mind, she began selling clothes to her neighbors and friends and, little by little, she's made herself known.

She recently set up a small space in her house where she can store the clothes that she sells and where her customers can come and buy her merchandise. However, she now has too large a supply of summer clothes which she can't sell because her customers are looking for clothes for the coming winter. Rebeca is applying for a US$525 loan so that she can buy merchandise and have new stocks to offer her customers. With your help, Rebeca will be able to help her children and show that she, a single mother, can provide the things they need.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Rebeca es madre soltera de unos pequeños a quienes ella quiere inculcarles que el estudio es la base del éxito y espera que cuando crezcan sus hijos puedan ser personas trabajadoras y que se superen para así ella senrtirse orgulloza de que todo el esfuerzo que está haciendo ahorita por sacar dinero para mandarlos a estudiar valió la pena. Es por eso que comenzó por vender ropa entre sus vecinos y amigos y poco a poco se fue haciendose conocida.

Actualmente hizo un pequeño espacio en su casa para poder colocar la ropa que vende y así poder tener un lugar en dónde la encuentren y le compren mercancía. Sin embargo actualmente tiene mucha ropa de verano y no puede seguir vendiendo esta mercancía puesto que lo que busca la gente en estos momentos es ropa de invierno y es por esto que Rebeca está solicitando un crédito de US $525 para poder comprar mercancía y así tener novedades para ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Rebeca podrá sacar adelante a sus hijois y demostrarse que ella puede sola con la manutención de sus hijos.

loans.use: Buy seasonal merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Maria  De Jesús

texts.es:
Maria de Jesús began her business selling food in the bus terminal with an initial investment of her life savings of $50.00.

She now has been in this business for 15 and it is necessary to note that the loans from Ceprodel have enabled her to better the conditions of her business, make wholesale purchases of materials that she needs to better the quality of life. Being a single mother this business enables her to support her son.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Maria de Jesús inicia su actividad de venta de comida en la Terminal de buses con los ahorros de toda su vida invirtiendo $50.00 inicialmente.

Actualmente ya tiene 15 años de tener el negocio y es necesario destacar que los financiamientos de CEPRODEL le han permitido mejorar las condiciones de su negocio, la compra al contado de los materiales que necesita así como el mejorar su calidad de vida siendo madre soltera esta actividad le sirve para el sustento de su hijo.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lê Thị Lịch, 57 years old, is a fifth year member of the TYM Fund, branch 14. All her five children are grown up and left home. Now is just her and her husband. Her activities are farming pigs and brewing rice liquor. The combination is a norm for members of this branch. Money from selling liquor is used to pay weekly repayments, byproduct from the brewer is to feed pigs. All are neat and nice. The monthly income is hefty at 200USD. Demands increase as Tết is coming. She would like to apply for a loan of 775USD to buy more rice and few more piglets.

From Wikipedia: Tết Nguyên Đán, more commonly known by its shortened name Tết, is the most important and popular holiday and festival in Vietnam. It is the Vietnamese New Year which is based on the Chinese calendar, a lunisolar calendar. The name Tết Nguyên Đán is Sino-Vietnamese for Feast of the First Morning, derived from the Hán nôm characters 節元旦. In modern Chinese, the characters for Nguyên Ðán (元旦) have evolved to refer to New Year in the Gregorian calendar, that is, January 1.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Lê Thị Lịch, 57 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 5 của Quỹ Tình thương chi nhánh 14 Quảng Xương. 5 người con của chị đều đã trưởng thành và ra ở riêng, trong nhà chỉ có hai vợ chồng. Công việc chính của chị Lịch là nấu rượu và chăn nuôi lợn. Đây là một hình thức mà rất nhiều thành viên vay vốn Quỹ Tình thương áp dụng. Bán rượu để có tiền trả tuần và thu nhập hàng ngày, bã rượu làm thức ăn cho lợn. Hoạt động làm ăn rất có hiệu quả, thu nhập của chị Lịch ở mức 200USD/tháng. Sắp đến Tết âm lịch, nhu cầu của các quán rượu trong vùng tăng cao, chị Lịch bàn với gia đình vay mức vốn 775USD vừa để mua gạo nấu rượu vừa để mua thêm lợn đầu tư chăn nuôi.

loans.use: Buy pigs and rice to brew rice wine

loans.name: Cinthya

texts.es:
Cinthya is a very happy and responsible girl, her parents always dedicated themselves to the buying and selling of red meat in the Túpac Amaru market in the city of Juliaca. Since she was very young Cinthya supported her parents in this business, learning to manage very well and with her happiness and good attention she obtained very good clients. For this reasons she decided to become independent and open her own business of buying and selling meat, always with the unconditional support of her parents. Currently this enterprising girl covers all of her personal expenses and higher education fees with this business. She begins her days at 7 am, studying very enthusiastically in order to better herself. Beginning at noon she goes to the market where she attends to her sales of meat. Thanks to her insistence and diligence she is able to obtain good results. In order to generate greater economic gains she thinks that she must augment her capital, for this proposition she is appealing to your good heart and soliciting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, Kiva Volunteer.

Cinthya, es una muchacha muy alegre y responsable, sus padres siempre se dedicaron a la compra y venta de carnes rojas en el mercado Túpac Amaru de la ciudad de Juliaca, Cinthya desde muy pequeña apoyó a sus padres en dicho negocio, aprendiendo a desenvolverse muy bien y así con su alegría y buena atención fue obteniendo muy buenos clientes, es por ello que decidió independizarse y abrir su propio negocio de compra y venta de carne, siempre con apoyo incondicional de sus padres.Actualmente ésta emprendedora muchacha cubre todos sus gastos personales y de estudios superiores con este negocio, ella durante todos los días desde las 7:00 de la mañana inicia su día cotidiano, acudiendo a estudiar muy entusiasta para buscar su superación personal, a partir del medio día se dirige al mercado donde atiende su puesto de venta de carnes.Gracias a su empeño y su diligencia está logrando obtener buenos resultados, para generar mayores ingresos económicos tiene pensado aumentar el monto de su capital, con ese propósito recurre a tu buen corazón y hace la solicitud de un préstamo.

loans.use: increasing capital in order to increase the amount of products she offers

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel E. is 42 years old. He lives in Benin City; he is married with 5 children. He sells and services gas and electric cookers. He is soliciting for a loan of $875 to buy more gas and electric cookers to sell at his business. He learned how to do this business for a year, and has had his own business since 1993.

loans.use: To buy more gas & electric cookers for sale

loans.name: Bupe

texts.en: Bupe M. is from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania.  She is 32 years old, married, and has two children aged ten and 13.  Bupe also cares for three dependents, who live with her because otherwise they would be street children. In 1998, Bupe established a crops business with the help of SELFINA, an organization that works towards the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through sale and leaseback agreements for small farmers.  She now requires a new loan of $250 in order to buy more stock of crops in bulk.

loans.use: To buy more stock of crops in bulk.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 25 year old father of 1. He lives and works in southern Lebanon, in Saida and owns a coffee shop.

This is the second time he is applying for a loan at A. Majmoua because he needs to buy provisions for his business. The income generated from this investment will help him pay a part of his house payments.

loans.use: To buy provisions

loans.name: Fatmeh's Group

texts.en:
Fatmeh group is composed of four women living in a small village in the Bekaa valley. AmA., 25 years old; Amina, 49 years old; Fatmeh, 34 years old; and Fatmeh, 31 years old, are all married. The 4 women work from their homes selling accessories, sewing, and selling clothes, respectively.

Each of the women are requesting a loan of USD 300 as working capitA. to further expand their business. This loan of USD 1,200 will allow them to generate more revenue for their families and therefore improve their lives. This is the first loan that Fatmeh group is requesting from A. Majmoua.

The young woman wearing a white veil on the picture (second row, first from the left) is the A. Majmoua credit officer who monitors the Fatmeh group.

loans.use: For working capital to generate more income from their home-based businesses

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Ms. Angela A. is single and 49 years old. She has lived in her own home in the Buena Vista Neighborhood for 22 years. She has two adult children, one of them lives in her home, and the other is married and lives with his family. Ms. Angela has owned her own business for the past 15 years, she has a store that has a good amount of various merchandise. She is a client of Fundacion Paraguaya for many years know, she has had many transactions with the institution and states she is very happy with them.

Ms. Angela has asked for a loan to purchase more merchandise for her store such as, flour, bread crumbs, canned good, drinks, herbs, pastas, rice, cleaning and craft supplies and others.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Angela A. es soltera, tiene 49 años, vive en su propia casa que esta situada en el Barrio Buena Vista desde hace ya 22 años.Ella tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad, una de ellas vive en la misma casa y el otro ya esta casado y vive de manera independiente con su familia. La señora Angela es propietaria de su microempresa desde hace 15 años, ella posee una Despensa en donde cuenta con una buena cantidad de mercaedrias de todo tipo. Ella es cliente de la Fundacion Paraguaya desde hace varios años, ha tenido varias operaciones con la Institucion y manifiesta estar muy conforme con la misma.

La señora ha solicitado el credito para la compra de mas mercaderias para su Despensa como ser: harinas, panificados, productos enlatados, bebidas en general, yerbas, fideos, arroz, articulos de limpieza, articulos de merceria y otros.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for her store such as, flour, bread crumbs, canned good, drinks, herbs, pastas, rice, cleaning and craft supplies and others.

loans.name: Sensa

texts.en:
Sensa M., a Tanzanian woman, is a food vender. She lives in Buguruni Mnyaman in Dar-es-Salaam. Her business is located at the Buguruni business market and her customers come from all around the market. She manages to meet her family's daily needs from her business income. 

She needs a loan of $550 to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Nuriyya

texts.en:
Nuriyya, who was born in 1981, is a mother of one child. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan in the town of Fizuli; she is now settled in the village of Bala Bahmanli.

Nuriyya and her husband (who is shown in the picture) have been in the business of breeding sheep for 10 years. Now she needs a loan of $1200 to buy 2 calves.

loans.use: To buy 2 calves

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar baji is the wife of G. M. and lives in a small area named Bund Road of City Lahore, Pakistan. She has been living in this area for the last 20 years. She is the mother of four children: three sons and one daughter. Her elder son completed his education in the 10th standard and has a furniture-making business. The next to him completed his education in the 12th standard and is now working in an office. Her younger son is completing his bachelor’s degree. Her daughter reads in the 12th standard. Kosar baji’s husband runs a hotel in his community. He has been in this business for the last 20 years. He is a well-known person in his community and everybody comes to him for buying food. Particularly, he sells a Punjabi dish (Nan and Channay). Kosar baji herself is a housewife and also helps her husband in making dishes. She is applying for a loan to buy more materials (cooking oil, lentils, vegetables, rice and spices) for her husband’s food business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Rubina baji wants a loan to buy more garments to resell. Sabah baji wants a loan to buy another juicer machine for her juice corner. Naeem baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Nazia baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy materials for her food business

loans.name: Daouda Adama

texts.fr:
Monsieur Daouda Adama C. est un célibataire de 28 ans qui vit avec son enfant, son père, sa mère, ses frères et soeurs  dans une famille traditionnelle dans le quartier Torakabougou de la ville de Bougouni(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Afin de s’insérrer dans la vie économique, le jeune diplômé Daouda opte pour l’achat et la vente de tissus une activité apprise auprès de son frère. Avec une expérience de 10 ans, il maitrise bien cette activité. En manque de moyens financiers conséquents, il décida de faire recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son premier prêt individuel.
Il compte utiliser ce prêt  pour acheter,  8 rouleaux  de tissus et 20 draps de lit  sur commande à partir du  Burkina Faso. Les tissus sont découpés en petits lots pouvant etre utilisé pour confectionner des complets (Chemise et Pantalon) ou des pantalons simples. Réputé pour vendre des tissus de qualité, la clientèle de Monsieur C. ne cesse d’augmenter. La vente se fait à domicile, au niveau des entreprises en détail au comptant et à crédit payable mensuellement à une clientèle  composée de toutes les catégories socilaes. Il envisage d’ouvrir une boutique de vente de tissus de vente de toutes qualités à Bougouni.
texts.en:
Mr. Daouda Adama C. is a single 28-year-old man who lives with his child, his father, his mother, and his brothers and sisters in a traditional family in the Torakabougou area of the city of Bougouni (third administrative region of the republic of Mali). In order to join the working world, the young, educated Daouda has chosen to buy and sell fabric, a business he learned from his brother. With 10 years of experience, he is mastering the trade. Lacking consistent financial means, he decided to seek the aid of microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom he is on his first individual loan. He plans to use this loan to buy 8 bolts of fabric and 20 custom bed sheets in Burkina Faso. The material is cut into small pieces that can be used to make suits (shirts and pants) or ordinary pants. With a reputation for selling quality fabrics, Mr. C.’s clientele hasn’t stopped growing. He sells from his house at retail for cash or credit payable monthly to a clientele that consists of all social groups. He envisions opening a fabric shop in Bougouni.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Cette jeune dame exploite une buvette restaurant tout prés de l'aéroport de Ziguinchor. Avec cette activité, elle gagne sa vie et soutient son mari à entretenir leur petite famille. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour améliorer son restaurant qui est trés fréquenté en cette période de saison touristique.
texts.en:
This young woman runs a pub very near the Ziguinchor airport. Through this business, she earns her living and supports her husband in caring for their small family. She is requesting this loan to improve her restaurant, which is very busy during the current tourist season.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restaurant and pub

loans.name: Maribel De Jesus

texts.es: Maribel esta solicitando su 3cer crédito a AFODENIC para inventirlo en hecharle el piso a la cocina, trabaja como docente en la Escuela Vigarmy Flores en la colonia Rio Plata,  esta profesora todos los dias tiene que madrugar para dejar hecho el desayuno a su hija y a su esposo y despues para viajar a la 66:00 am. a impartir el pan de la enseñanza a niños de esa colonia,  tiene una niña de 10 añitos de edad que estudia su 5to grado de educación primaria, su esposo trabaja en una empresa de cable y comparten con todos los gastos del hogar,  a pesar que son una familia pequeña los dos dependen de un salario bajo, pero son una familia muy unida y responsable; Mariebel actualmente estudia tercer año  en la universidad URACCAN,  su sueño es terminar de construir su vivienda para tener mejor comodidad, trabajo y  salud.
texts.en:
Maribel is asking for her 3rd loan from AFODENIC to invest in installing a floor in her kitchen. She works as a teacher in the Vigarmy Flores School in the Rio Plata neighborhood. Every day she wakes up early to prepare breakfast for her daughter and husband and then leaves at 6 AM to teach the children of the neighborhood. She has a 10 year old daughter who is in 5th grade in elementary school. Her husband works in a cable business and they share the household expenses. In spite of being a small family they are dependent upon low income, but they are a very united and responsible family. Mariebel today is in her third year at the URACCAN university. Her dream is to finish building their home in order to have greater comfort, work and health.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install a floor in her kitchen

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en: Margaret N. is the leader of the Bbogo loan group in Lugazi. She is a very hard working lady and manages her businesses well.  She sells a small silvery fish known as ‘mukene’ that she buys from the fishermen either late at night or very early in the morning depending on the fishing schedule and season.  She then sells these fish to people at the landing site, in the village, and others in Lugazi.  In addition to this business, she makes chapattis for customers for breakfast.  Her sales depend on the weather, on some days she can use up to 1.5 packets of flour.  Lastly, she has a small scale farm. Margaret is requesting a loan to buy more fish to sell and a carton of flour.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell and a carton of flour

loans.name: Soliha

texts.en:
K. Soliha first applied to MicroInvest in 2002 and she recommended herself as a serious and reliable client. Soliha lives in the B. Gafurov region of Tajikistan. She is married with 4 children. Soliha has started the business from scratch and, thanks to previous loans, she improved the business turnover in women's wear and shoes. She also trades fancy goods and women's accessories. She has been engaged in business for 10 years.

Soliha works with direct suppliers so she trades at low prices and has repeat customers. Solha is applying to KIVA with a request for a business support loan of 4100 STJ for 4 months to import new seasonal goods.

loans.use: To import new seasonal good.

loans.name: Abdujabbor

texts.en: Abdujabbor T. first applied to MicroInvest in 2009 and he recommends himself as a reliable business owner who trusts in the MicroInvest loan procedure.  Abdujabbor is married and has 2 children. He lives in the B. Gafurov region of Tajikistan. He has been selling the national Tajik bread named “lepeshky” for 10 years. Abdujabbor is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of 1600 STJ for 6 months. He will use the loan to open a new trade outlet. Abdujabbor thanks KIVA for its support and contribution to the development of small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Opening a new trade outlet

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria es socia del Bancomunal  Las Surcanitas.
Gloria  es conviviente tiene 50 años, no tiene hijos.
Gloria trabajaba  en una empresa vendiendo libros  por muchos años, y con el tiempo se independizó y se puso a vender en  los colegios,  les vende libros para los alumnos  y con una posta médica vende libros para los profesionales que trabajan allí. 
Gloria necesita 1600 soles, para la compra de libros para el colegio.
Desde que está en Finca se siente más tranquila para trabajar, gracias a las charlas tiene un mejor visón de negocio, más optimismo, y  tiene más cuidado para invertir.
El sueño de Gloria es tener una librería.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the Bancomunal Las Surcanitas. She is 50 years old and has no children. Gloria previously worked at a company selling books for many years. After some time, she became independent and started selling books in the schools for the students. She also sells them in the medical clinics for the professionals that work there. Gloria needs 1,600 soles to purchase books for the school. After meeting with Kiva partner Finca, she feels more calm about working and thanks to their discussion, she now has a better business sense, is more optimistic, and is more careful about investing. Gloria dreams of owning a library.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Gloria needs 1,600 soles for the purchase of books for the school.

loans.name: Kou

texts.fr: Madame Kou G. est une femme Sénégalaise célibataire qui est actuellement monitrice.  Elle sollicite un crédit chez l’IMCEC et Kiva pour se lancer dans le commerce des produits cosmétiques.  Avec les revenus de ce nouveau entreprise elle espère de mieux se soutenir et d’être indépendante.  Elle attendait le financement de son crédit pour acheter la marchandise, alors il n’y a pas de marchandise dans sa photo.  Madame G. habite à Diourbel, une petite ville rurale située 150 kilomètres de Dakar, la capitale de Sénégal.
texts.en:
Ms. Kou G. is an unmarried Senegalese woman who is currently a counselor. She’s requesting a loan from IMCEC and Kiva to get started in the commerce of cosmetics. With the revenues from this new enterprise, she hopes to support herself better and to be independent. She was waiting for her loan to be financed to buy merchandise, so no merchandise appears in the photo. Ms. G. lives in Diourbel, a rural town located 150 km from Dakar, the capital of Senegal.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei is married with two children. He sells various home products at a small market in Melitopol city. He has been in this business for 15 years. Offering a large assortment of small home products attracts many customers and provides a stable source of income for his family.

Sergei lives with his wife and two children in a private house. They are a good friendly family where everybody helps one another. Sergei would like to borrow 15,000 UAH to increase the assortment of products and make more sales. He would like to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of products

loans.name: Hasana

texts.en: Hasana L. sells hair cream and weavon as a hairdresser who owns a beauty salon at Abura. Hasana has received a junior high school education. She is single.  Hasana has been a hairdresser selling cream and weavon since 2007. She is responsible for paying the light bill, water bill and other utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more creams, weavon and other hairdressing products. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest.

loans.use: To buy more creams, weavon and other hairdressing products.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es: La Sra. Felipa A. empezó a trabajar con crédito en Emprender el año 2002 con el grupo Gladiolos en seis secuencias, luego descanso un buen tiempo, retornando el año 2006 con credito individual, ella vive en la zona de Rosales, su esposa tiene una panaderia, viven en casa propia, tienen hijos mayores que se sustentan a si mismos , solo un hijo pequeño que todavía mantienen,la señora se encuentra en su cuarto crédito individual, no tiene deudas en otros bancos, trabaja en la venta de verduras desde hace 24 años, es buena cliente.
texts.en:
Felipa A. started to work with a loan from Emprender in 2002. She worked for six loan cycles with the Gladiolos Group. Then she rested for a good while, and she returned in 2006 with an individual loan. She lives in the Rosales zone. Her husband has a bakery. They live in their own house. They have grown children who take care of themselves. They only have one small son who they still take care of. This is her fourth individual loan. She does not have debts in other banks. She has sold vegetables for 24 years. She is a good client.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Ruos

texts.en:
The photo shows Mrs. Ruos C. selling various items from her own store in her home. She is 28 and married, and has been blessed with three children: two are single and one is married and lives separately. Her husband is a truck driver for a small company.

Ruos C. is a busy woman who works hard every day at her business operations in order earn the money to help support her family. She will use part of this Kiva loan as capital to purchase a market store where she will sell vegetables, and the rest of the loan to buy more items to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a market store where she will sell vegetables

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Cette femme a commencé en 2006 le commerce des articles de mercerie, elle a des clients qui sont pour la plupart des couturières, elle vend à crédit à certaines de ses clientes et collecte les fonds dans les huit jours suivants, ainsi elle arrive à gagner la confiance de bons nombre de clients. Voulant agrandir son stock actuel, elle sollicite un deuxième crédit pour acheter des grippures, des doublures, des fils et divers articles de mercerie.
texts.en:
In 2006, this woman began doing commerce in sewing supplies. Most of her customers are seamstresses. She sells on credit to some of them and collects the funds in the following weeks. She thus manages to earn the trust of a good number of customers. Wanting to expand her current inventory, she is requesting a second loan to buy heavy lace or trim, some linings, thread, and various other sewing-related items.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods

loans.name: Lobe (Help Me) Group

texts.en: Klubo is a 44 year old married woman and the mother of 4 children. She stopped her education at the 4th grade. All four of her children are college students. She sells dry goods and dry coconuts. For the past 4 years, she has been having difficulty accessing loans to finance or improve her business. Now that her prayers have been answered, she dreams of having a shop of her own to sustain her children and herself.

loans.use: Additional dry coconuts, oil etc

loans.name: Odilia

texts.es:
la sra. ODILIA C. tiene 9 años de dedicarse a su negocio el cual vende ropa para cama, cobijas y fundas.
La Sra. C. lleva a cabo la mayoria de sus ventas al crédito y la mercaderia la distribuye de manera ambulante a los vecinos de la aldea de Chirinas y comunidades aledañas.
sus clientes la prefieren por la amabilidad con que los atiende y por las comodidades de pago que les da.
Odilia es casada y su esposo de dedica a la agricultura, siembra chile dulce y tomates.
Del matrimonio ya no depende ningun hijo,  ya que todos estan casados, pero Odilia y su esposo sienten muy alegres ya que con los ingresos de ambos lograron educar a sus hijos.
Doña Odilia, sigue llevando a cabo su negocio para cubrir a un 100% sus gastos personales, y apoya a se esposo a cubrir ciertos gastos del hogar.

loans.use: compra de ropa de cama, fundas, cobijas

loans.name: Nadine

texts.en: Nadine is a 28-year-old married woman. She has been working in embroidery /needlework and in the artisanal sector since 2004 to help her husband in the household. Today, Nadine is asking to borrow $500 to buy merchandise so that she can participate in a summer symposium to present her hand-made collection.

loans.use: buy merchandise

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline is 48 years old and married with 7 children. She sells provisions. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She hopes for the loan amount of N30, 000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Dinah's Group

texts.en: B. Dinah is the leader of her lending group in Ibanda. She is 32 years old and married with 4 children who are all in school. Dinah is a determined and hard working lady with a retail shop that she started 7 years ago from scratch. The shop is located in Nyarukika trading centre and her dream is to see it grow much bigger. Dinah needs a loan to help with restocking her retail shop with more bean seeds, maize flour, sugar, salt and so on so that she could be able to make more profits out of it. She is so grateful for her loans and she has no hope of ever stopping since she has strong belief that she will succeed with the help from loans.

loans.use: Restocking her retail shop with more goods.

loans.name: Maclovio

texts.es:
El señor Maclovio H. y su esposa la señora Matilde Cruz, es un matrimonio joven y  tiene poco tiempo que adquirió su vivienda por medio de Infonavit, pero le está haciendo falta algunos detalles para que este en mejor condición. 
Es por eso que solicita el préstamo para poder pintar el interior y arreglar algunos detalles que se necesitan y así podrían habitar lo más pronto posible para dejar de pagar renta. 
Planea pagar el préstamo con los ingresos que el genera de su empleo como guardia de seguridad de una compañía, ya que con los ganancias que obtiene su esposa de las ventas de productos de belleza por catálogos serán para los gastos de la familia. 
La persona que aparece en la foto es la señora Matilde Cruz esposa del señor Maclovio ya que el se encontraba en su trabaja el día de la visita.
texts.en:
Maclovio H. and his wife Matilde Cruz are a young married couple. They recently acquired their home through Infonavit, but still need to make some minor repairs. For this reason they are requesting a loan that will allow them to paint the inside of the house and fix some details, thus enabling them to move in as soon as possible and stop paying rent. He plans to repay the loan with the income he earns from his job as a security guard at a private company. The income his wife earns from selling catalog beauty products will cover household expenses. Only Matilde Cruz appears in the photo, because Maclovio was working on the day of the visit.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To paint the house interior and make repairs.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca es una madre de familia de 60 años de edad, madre de siete hijos, actualmente vive sólo con su esposo en el distrito de Zaña, ubicado a 50 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Hace dos años retomó sus actividades de costurera debido a que la pensión de jubilado de su esposo no era suficiente para el mantenimiento de su hogar. La calidad y responsabilidad con la que realiza su trabajo ha hecho que su negocio sea muy solicitado por sus clientes.

Debido al constante uso su máquina de coser de pedal ha sufrido algunos desperfectos mecánicos que necesitan de urgente reparación para que ella siga trabajando; por este motivo está solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Francisca es una mujer muy carismática que ofrece un buen trato a todas las personas que la visitan. Su más grande anhelo es comprar una máquina de coser eléctrica con la que pueda seguir realizando su trabajo.
texts.en:
Francisca is 60 year-old mother of seven children, although currently she lives only with her husband in the Zaña district, located 50 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. Two years ago Francisca began working again as a seamstress, due to the fact that her husband's retirement pension was not enough to pay for the household costs. The quality and responsibility with which she runs her business has made it very popular with customers. Due to its constant use, the pedal on her sewing machine has been damaged and needs urgent repairing for Francisca to continue working. For this reason she is asking for the first time Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 500 nuevos soles. Francisca is a very charismatic woman that treats everyone who visits her well. Her greatest wish is to buy an electric sewing machine, that she could continue to work on.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of a sewing machine pedal.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica A. is from the village of Lurugan, Valencia City. She is 20 years old. Jessica is married and has 1 child. To make a living, Jessica runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jessica has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jessica joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jessica has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. Jessica is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Jessica from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Friendship Group, Mukono

texts.en: Dan M. is a hard working and determined man. He is a medical professional with a master's degree in medicine, and he has a pharmacy in Kyaliwajjala town as well as offering maternity services and a general clinic. He says that he is able to make 100,000 UGX in profits a week and he would like to expand his business further and open up other branches where he will employ more people. This is his first loan with the group and he hopes to buy more medicines to expand his business.

loans.use: Buying more medicines to expand his business

loans.name: Mr. Vith Paen Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan, which consists of fourteen people, is located in Chumrov village in Takeo province. All the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mr. Vith P. is the village bank president. He has been selected president by the members. He is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. His wife, Mrs. Uk Phally, is a silk weaver. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so her husband decided to ask for a loan to buy more silk for his wife's business. Mr. Vith P. is a father of four children. Three of the children are silk weavers and the youngest one attends the local school.

loans.use: To buy more silk for his wife's business.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
La señora Delfina es socia del Banco Comunal “Manuela Ramos” desde hace 10 años, vive en el distrito de Santa Rosa, provincia de El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 53 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 05 hijos. Ella estudió primaria incompleta.  Delfina se dedica a atender su pequeña tienda de abarrotes.

Delfina nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital y comprar algunos productos para abastecer su bodega.

Ella requiere un crédito  de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar arroz, azúcar, fideos, etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es que sus hijos sean profesionales y así ella pueda vivir tranquila.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Delfina has been a member of the Manuela Ramos Communal Bank for the past 10 years. She lives in the district of Santa Rosa, in the province of El Collao, department of Puno. She is 53 years old, a single mother and has 5 children. She studied but did not complete her primary school education. Delfina works in her small grocery store. Delfina says that with the first loan she requested from the Manuela Ramos Movement, which was for 300 new soles, she was able to increase her working capital and buy some products for her store´s inventory. She needs a loan for 1,000 new soles with which she can buy rice, sugar, pasta, etc. Her dream for the future is for her children to become professionals and that way she can live peacefully. What she likes most about her communal bank is saving.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, pastas, etc.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap N., 47, and her husband, Mr. Saroeun Penh, 46, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They were married in 1980 and have one daughter who attends primary school. 

Sopheap has been a silk weaver for five years. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a marine for 35 years.  

Sopheap is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy cows to raise and also to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To buy cows and to buy silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Jessica Del Rocio

texts.es:
Jessica T. de 35 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y caña cuenta con agua y luz como servicio básicos, es soltera pero esta embarazada. 

Jessica empezó con una mesa de madera vendiendo aretes y cuadernos a las fuera de su casa, poco a poco ahorro dinero y puso una pequeña papelería en su casa.

Ahora Jessica trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 20h00 todos los días, vende lápices por caja, cuadernos, plumas, laminas etc. Una de las complicaciones en el negocio es la delincuencia.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, piedras, arena para arreglar su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener una tienda que tenga todo lo que el cliente pida.
texts.en:
Jessica T., 35 years old, lives in a semi-urban zone in Paraíso de Guayaquil. Her house is made from cement and cane, and has basic services including water and light. She is single but is pregnant. Jessica began with a wooden table where she sold art and paintings outside her house, little by little saving money, and then installed a small stationery shop in her house. Now Jessica works from 7am until 8pm every day. She sells boxes of pens, notebooks, pens, laminate sheets etc. One of the complications of her business is the delinquency. With the loan she wants to buy cement, stone, and sand to rennovate her business. In the future she wants to have a shop where she has all that her customers request.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cement, sand and stone

loans.name: Daniel Antonio

texts.es: Daniel Antonio tiene 58 años, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales solamente1 depende el. Es un hombre muy trabajador pues le gusta mucho su actividad económica que es una pulpería, que tiene más de 5 años de trabajar con su actividad pues el ofrece sus diferentes productos en el mercado en donde tiene una amplia variedad de clientes. A pesar del gran desafío que enfrenta como es problema de salud de su esposa de la cual le brinda la atención necesaria. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de pollo, huevos, aceite, gaseosas, jugos, detergentes entre otros. Su deseo es mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Daniel Antonio is a 58-year-old father with 3 children, 1 of whom still depends on him financially. He is a very hardworking man who really loves his general store. He has been in business for over 5 years, offering a wide selection of products to a variety of customers at the market. Despite the huge challenge that he is currently facing--his wife's health problems--he gives her the care she needs.

The loan that he is requesting will be used to purchase chicken, eggs, cooking oil, soft drinks, juice, detergent, and other goods. He hopes to be able to improve his home.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of spare parts and bicycle frames

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is married with five children and she is 47 years old. She lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo state, Nigeria. She sells mouth watering Nigerian cooked foods in the market and she has been in this business for six years. She hopes to expand her business and attract more customers. 

Ruth is a hard working woman and dedicated to her business. She is requesting a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 28-year-old lady who is married to a teacher. She is blessed with two school-aged children.

Grace offers computer services such as photocopying, lamination and printing and sells stationery as well as refreshments. She has been running the business for four years and has one employee.

Grace is a member of Ushindi group in Faulu Kenya whose members guarantee each other’s loans. She has requested a loan of Kes 40,000 to buy photocopy paper and a printer cartridge.

Grace hopes to build her own house in the future. In five years, she wants to become a wholesaler. Grace describes herself as a hardworking lady.

loans.use: To buy photocopying paper and a printer cartridge

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen J. is from the city of San Vicente. She is 54 years old. Helen is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Helen owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling clothing & shoe products in the local community. Helen has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP average per month for these activities.

In 2006, Helen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,500 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase construction materials for house repair. Helen is requesting a new loan of 14,500 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Helen from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital for her store

loans.name: Elbrus

texts.en: Elbrus A., age 55, is a trader who sells fruits and vegetables. For a year, he has been able to sell these items in his own store. He sells different kinds of seasonal vegetables and fruits. He is married and has two sons. Elbrus would like to increase the number and variety of products he sells in order to increase his profit. He has applied for a loan in the amount of 900 AZN.

loans.use: To purchase more seasonal food items to sell

loans.name: Muhasima

texts.en:
Muhasima K is currently in the business of selling beer and local brew at a bar and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell.  Muhasima is 31 years old and is married to a teacher. She and her husband have two children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the bar by stocking various hot drinks and wines etc.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more beer to sell.

loans.name: Kuña Pora Group

texts.es:
La  formación de este comité inició mediante la invitación de laa señora Felicita F., quien contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la zona.
El comité se denomina “Kuña Pora” y se encuentran desarrollando el el Quinto Ciclo, con 11  integrantes. 
Es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unido, solidario  y responsable. Las integrantes tienen actividades diferentes y siempre están con un gran espíritu emprendedor.
Todas las señoras son de familias humildes quienes luchan día a día para salir adelante, es por eso que las actividades que cada una realiza dependen de la facilidad con que cuentan, así la señora Teófila se dedica  a la venta de remedios yuyos o naturales.
Ella sale hacia el campo con sus hijos para recolectar todo tipo de remedios naturales que la gente consume para combatir cualquier dolencia.
Una ves que ella cuenta con la cantidad y variedad requerida por sus clientes, para mejor manejo y mayor ganancia empaqueta en bolsitas de diferentes tamaños para venderlos.
De esta forma ella trabaja y ayuda a su familia, y solicita el préstamo para la compra de remedios naturales en gran cantidad, y además para compra bolsitas de plásticos de diferentes tamoños.
texts.en:
The committee is called ‘Kuña Pora’ and its 11 members are now in their fifth loan cycle. Their group stands out in their community for being very unified, supportive and responsible. Its members are involved in different areas of work and they always carry out their work with an enterprising spirit. All of the women come from humble families who fight to get ahead on a daily basis, and the work they carry out depends on their particular abilities. One of their members, Teófila, works selling natural herbal remedies. She goes out to the country with her children to collect many different types of natural remedies that people can use to ward off pain. Once she has the amount and the variety that her clients need, she packs the herbs in small bags of different sizes. By packaging the herbs individually, Teófila’s clients will be able to manage their intake better and she will make a larger profit. In this way Teófila is able to work and support her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase natural remedies in bulk and to purchase small plastic bags of different sizes.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Natural remedies in bulk, polythene bags and thread for packaging

loans.name: Cécile

texts.fr: K. Cécile est née le 19 Mai 1969 à Djeffa, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Mariée à DJOHOU Théophile,  Cécile est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Le couple a un autre enfant à charge, en plus des quatre enfants. Cécile vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants à Kraké, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Cécile habite ce quartier depuis cinq ans environs. Le couple subvient ensemble aux besoins de la famille. Cécile a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire et a appris ensuite la coiffure. Cécile mène cette activité depuis hui ans dans son atelier à son domicile. Parallèlement, Cécile vend des mèches, des produits pour cheveux, et aussi des boissons de façon secondaire. Cécile s’approvisionne au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Cécile sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un concours financier, en vue d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande sans cesse croissante de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Cécile K. was born on May 19, 1969, in Djeffa, in Sèmè-Podji. She's married to Théophile DJOHOU and the mother of four children, who all attend school. The couple has another child to support, in addition to their four children. Cécile, her husband and children live together in Kraké, in Sèmè-Podji. She's been living in this neighborhood for approximately five years. The couple provides for the family together. Cécile dropped out of middle school, and was then trained as a hairdresser. She's been running this business for eight years, in her workshop at her home. In parallel, she sells hair extensions, haircare products, and also beverages, as a secondary business. Cécile gets her supplies in Nigeria, a country that borders Benin. For the first time, Céline is seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster her stock and better meet an ever-increasing customer demand.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair extensions and haircare products

loans.name: Ermitaña

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVO AMANECER - CUSCO”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Ermitaña; ella tiene 46 años de edad y La socia es natural del distrito de Quillabamba, la socia es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos, ella se dedica al comercio minorista, la socia  elabora helados artesanales al por mayor y desde hace 2 años atrás vende a domicilio yogurt, La socia es conocida en su barrio y tiene mucha clientela, pero aún así ella sale a buscar siempre mayor número de clientes en otros barrios, ella desea un día tener su propia heladería y cafetín, La socia está trabajando para insistir en su sueño y que este se haga realidad. La socia solicita el préstamo para poder comprar ingredientes para realizar, sus helados y su yogurt.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “NUEVO AMANECER - CUSCO” ["New Dawn - Cusco"] communal bank. She lives in the district of Huanchac, in the province and department of Cusco. Her name is Ermitaña, and she is 46 years old. She comes from the district of Quillabamba, and she is a single mother with 2 children. She is in the retail trade. She prepares artisanal ice cream to sell wholesale, and for the past 2 years, she has sold yogurt for home delivery. She is well-known in her neighborhood and has many customers, but even so she is always going out to look for more customers in other neighborhoods. She hopes one day to have her own ice cream shop and small café. Ermitaña is working hard to stay with her dream and make it a reality. She is requesting the loan so that she can buy ingredients to prepare her ice cream and yogurt. Ermitaña infinitely values and appreciates the loan offered to her, since it will allow her to expand her business and improve her quality of life. Accordingly, she is committed to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying ingredients to make ice cream and yogurt

loans.name: Sorbeh United Group

texts.en:
Meet with the members of the “Sorbeh United” group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

Ibrahim T. (pictured second from left) is the leader of this group. The thirty-three-year-old man is married to a businesswoman and they have two children.

Ibrahim has been a businessman for seven years now, selling toothpaste, toothbrushes, bars of soap, etc. With his share of this loan, he will buy more of the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to his current stock.

loans.use: To buy more toothpaste, toothbrushes, bars of soap, etc.

loans.name: Zainap

texts.en: Zainap J. is currently in the restaurant business and is requesting a loan to stock more food for the restaurant. Zainap is 31 years old and is married, with a husband who is a businessman. She has three children, and they go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her restaurant by purchasing more chairs and tables to accommodate more people.

loans.use: To stock more food in the restaurant

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Mr. Chan S. is highly skilled at building stone and wooden houses and employs a few laborers to help provide his service. He receives a lot of orders from his clients to construct their houses and he also goes to work from construction site to construction site.

Chan S. has another partner in his wife, who works sewing in a factory. He has two school-aged kids, who are dependent on him.

The family’s house breaks down during heavy rainfall and needs repairs frequently. Chan S. will be using his loan to mend his old house.

loans.use: To mend his old house

loans.name: Diatou

texts.fr: Madame Diatou Gringue  est une yoffoise  qui est mariée et mère  de 7 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 12 et 24 ans. Elle est vendeuse de poissons depuis plus de 20 ans.  Elle a hérité cette activité de sa mère qui depuis qu’elle avait 15 ans avait commencé à l’initier. Actuellement son activité consiste à s’approvisionner  en poissons  au marché au marché central de Pikine. Le matin  elle place ses produits auprès de ses  clients et le soir elle passe pour encaisser son argent. Elle est membre de la caisse de Yoff depuis février 2007.Elle a déjà  remboursé 5 prêts  antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu  pour renforcer son fond de roulement qui est destiné à l’achat de poissons. Actuellement on traverse une période ou le poisson se fait rare et ou  les prix montent. Ce financement pourra l’aider à accroitre ses revenus et a améliorer  la situation sociale de sa famille.
texts.en:
Madame Diatou Gringue  comes from Yoff and is married and the mother of seven children who range in age from 12 to 24. She has been selling fish for more than 20 years. She inherited this business from her mother who began it at the age of 15. Presently she stocks up on fish at the central market in Pikine. Each morning she places her fish with retailers, and in the evening she comes to collect the money. She has been a member of the Yoff branch since February 2007. She has already reimbursed five preceding loans.
