She is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs to bolster her working capital used to buy fish. At the present time, there is not much fish available and the price is climbing. This loan will help her increase her income and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to bolster her working capital

loans.name: Carolina Anabel

texts.es:
Carolina Anabel E. C. tiene 23 años. Es casada vive con el esposo y el hijo, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijo.
  
Carolina  una socia de la ventanilla rural La Esperanza, que está ubicada a 25 kilometres del Cantón de Ventanas. Es una comunidad que se dedica al comercio en mayoría este grupo se reúne cada mes en el sector del barrio San Vicente.

Carolina trabaja en el comercio vende accesorio por catalogo como aretes, perfumes,  realiza las comprar en Guayaquil en las vende en un local de su casa y puerta a puerta.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería para ampliar su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueno es tener dinero para terminar la carrera y comprar un carro y ampliar la casa.
Le gusta escuchar música y estudiar.
texts.en:
Carolina Anabel E. C. is 23 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and son in the canton of Ventanas, located in the Los Ríos province.

Carolina is a member of the La Esperanza communal bank, which is located 25 kilometers from the canton of Ventanas. It is a community dedicated primarily to commerce. The group meets every month in the San Vicente neighborhood.

Carolina works selling accessories by catalog such as earrings and perfume. She makes her purchases in Guayaquil and sells them from a business in her house, and door-to-door.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of merchandise to expand her business. The support of the loan would help her financially to meet her needs. Her dream is to have money to finish her degree and to buy a car and expand her house. She likes to listen to music and to study.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to expand her business.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité está compuesto por 20 integrantes de Coronel Bogado,  se han formado como comité hace poco tiempo, desde febrero del 2010 para ser beneficiarias del  crédito grupal. Renovaron por 3ra.vez solicitando el crédito en 3 meses  a fin de cancelar y volver a solicitar en el mes de diciembre para poder contar con capital para invertir y surtir  sus negocios antes de las fiestas de fin de año, teniendo en cuenta el movimiento comercial de las fiestas de navidad y año nuevo. 
Varias de las integrantes  realizan sus actividades en la zona de la terminal de ómnibus, ya que se encuentra en el centro del movimiento comercial y de la misma ciudad. 
 Cuentan con un ahorro de 1.452.000gs., destinado a fondo se seguridad.

La directora general, Maria G., con 43 años, está casada con Mauro Cabrera, cuyo fruto has sido 5 hijos. 
 Ella y su familia viven en el barrio Santa Librada. Su marido se dedica a la carpintería y ella tiene un kiosco donde se dedica a la venta de bebidas y comestibles de varios tipos.  
   
Comenta que está muy contenta con su grupo ya que trabajan bien y solicita el préstamo para la compra de bebidas como gaseosa, vinos, cervezas, y carne, y aceite.
texts.en:
This communal bank has 20 members from Coronel Bogado.  They came together as a communal bank a short time ago in February of 2010 in order to benefit from a group loan.  They have entered their third loan cycle, requesting the loan over 3 months in order to be able to pay it off and request a new one in the month of December. This way they will have capital to invest and stock their businesses before the end-of-year holidays, bearing in mind the increased commercial activity of the Christmas and New Year holidays.

Several of the members carry out their businesses in the area around the city's bus station since it is located at the heart of the commercial activity and the city itself.

They have savings of 1,452,000 Paraguayan guaranis which is to be used as a security fund.

The director of the communal bank, Maria G., is 43 years old.  She is married to Mauro Cabrera and they have 5 children.  She lives with her family in the Santa Librada neighborhood.  Her husband works as a carpenter and she has a kiosk from which she sells different types of drinks and food.

She comments that she is very happy with her group since they work well and she is requesting the loan to buy drinks such as soda, wine and beer as well as meat and oil.

loans.use: Purchase of drinks and meat

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica N. lives in the  Kitawuluzi  neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has  6 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members.      

Monica  has a business of a retail shop.  She has been in this business for 5 years, and she works 6 days out of every week.    Monica sells her products from home, by means of retail.   

Monica  has requested a loan of 500000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy  more boxes of  soap, a bag of sugar, cartons of salt, and cooking oil.  She also generates additional income through tailoring.

The main business challenges for    Monica  include transportation  and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler.    

Monica  lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees, and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more soap, sugar, salt, cooking oil

loans.name: Emiliya

texts.en:
Emiliya is married with a grown daughter, Valeriya. She is an entrepreneur from Berdichev. Emiliya sells children’s toys in the central marketplace of her hometown. She offers a nice selection of toys for different age groups at affordable prices. Emiliya has been in the trade since 1995. Presently, she has 32,000 Grivnyas in turnover capital. 

This holiday season, Emiliya is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional seasonal merchandise, i.e. imitation Christmas trees, garlands and decorations, as well as stuffed toys and electronic games that always sell well before Christmas and New Year’s. Emiliya uses the profit generated to pay her daughter’s college fees. However, one day, she is hoping to expand her business by investing her profits in opening a children’s toy store and a café with a playground for little customers.

loans.use: To increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
Don Rogelio, de 40 años de edad, reside en Corinto departamento de Morazán, se dedica a sembrar granos básicos, él está casado y comparte su vivienda con su esposa y cinco hijos: Iris de 14 años, Idalia de 12, Iveth de 7, Flor de 4 años de edad  y Ana de un mes de edad,  don Rogelio se dedica a la agricultura desde hace muchos años ya que creció en un hogar donde su padre de esta actividad les dio lo necesario para su crecimiento.
El Solicita un préstamo para la recolección de granos básicos, esta actividad consiste en pagar mozos para que le ayuden a recoger la cosecha de maíz y frijol, y es a través del préstamo que él pagara a quienes le ayuden y de  esta manera dejara lista la cosecha para venderla y otra parte para el consumo familiar-
Su objetivo es seguir en esta actividad agrícola ya que es el sustento de su familia y con la ayuda de los préstamo espera cultivar un terreno más grande para las próximas temporadas.
texts.en:
Rogelio is 40 years old and lives in Corinto, located within the Morazán department.  He is a farmer who raises basic grains.  He is married and shares his life with his wife and five children; 14 year old Iris, 12 year old Idalia, 7 year old Iveth, 4 year old Flor, and one month old Ana.  Rogelio has been farming for many years, as he grew up in a home where his father was a farmer and he was able to provide for them in this way.

He is asking for this loan so that he can harvest his grains.  This involves hiring field hands to help him gather the harvest of corn and beans.  He will use the money from this loan to pay his helpers and prepare the harvest for sale and part of it to feed his family.

His goal is to continue this activity because this is his family’s sustenance.  With the help of this loan, he hopes to be able to farm a larger area next season.

loans.use: Pay for field hands

loans.name: Ansise Hispana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC WATA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ansise Hispana; ella tiene 48 años de edad y es viuda y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de ferretería, ella atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de ferretería. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para la ferretería.                       
         
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member who belongs to the communal bank named "Sumac Wata". It is located in the district, province and region of Cusco. 

Her name is Mrs. Ansise Hispana. She is 48 years old, she is a widow, and she has 3 children. She has a hardware store which she operates from 8am until 7pm. She wishes to expand her hardware store. She requests a loan to purchase merchandise for her hardware store.

She is happy to be in receipt of a loan and she is committed to the payment obligations.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her hardware store.

loans.name: G.s. Juan Davila Group

texts.es: La señora Gloria Damaris tiene 4 hijos entre 3 y 12 años de edad, su esposo trabaja en La Concepción. Aduce que ahora la situación es un poco más fácil para ella desde que su esposo consiguió trabajo, ya que antes ella era la única que mantenía el hogar. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y frutas, con mucho empeño y esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante. El préstamo será invertido en la compra de una pequeña cosecha de naranjas y ropa. La otra integrante es Junieth Guadalupe tiene su  negocio que consiste en la venta de ropa nueva, los cuales principalmente los distribuye de manera ambulante aunque en su mayoría es por encargos. Ella tiene 2 hijos de 10 meses y 5 años de edad. Su próximo paso consistiría en ser más selectiva a la hora de obtener nuevos clientes. Ellas se han unido para mejorar las condiciones de su negocio por medio de los financiamientos.
texts.en:
Gloria Damaris has 4 children aged between 3 and 12 years old.  Her husband works in La Concepción.  She tells us that her situation has become a little easier since her husband found a job as she used to be the only one who supported their household.  Gloria Damaris sells clothes and fruit.  With a great deal of determination and effort, she has managed to get ahead in life.  Gloria will invest her loan in buying a small harvest of oranges and some clothes.

The other member of this group is Junieth Guadalupe whose business is selling new clothes which she distributes as an itinerant street vendor although she mainly works to order.  She has two children aged 10 months and 5 years.  Her next step in her business is to become more selective when attracting new customers.  These two women have come together to improve their businesses through loans.

loans.use: to buy oranges and clothes.

loans.name: Ma. Chita

texts.en: Ma. Chita P. is from the village of Cabuan, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 47 years old. Ma. Chita is separated from her spouse. To make a living, Ma. Chita runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and toothpaste in the local community. Ma. Chita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Ma. Chita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Chita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Ma. Chita is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like biscuits and beverages. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Ma. Chita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, like biscuits and beverages

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn V. lives in the village of San Jose, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 23 years old, married and has four young children. For the last five years, she has made a living by running a specialized retail store where she sells bananas and coconuts. She makes about 3,000 PHP a month from her work.

Earlier this year, Analyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is applying for a loan, her first, for PHP 5,000 to buy more coconuts to sell. She plans to use the additional income she earns to continue improving and expanding her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional coconuts to sell

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama P. has been making and selling kenkey, a Ghanaian staple made from fermented corn dough, for the past 15 years. She sells her kenkey in Kokowada near Elmina.  Ama is married and has one child.  Her earnings pays for her child’s school fees. 

With the goal of improving her income, Ama needs a loan to grow her food business. The loan will be used to purchase more corn and other ingredients. She plans to reinvest her earnings back into her business for further growth.

loans.use: To buy  ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Ганиев Рустам житель района Худжанд. Ему 50 лет. Он женат. Имеет одного ребенка. Образование-среднее. Он занимается производством сыра. Ему помогают жена и сын. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 10 лет. Кредит берет для покупки молока.
texts.en: Rustam G. resides in Khujand. He is 50 years old, married, and has one child. He has a vocational education.  He works making cheese.  He is helped by his wife and son. He has been doing this work for ten years.  He is taking out a loan to buy milk.

loans.use: to buy milk for making cheese

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: El señor Pedro trabaja como chofer en el sindicato Eduardo Avaroa y además es socio propietario. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de un motor nuevo. Lo ayudara a realizar con mayor seguridad para el y los pasajeros. Vive en casa propia. Es viudo y tiene dos hijos. El cliente esta muy satisfecho con los créditos que se le otorgaron y le ayudó a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Pedro works as a driver in the Eduardo Avaroa syndicate and he is also a partner in the syndicate.  He needs this loan to buy a new motor.  This will allow him to have a safer vehicle for his passengers.  He lives in his own home, and is a widower with 2 children.  Pedro is very pleased with the loans that he has obtained, which have helped him to improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to provide maintenance for his vehicle

loans.name: Huyen's Group

texts.en:
Huyen T. Pham is 36 years old. She lives with her with her family in Dong hoi commune. Ms Huyen has opened a butchery and cookie shop at her house. Every day, this shop provides her with a profit of 200,000 Vietnamese dong that helps her to manage her family life. She participates in our credit program with the hope of having more money to buy more kinds of sweet products to expand her shop and attract more customers. She needs a loan of 5,014,000 Vietnamese dong. She thinks this kind of loan is very suitabL. with her business.

Mai T. H. L. is 45 children. She is doing a variety of farming such as growing rice, raising fish and pigs for meat. She needs a loan of 5,014,000 Vietnamese dong to buy food for them.

Nga T. B. is 46 year old with 2 children. She is raising 200 chickens for meat. She is requesting a loan of 5,014,000 Vietnamese dong to buy food for them.

Binh T. N. is 35 years old with 2 children. She sells ready, cooked food in the local market. Now she needs a loan of 5,014,000 Vietnamese dong to buy materials.

L. T. N. is 43 years old with 1 child. She sells aquatic products wholesaL.. She needs to have a loan of 5,014,000 Vietnamese dong to buy more products

loans.use: to buy more kinds of sweet products

loans.name: Huon

texts.en:
Huon R. is 31 years old and has been selling fresh fish next to her village for more than two years. She sells fish that she gets from her husband’s fishing or buys them from her wholesale supplier and other fishermen. She is married to Houn Nat, 30, who works at fishing in and around the lakes of his community. 

Currently, his fishing is temporarily interrupted because his boat and other fishing equipment are broken. Because of this, Huon R. requested a loan to buy a new boat and additional fishing equipment. In the photograph, Huon R., her husband, and their three small kids are pictured all together in front their house.

loans.use: to buy a new boat and additional fishing equipment.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz, de 29 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Jhon de 28 años y su querida hija Nicol de 4 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Visitando a sus clientes en sus mismas casas, Luz realiza la venta de sus productos de belleza, es una vendedora muy persistente y convincente, motivo por el cual termina con la venta de sus cosméticos rápidamente. En su barrio es muy conocida y saben que los productos que vende son de muy buena calidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejarles a sus clientas sobre lo que mejor le quedara a su piel. Lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cobrar por la venta de sus productos ya que algunos clientes no le pagan a tiempo. En  adelante, espera poner su tienda de cosméticos, donde pueda vender mas cómoda y sin la necesidad de ir casa por casa. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, quiere hacer crecer su negocio, es por eso que desea pagar a tiempo todas sus cuotas para poder acceder a otro préstamo, además sabe que cuenta con el apoyo de su banco comunal. Con el crédito solicitado, comprará más cosméticos, ya que está teniendo mucha demanda.
texts.en: Luz is a very friendly and hard-working 29-year-old woman. She lives in her own home along with her husband Jhon, 28, and their beloved daughter Nicol, 4, for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life. Luz sells beauty products, visiting her customers in their homes. She is a very persistent and persuasive saleswoman who is motivated to sell her cosmetics quickly. She is very well-known in her neighborhood, and they know the products she sells are of very high quality. What she enjoys most about her work is advising her clients on what best fits their skin. She has two years of experience and the thing she considers to be the most difficult is charging for the products since some customers don't pay on time. In the future, she hopes to have a cosmetics store where she can sell in more comfort and not have to go from house to house. This is her eighth loan with Kiva partner MFP. She wants to make her business grow, and she plans to make her payments on time so she can have access to more loans. Furthermore, she counts on the support of her community bank. She is requesting the loan to purchase more cosmetics because they are in very high demand.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en: Merly is 36 years old and married with two school-aged children. She has been growing corn for three years in the Philippines and earns about Php 30,000 per crop. She is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase seeds and fertilizer. In the future, Merly hopes that her farming business will improve and be able to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Olima

texts.ru: Олима жительница района Рудаки. Ей 25 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Ее муж работает в колбасном цехе. Сама Олима имеет  среднее образование. Она занимается шитьем национальных платьев. В основном она берет заказы на дому. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже два года. Кредит берет для приобретения электрической швейной машинки.
texts.en: Olima lives in Rudaki.  She is 25 years old, married, and has two children.  Her husband works in a sausage shop.  Olima has a secondary education.  She works sewing traditional dresses.  She primarily takes orders to sew at home.  She has been doing this work for two years.  She is taking out a loan to buy an electric sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy an electric sewing machine

loans.name: Ismael Antonio

texts.es:
Don Ismael habita en San Sebastian un pueblo localizada en Yali municipal de Jinotega, el tiene52 años de edad, esta casado, tiene dos hijos. El se dedica a la agricultura específicamente a la siembra de café. Empezó  trabajar con la siembra de café hace 7 años pues antes se dedicaba a la siembra de granos básicos, su finca la adquirió a través de una herencia después con el tiempo vendió parte de su finca para comprar 7 manzanas de café. El ha sido un hombre emprendor  a pesar que no finalizo sus estudios. Hoy en día además de dedicarse a la siembra  de café, tiene un ciber café y vende repuestos. 
El esta solicitando el préstamo para terminar de sembrar café y comprar abono para preparar la tierra. Con esta inversión espera sacar una producción de café con excelentes rendimientos  y venderlo a un buen precio que le genere ganancias. En sus planes futuros esta ampliar su siembra de café para convertir en un productor mayorista de café orgánico para sacar adelante a su mayor prioridad su familia.
texts.en:
Ismael lives in San Sebastián, a village which is located in Yali, in Jinotega.  He is 52 years old, married, and has two children.  He is a coffee farmer.  Ismael started growing coffee seven years ago.  Before that he used to grow basic grains.  He acquired his farm through an inheritance.  Over time, he sold part of his farm to buy seven 'manzanas' (one 'manzana' = 1.68 acres) of coffee.  He has been an enterprising man even though he didn't finish his schooling.  Now, in addition to growing coffee, he also owns an Internet cafe and sells spare parts.

Ismael is requesting a loan to finish sowing his coffee and to buy manure in order to prepare his land.  Through this investment, he hopes to achieve an excellent yield of coffee and sell it for a good price which will make him profits.  His future plans include expanding his coffee growing so that he can become a wholesale producer of organic coffee.  In this way, he will be able to get his family, who are his main priority, ahead in life.

loans.use: to grow coffee and buy manure to prepare his land

loans.name: Isabel Adelita

texts.es:
Isabel de 46 años es madre de familia, vive en su casa con su esposo e hijos, cuenta con servicio de luz y agua, ubicada en el distrito de Pacanga que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad.  Esta zona   se caracterizan por la actividad agrícola, ganadera de sus pobladores.

Isabel se dedica a la venta de ropa, accesorios y zapatos para damas, negocio que a colocado en su domicilio desde hace unos años, pero también deja mercadería en otros caseríos y cobra cada fin de mes, tratando de tener mayor demanda de clientes y así pueda obtener más ingresos para solventar los gastos familiares.

Al observar Isabel que su negocio cada día es más próspero a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería y abastecer su tienda con productos innovadores, con la finalidad que su clientela siga aumentando para poder pagar su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia en especial la de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Isabel, 46, is married and lives in her home with her husband and children, where they have electric service and water, located in the district of Pacanga belonging to the department of La Libertad. This region is characterized by the crop and livestock farming of its inhabitants. 

Isabel earns a living selling clothing, accessories and ladies' shoes, a business which she set up in her home some years ago. However she also leaves merchandise in other hamlets and collects at the end of each month, in an effort to have greater customer demand and thus be able to obtain more earnings for covering household expenses. 

Having observed that her business is more prosperous day by day, Isabel believed it necessary to seek a loan from Edpyme Alternative for 1,000 Peruvian soles, in order to purchase a large quantity of merchandise and stock her shop with innovative products. Her goal is that her clientele would keep growing so that she may pay off her loan and improve the quality of life of her family, and especially of her children.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of merchandise for stocking her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married and has a machine shop business in the Philippines. Elizabeth works hard to support her family. She has been in this business for eight years now.

Elizabeth requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials and equipment for her business.


In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy materials and equipment for her business.

loans.name: Trabajando Para El Manana 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Bibiana is the coordinator of her group "Trabajando para el Manana" 1, 2 & 3 (Working for tomorrow). Bibiana is excited to be taking her 4th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for almost 3 years, starting to work out of her house after her partner in love gave her money to start her business. She plans to use this loan to buy ingredients like meat, flour, seasoning, cooking oil, vegetables and a gas oven for her "empanada" sales business. An empanada is a round of flour filled with meat or vegetables and fried, a popular snack or food. 

Bibiana makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their 4 children. She says that her biggest challenge is to help her children to become professionals. She said her most favorite activities are attending to her family and spending great moments with them. Her challenges are to develop her business, to proviD. extra income for her family, and to save. She says, "with all of this I will be giving steps forward to make change for me and my family future. Thank you all for helping me to improve my family´s life, myself and all the members from this group!!!"  Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Samana. 

The group pictures are separated to show as many faces as possible.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, flour, seasoning, cooking oil, vegetables and a gas oven

loans.name: Rosmery Mirtha

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosmery Mirtha; ella tiene 26 años de edad y es casada; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de maiz,ella lleva a lugares como Paucartambo,ella vende en forma ambulatoria, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de maíz. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz al por mayor.
                                                                                                                 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Communal Bank "Virgen Natividad" ("Virgin of the Nativity").  This bank is located in the district of Urubamba, which is in the Province of Urubamba and the Department of Cusco.

The member is Señora Rosmery Mirtha; she is 26 years old and married.  The member combines her daily activities with a business buying and selling corn. She obtains it from places like Paucartambo, and she sells it as a street vendor.  The member works from 6 a.m. through 6 p.m..  The member wants to grow and improve her business selling corn.  The member is requesting the loan to buy corn at wholesale.

The member is happy about the loan, and promises to comply with her repayments.

loans.use: to buy corn at wholesale

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, de 59 años, vive en compañía de su esposa Isabel, y cuidan de sus 6 hijos, de los cuales solo viven con 2 de ellos; Julio y Obed. Todos unidos viven en la comunidad de Casacoto. Todas las mañanas, Juan organiza las diferentes actividades de casa. Por ejemplo Isabel, tiene que atender a sus pobladores que a primeras horas del día, compran leña para poder cocinar los alimentos del día. Mientra Juan, sale a cuidar de sus animales entre ovinos y vacunos; ya después de la cena. Él se dirige a sus terrenos agrícolas, que con tanto esfuerzo pudo adquirir, ahí siembra papa y arveja que es lo que más le gusta, pues adquiere ganancias mensualmente y tiene mayor demanda. En el mercado central de su localidad; en épocas de campaña de papa, los negociantes le brindan un buen precio de compra. Por ello él, está pensando adquirir más terrenos de cultivo, donde no solo sembrará papa, también demás productos que crecen en está zona. Sin embrago le preocupa la falta de capital de trabajo, pero está seguro que con el apoyo de su banco comunal, podrá concretar este objetivo. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Miraflores de casacoto” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde está  feliz de trabajar con los pobladores de su localidad, pues tomaron la decisión de invertir y progresar juntos. Asimismo promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.  Juan se encuentra sembrando papa en la localidad de Illick, por ello de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes para esparcirlos entre sus cultivos.
texts.en:
59-year-old Juan lives together with his wife Isabel and they care for their children.  They have six children but only two of them still live at home: Julio and Obed.  They live together in the community of Casacoto.

Every morning, Juan organizes the different household tasks.  For example, very early in the morning Isabel has to serve the locals with firewood so that they can cook their daily food.  Meanwhile, Juan goes out to look after his animals (sheep and cattle).  After supper, Juan goes out to his farmland which he acquired through a lot of hard work.  There he grows potatoes and peas.  This is what he most enjoys as he makes monthly profits and there is a lot of demand.  In the central market in town, during potato season, traders give him a good price for his produce.  For this reason, he is planning to acquire more farmland where he will not only grow potatoes but also other products which grow in this area.  He is worried by his lack of working capital but he is certain that, with the help of his community bank, he will be able to achieve his goal.

Juan is a member of the 'Miraflores de Casacoto' community bank and this is his fourth loan from MFP.  He is happy to work with the residents of his town because they took the decision to invest and make progress together.  For his part, he pledges to be punctual in making his loan repayments.  Juan is currently sowing potatoes in the town of Illick.  With your support, he will invest the money that he has requested in buying several sacks of fertilizer to spread over his crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN BARTOLOME DE TAMBO REAL”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nancy; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de lácteos, ella vende leche y también quesos, ella vende en las distintas ferias que existe en el distrito de Anta, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de queso y leche. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos parea que quesos como comprar leche al por mayor.
 
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the "San Bartolomé de Tambo Real" community bank which is located in Anta district, in Anta province, in Cusco department.

Nancy is 40 years old, married, and has four children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling dairy products.  Nancy sells milk and cheese.  She sells her products in the different street markets in Anta district.  She would like to expand her business selling cheese and milk.  She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for making cheese (she will buy milk wholesale).

Nancy is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making cheese (she will buy milk wholesale)

loans.name: Maria Ester

texts.es:
Maria tiene 30 años de edad, es casada, y tiene dos hijos.

Ella se dedica a prestar sus servios como empleada domestica desde hace 11 años. Su esposo tiene una panadería, y ella le ayuda cuando sale de su trabajo. Ambos trabajan para llevar el sustento a su familia.

La señora Maria esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundacion Campo, para comprar los materiales necesarios para construir un espacio al lado de su casa donde su esposo pueda tener su pequeña panadería. Los materiales que necesitan incluyen cemento y láminas de aluminio.  En la actualidad ellos alquilan un local donde su esposo hace el pan que vende en distintas comunidades. Teniendo la panadería en su casa Maria y su esposo pueden ahorrar al no tener que pagar el alquiler. De esta manera ellos tendrán mayor comodidad para elaborar el pan, y así poder obtener mejores ganancias. Con el préstamo Maria y su esposo podrán comprar todos los materiales al mismo tiempo, en vez de tener que hacer varios viajes a la ciudad. Así mismo, podrán realizar la construcción más rápidamente.

Maria espera en un futuro obtener mejores ingresos y así proporcionar una mejor vida para su familia. También desea ahorrar para asegurar la educación de sus hijos. Además ella desea hacer mejoras a su casa, ya que ciertas partes están en mal estado. La mayor parte de su casa esta construida de láminas de aluminio, y cuando llega el invierno el agua entra a su casa.
texts.en:
María, 30, is married and has two children.  She’s been working as a domestic employee for the last 11 years.  Her husband has a bakery and she helps him when she gets home from work.  They both work to support the family.

María is asking Fundación Campo for a loan to buy building materials and supplies needed to build a space on the side of her house where her husband can have his small bakery.  The materials they need include cement and aluminum sheets.  They currently rent the space her husband uses to bake the bread they sell in various communities.  Having a bakery at home will allow María and her husband to save since they won’t have to pay rent.  This way baking the bread will be more comfortable and profits will be better.  With the loan, María and her husband will be able to buy all the needed building materials at once instead of having to make several trips to the city.  At the same time, they will be able to complete the construction more quickly.

María hopes in future to earn better income to provide a better life for her family.  She also hopes to be able to save up to insure her children’s education.  She also wants to do some home improvements since some parts of it are in bad shape.  Most of her house is built with aluminum sheets and when winter comes water gets into the house.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies to build a space for a bakery.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is single and blessed with one child who is still in school. For the last six years, she has been operating a retail shop to make a living. She also runs a grocery to earn extra income. She employs one person to help her in the business.
 
In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. With a loan of 10,000 Kenya shillings, she wants to buy more fruits for resale.

loans.use: to buy fruits for resale.

loans.name: Lhagvasuren

texts.en: Lhagvasuren is 40 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His wife is a nurse while his eldest daughter is a college student and his younger two children are school students. He started his water business in 2004 by opening a well in his own yard. He provides all the water within a 1.5 km radius. It is difficult for customers to transport water; therefore, he is planning to buy a new truck to deliver the water. He is a hardworking and diligent man who is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to buy a truck.

loans.use: to buy a truck.

loans.name: Sofronio

texts.en:
Sofronio is 33 years old and is married to a teacher. He lives in Happy Village, Tambulig Zamboanga del Sur. 

He owns and operates a small grocery store. His business has grown fast because of his hard work.  He has a net income in the amount of 9000 Php a month. He has been operating this business for about 2 years, since he got married. 

In 2011, Sofronio joined GDMPC to have financial access from the cooperative for the expansion of his current business. He is requesting a loan in the amount of Php 10,000 from GDMPC  He has taken a loan previously in the cooperative and he was able to pay on time. The money he borrows is of great help to his business. This is his second cycle of loans taken from GDMPC.  In the future, he plans to have his own house. He hopes that the revenue generated from his business will help him build a house.

loans.use: Purchase additional grocery products to sell

location.town: Happy Village, Tambulig Zambo. del Sur

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 32 years old. She is married and a mother of two children. She is a farmer and does the farming on her own piece of land. She has been doing this for the last six years. 

She learned about KADET LTD from other women in a group already registered with KADET in her area of residence. This will be her third loan which she is planning to spend to buy fertilizer and wheat and maize seeds. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to build a permanent house.

Her dream is to be a prominent farmer of wheat and provide a better living for the family. She is an industrious woman who is determined to achieve her set objectives.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and wheat and maize seeds.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LLANCASUN DE ARIN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Julia; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es casada y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de taller de carpintería ella juntamente con su esposo trabajan en el taller de carpintería haciendo trabajos como mesas, sillas y puertas, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de carpintería. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar madera y pegamentos para el negocio de carpintería. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Introducing Julia, a member of the “Llancasun de Arin” Communal Bank, which is located in Calca, a district of the Calca province in the Cusco department.

Julia is 40 years old, she is married and she has 1 child. She alternates her daily chores with her job in the carpenter's shop where she works together with her husband. They create objects such as tables, chairs and doors. Thanks to this small activity she provides for her child. She wants to expand their carpentry activity, and she is requesting a loan to buy wood and adhesives for the workshop.

She is happy about the loan and she commits to complying with the repayment of her dues.

loans.use: To buy wood and adhesives for her carpenter's shop.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a single mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has no electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, Monica has operated a business selling clothes in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale shop in the future. 

Monica plans to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 42-year-old married man. He has four children ranging from three to fourteen years old. He describes himself as patient and flexible. 
Stephen operates a retail store where he sells maize. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a conducive environment. In addition, he also runs a greengrocery to increase his income. He describes his biggest business challenge as the shortage of maize sources. He will use his loan of 20,000 KES to buy 15 bags of maize. Stephen's business goal is to be a supplier of maize to nearby towns within the next five years.

loans.use: to buy 15 bags of maize.

loans.name: Katsaka

texts.en:
Katsaka is applying for another loan to start a charcoal selling business. She will use this 50,000 Kes loan to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. In the future, Katsaka aspires to continue improving her businesses. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Katsaka has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Maendeleo Visiga Group(Please Delete)

texts.en:
Theodesia who is in her mid 30s is a divorcee with two children who are still at school. She has been a food vendor for five years now. She works from 7am to mid-night daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to restock the out of stock items in her mamalishe store and to sell soft drinks. She dreams of building her own house.

Theodesia will be accountable for paying back the loan.(PLEASE DELETE THIS DOCUMENT)_

loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in mamalishe store and to sell soft drinks.

loans.name: Jazmín

texts.en:
Jazmin owns a small restaurant in Guayaquil, Ecuador. She has operated this small business for a year now, but she spent many years learning how to run a restaurant from her mother who was in the same line of work all of her life. Jazmin is asking for this loan so that she can buy raw materials and ingredients for her business such as rice, butter, flour eggs, and dishes. She is a single mother of four, and her restaurant is her only source of business. Ms. Sanchez wants lenders to know that she is extremely hard working and entrepreneurial, and her wish is to make the restaurant popular so she can earn enough to send her children to school.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: azmin is asking for this loan so that she can buy raw materials and ingredients for her business such as rice, butter, flour eggs, and dishes.

loans.name: Davi

texts.en:
Born in 1952 in Aklakou, where she currently lives, Mrs. Davi F. is widowed with three (03) children. Having become the head of her household by circumstance, she meets with difficulty her many needs using the profits from the sale of condiments and canned goods. She has been in this business since her youth. Today, Mrs. Davi F. has much experience in the sale of condiments. She has benefited twice in succession from loans which she repaid without incident.

Today, she is asking for a loan of $650 to buy baskets of condiments and cartons of canned goods to stay on top of the demands of her clientele. From this business will follow the profits which will allow her to be the mother of a happy family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1952 à Aklakou où elle vit actuellement, Madame F. Davi est veuve avec trois (03) enfants. Devenue chef de famille par la force des choses, elle subvient difficilement aux nombreux besoins à partir des bénéfices tirés de la vente des condiments et des boîtes de conserve. Ce commerce, elle le fait depuis son jeune âge. Aujourd’hui, Madame Davi F. possède une grande expérience dans la vente des condiments. Elle a bénéficié deux fois de suite, des crédits qu’elle a bien soldés.

Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite un crédit de $650 pour acheter des paniers de condiments et des cartons de boites de conserve afin d’être à la hauteur de la demande de sa clientèle. De cette activité, découleront des bénéfices qui lui permettront d’être la mère d’une famille heureuse.

loans.use: To buy baskets of condiments and canned goods to sell

loans.name: Beatriz Adriana

texts.en:
Adriana is 22 years old. She is single and works as an employee in a factory. She lives with her parents, brothers and sisters. 8 months ago she began to sell beauty products to her coworkers, neighbors and friends. She started her business because she needed to help out even more with the family expenses. She wants to be a successful woman and that is the reason that she does two jobs at the same time.

Now she is requesting for a loan of $550.00, because she wants to purchase more merchandise and increase her number of customers by offering a greater variety of products. And we are sure that, if she gets this loan with your help, she will become a great business woman.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en: Mrs. Yorn S. is 44 years old and lives with her husband and 3 children in a part of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To supplement the family's income, Yorn S. raises pigs and some domestic animals on her small piece of land, while her husband is self-employed as a taxi driver and can make up to $7 each day. Recently, Yorn S. has managed to increase the number of her pigs, which will enable her to increase her profits.

loans.use: To add more pigs to her group of livestock.

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing E. is 30 years old and lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is a married mother of 2 and has been  a LAPO client for 3 years. She learnt how to run a general store from her mother and started her own store in 2004. She is seeking a $250 loan to buy more goods for sale i.e. clothes and plastic goods.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and plastic goods for sale

loans.name: Mankumari

texts.en:
Mrs. Mankumari R. M. lives in Bholdhoka, Lalitpur, Nepal. She lives in a single (i.e., not extended) family with her husband Kumar R. M. and one son. Her husband works in a steel shop. Her son is attending primary school. Mrs. M. opened a grocery shop two years ago to raise the living standard of her family. Their financial condition is not good so they can't provide better education for their son because in Nepal the cost of education is very high. To overcome this problem she opened a grocery shop.

Due to lack of capital, she can’t fully stock her shop. So she is asking for her first loan in the amount of US$ 175 to buy goods like rice, lentils, noodles, etc. She plans to spend her income to provide better education for her son and wishes to help her husband to upgrade the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: To buy gocery goods for re-sale

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
We meet Esperanza, a young, a 21-year-old enterprising mother, who makes a variety of breads, an occupation she has inherited from her beloved grandparents who now, thanks to her perseverance and diligence, continue thriving. While she eagerly dedicates herself to this work, her husband, Raúl, has decided to leave his hometown, Ocuviri, to search of better opportunities to get some savings to finally build a house, a home of his own in which he hopes will give his three beloved children security, well-being, and comfort so they can grow up well. Esperanza’s wish is to repair her small bakery and increase the amount and variety of her production to satisfy the large demand of her clients and to fulfill these plans she asks for a loan with which she’ll be able to get her wish and satisfy her demanding clients with her delicious breads.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia, Princeton University Language Project volunteer.

Encontramos a Esperanza madre joven y emprendedora de 21 años, elaborando una gran variedad de panes, negocio que heredó de sus queridos abuelitos y que ahora con el que gracias a su perseverancia y diligencia viene progresando.Mientras ella se dedica ha este oficio con mucho ahínco, su esposo, Raúl, ha decidido salir de su pueblo natal, Ocuviri, en busca de mejores oportunidades con el objetivo de amasar algunos ahorros para finalmente construir su casita, morada propia en la que pretenden brindar a sus tres queridos hijos seguridad, bienestar y comodidad para que puedan desarrollarse plenamente.El deseo de Esperanza es refaccionar su pequeña panadería y aumentar la cantidad y variedad de su producción para cubrir la gran demanda de sus clientes y para concretar sus planes solicita un préstamo dinero con el que podrá concretar su deseo y seguirá satisfaciendo a su exigente clientela con sus deliciosos panes.

loans.use: The repair of the equipment in a small bakery.

loans.name: Ana Mariela

texts.es:
Ana Maricela is a woman who likes to work very much, but at the same time she likes to be with her children in order to care for them and be sure that they do not get in trouble in the streets. It is for this reason that she started to sell beauty products from a catalog to her friends and neighbors: to be able to earn money for the expenses of her three children who must study and who want to go to the university to prepare for a career.

This is Ana’s dream and the reason that she fights constantly to make her business prosper: With the salary that her husband earns as a security guard and that which she earns from her cosmetic sales, they want their children to study at the university. Ana is requesting a loan of $375 which she promises to repay in six months. With this money Ana Mariela will be able to buy new merchandise to offer to her clients. With your help Ana Mariela will be able to bring up her children to be people of means with better opportunities than she had.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Ana Maricela, es una mujer a la que le gusta mucho trabajar, pero al mismo tiempo le gusta estar con sus hijos para poder cuidarlos y que éstos no se vayan por el mal camino. Es por eso que comenzó a vender productos de belleza por catálogo entre sus amigos y vecinos para poder sacar dinero para los gastos de sus tres hijos a quienes tiene estudiando y desean que en un futuro estudien una carrera universitaria.

Y con el sueño que tiene Ana, a luchado constantemente para que su negocio prospere y así con el sueldo que tiene el esposo de Ana como guardia de seguridad, y lo que gana Ana con las ventas de cosméticos. Ana está solicitando un crédito de US $375 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Ana Mariela podrá comprar mercancía nueva para poder tener productos qué ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Ana Mariela podrá sacar a sus hijos adelante y sean unas personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades que ella.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as cosmetics and beauty supplies for resale

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana S. is single. She lives with her parents in downtown Berdyansk. Tatyana sells butter, cheese and meat in the central city market. Her kiosk is well known among customers for prices that are usually lower than those of other vendors. Tatyana has always been very honest and fair with each of her clients, which has helped her gain a good reputation and find many loyal customers. Presently, her turnover capital is about $2000. Tatyana has about $500 in inventory. Her monthly net profit is around $600.  

Tatyana is requesting a loan of $1000 to increase her assorted inventory, add to her turnover capital and reconstruct her vending facility. She has good management skills, a committed attitude and huge business potential. We believe the consistency and sustainability of Tatyana’s business, her knowledge of the market and her friendliness with clients will help her continue to be successful and repay this loan.

loans.use: To reconstruct her vending facility and increase  stock

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia is a woman who suffered physical abuse from her husband for many years. She decided to leave him and to offer her kids a loving and peaceful environment. With the little bit of savings she had, she decided to purchase a sewing machine. With her agility and with the support of her children, she was able to make the finest and most beautiful skirts. She sells them at the local market in San Jose in the city of Juliaca.

This business is her main source of income for Emilia who's 36 years old. She's currently renting a house and this is where she has her workshop. She's having a lot of succes in this business.

She is asking that you reach to your good heart and lend her some money to purchase more basic materials such as fabric to continue making her beautiful skirts. "Your good heart will give this family a better quality of living".

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Emilia, es una mujer que durante muchos años sufrió constantes maltratos físicos de su esposo, por esa razón decidió separarse y ofrecerles un ambiente de tranquilidad y amor a sus hijos, con el poco dinero ahorrado que tenía decidió adquirir una máquina de coser y con su agilidad y el apoyo de sus hijos empezó a confeccionar hermosas y finas faldas que luego los lleva para su venta al mercado San José de la ciudad de Juliaca.Este negocio se ha convertido en el ingreso económico principal de la señora Emilia de 36 años de edad y sus retoños, ellos actualmente viven en un domicilio alquilado en donde también funciona su pequeño tallercito que gracias a su constancia y perseverancia ya está logrando tener éxito.En esta oportunidad recurre a tu buen corazón y hace la petición de un préstamo para adquirir mayor cantidad de materia prima (tela) para seguir confeccionando sus hermosas y novedosas faldas “Tu buen corazón les dará la oportunidad de mejorar su calidad de vida”

loans.use: To purchase basic materials

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah A. is married with 2 children. She is 40 years old.  She has been in this business since 1988 and hails from Edo State, Nigeria. Sarah needs a loan amount of $875 to buy more clothes for sale.She has been with LAPO for 4 years.

loans.use: To buy more female clothes for sale

loans.name: Parween

texts.en:
Parween H. is married and a mother of six: three boys and three girls. All her daughters are married; her husband manufactures and sells furniture.

Her husband operates his business in a shop in one of the nearby towns. He is very good at his work and carves very beautiful designs out of wood. He buys wood for this purpose from a nearby wood market. Parween herself embroiders scarves on order from various traders. She has been embroidering for the past ten years. Currently, she needs a loan in the amount of US$ 475 to buy wood in bulk for their business.

loans.use: Buy wood in bulk for furniture-making

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
D. is married to Tita Foji David and they are blessed with six children. She lost her two children. The most recent one died after a brief illness, leaving behind a wife and four children who are now all with D.. Along with her widowed daughter-in-law and the four grandchildren, D. houses two other orphaned grandchildren. D., her husband, and the widow are all GHAPE members. They all join hands together to take care of those children, which includes paying school fees, feeding, hospital bills and clothing. Her husband is a subsistence farmer and brings no income to the house. 
D. was motivated by all these circumstance to join GHAPE in 2004 and has successfully repaid three loans, both of which she invested in rearing of pigs and goats and farming crops like cassava and beans.
D. is requesting a loan of to expand her animal farm (pigs and goats) and cassava farm. She says her business is going to succeed because she has been farming since the age of five when her parents began to teach her. In addition, she has enough land for farming and rearing animals and the demand for these items is high.
She plans to repay this loan in 18 months and the first installment repayment begins four months after disbursement.

loans.use: To rear pigs and goats and for farming

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria Elena has been working with Fundacion 2000 since 2005. She is married and has two grown-up children who no longer need her support. Her first loan of 3000 cordobas was used to purchase cosmetics and clothing.
The loans that she has received in the past have resulted in better living conditions for  Maria Elena and her husband: they were able to fix-up their home and to purchase home appliances.

This time Maria Elena is requesting a loan of $375 dollars (7,000 cordobas) to use as working capital. 
Her living conditions and payback guarantees have improved, as her husband also works repairing watches and both contribute to the household expenses.

 Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva volunteer 

La señora trabaja con fundacion 2000, desde al año 2005, habiendo iniciado con un capital de C$ 3000. córdobas, para comprar mercaderia variada como cosmeticos, ropa, es casada tiene dos hijos que no dependen de ella ya son mayores de edad, vive en casa propia.
Con los prestamos otorgados ella ha mejorado sus condiciones de vida ya que ha compuesto su casa, así como tambien a comprado electrodomesticos en la actualidad maneja un credito por C$ 7,000.00 córdobas, para capital de trabajo. 
Sus condicones de vida así como sus garantias se han reforzado, su esposo se dedica a la reparacion de reloj de pulso, donde éste le ayuda con los gastos del hogar que basicamente es para los dos ya que no tiene hijos menores.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Kolab

texts.en:
Mrs. Kolab P. is a grocer in Kveth Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a 24-year-old married woman. She has one child who is too young to work or attend school.

Her husband, Mr. Se San, is a construction worker in Thailand.

Since her current business is going well, Mrs. Kolab P. has decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery goods to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Married with a child who has successfully completed high school, Elizabeth is forty years old. She sells home products, like cooking utensils, plastic bowls, buckets, and plates. She makes her sales by "hawking," which is door-to-door sales.

Elizabeth is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to build a shop to house her goods. She wants to use this loan to buy stock of plastic materials and kitchen sets to sell to her customers. She is a member of the community group called Yesu Nimenidaso Group, meaning God is My Hope. In this group, members assist one another to provide support in handling repayment. She is pictured here after a group meeting.

loans.use: To buy stock of plastic materials and kitchen sets.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel G. sells liquid soap and detergent at Elmina. He has a Senior High school education.  He is married and has three children. His wife is a trader. Emmanuel has been selling liquid soap and detergent since 2003. He is responsible for paying the children's school fees and other utility bills. His loan will be used to buy more chemicals to increase his production of detergent and the liquid soap. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to reinvest into the business so he can increase sales, which will increase his income.

loans.use: His loan will be used to buy more chemicals to increase production of the detergent and the liquid soap.

loans.name: Thinh

texts.en:
Mr. Thinh S. is a vegetable farmer in Angk Chey Village in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. 

He now faces a small problem because he does not have enough money to hire laborers to work on his field. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. He will use the rest of the loan to buy more pesticides and fertilizers to make his crop more productive. 

His wife, Mrs. Dul Sokon, helps him on the plantation. Mr. Thinh S. is 50 years old and the father of six children, four of whom assist their parents on the plantation while the remaining two attend the local school. 

His wife is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To hire laborers to work on the field and he would use the rest of the loan to buy more pesticides and fertilizers to make his crop more productive.

loans.name: Fumilayo

texts.en: Fumilayo is a photographer. She has her own photography studio. Fumilayo takes pictures at weddings, funerals, birthdays, and other ceremonies. She needs a loan of 140,000 naira ($1200) to purchase a digital computer printer and a generator. Her customers are asking for faster photo processing times, and she wants to meet this demand. Fumilayo is 34 years old. She is married and has three children. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support and LAPO MICROFINANCE for their business training.

loans.use: To buy a digital computer printer and generator

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
Adnan is a 58-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their five children. He has been selling sweets for ten years. He requested a loan of 1,000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase sugar, nuts and other merchandise. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on schedule.

Adnan is unique in his work because he sells good quality sweets. His clients are his friends and others. In the future, he plans to open a cake shop.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, nuts and other merchandise.

loans.name: Yoem

texts.en:
Yoem C., 33, is a resident of Kompong Cham Province.  He is a local construction supervisor that manages employees to provide his service.  He has been constructing for a long time and currently earns an average of $4 per day.  

Yoem is married to Heng Phalla whom is 30 years old.  She runs a little store in front of her house to sell items such as dessert, sweets, and ice-cream. She can earn $2 per day from her business.  Phalla is a good mother of four children; three of the children are single, and one child is married.  Two of her children work as dealers in a casino. 

She is a very responsible lady to her family; she's always providing them with what they need.  To earn additional income, Phalla and C. request a loan of $1000 to purchase different kinds of merchandise like rice to store and re-sell. 

(C.'s wife and his daughter are pictured, because Yoem was unavailable)

loans.use: To purchase different kinds of merchandise like rice to store and re-sell

loans.name: Edmund

texts.en: Edmund D. is married and has 2 children. He has received schooling through senior high. Edmund sells groceries and other food supplies at Nyankumasi near Cape Coast, which he has done since 2001. His wife is a trader and uses his income to pay for the children's school fees, rent, utility bills and other financial expenses . Edmund will use the loan to purchase more groceries and bags of rice, cooking oil and other food items to meet the increase in demand by her costumers. With the new profits from his expanded business, Edmund plans to reinvest back for the expansion of  his trade in groceries.

loans.use: Edmund will use the loan to purchase more groceries and bags of rice, cattons of cooking oil and other food items to meet the increase in demand by her costumers.

loans.name: Radjabali

texts.ru: Раджабали Ассаров 1959 года рождения  женат имеет 6 детей. Жена домохозяйка. Более 6 лет он продает диски и расширяет свой ассортимент. Его старший сын также участвует в бизнесе , но он продает кайсу (сушенный абрикос). Раджабали работает также  в киностудии Б. Гафурова, он оставляет кого либо из семьи  на продаже дисков а сам идет на работу, так он совмещает работу и бизнес. Кредит получает почти год, планирует получать в дальнейшем  кредит и расширять свой магазин, и помогать сыну в продажи кайсы.
texts.en:
Born in 1959, Radjabali A. is married and has 6 children. His wife is a homemaker. Radjabali has been selling music and video disks and expanding his assortment for well over six years. His oldest son is also an entrepreneur and sells kaisa (dried apricot). Radjabali also works at the B. Gafurov film studio. He leaves one of his family members to watch over the business while he is at work, and this is how he juggles work and business. He has been receiving loans for almost a year and plans to use this loan to expand his business and to help his son with kaisa sales.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Artesanos Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Artesanos inicia su sexto ciclo con 10 socias, todas ellas son de la comunidad de Huascahura, que se ubica a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta de animales, abarrotes en general, verduras, comida, artesanías en telar  y la agricultura, ganadería.

Como es el caso de Eudosia que es casada, tiene 50 años y 5 hijos, Eudosia viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región de donde compra animales que luego los beneficia y vende de casa en casa. Además los días sábados y domingos vende comida.

Mientras que Brigida es casada, tiene 43 años y 2 hijos, Brigida vende carne en la ciudad de Ayacucho, además Brigida tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, verduras.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de prestamos como 300 soles, 600soles, 900 soles, haciendo un total de 4,950 soles de prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra de arroz, azúcar, animales menores, verduras, lanas, tintes.

Los sueños de las socias son mejorar sus negocios, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos, tener mas capital para surtir sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Artesanos Communal Bank is requesting a 6th round of loans for its 10 members, all of whom are from Huascahura, a community located about 20 minutes from Ayacucho city. The group's members run a variety of businesses selling, for example, animals, groceries, vegetables, meals, or handmade textiles. Some also farm, and some raise livestock. Eudosia, for example, is 50 years old, married, and has 5 children. She travels to different fairs in the region, buying animals to sell from house to house in her neighbourhood. Additionally, on Saturdays and Sundays, she sells meals. Another member, Brigida, is 43 years old, married, and has 2 children. She sells meat in Ayacucho city and also, sells groceries and vegetables from her home. The group's members need loans of different amounts, loans of 300 soles, 600 soles, or 900 soles, depending on their businesses. In total, the group is asking for 4,950 soles from the Communal Bank. The loans will be used to buy supplies like rice, sugar, young animals, vegetables, wool and dye. All the members dream of improving their business, especially by having enough working capital for supplies. They also dream of providing a good education to their children.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, young animals, vegetables, wool and dye.

loans.name: Fuente De Vida - Group 1

texts.en:
Siliana Y. is this group's coordinator and she sells clothing. Usually the best-selling items are women's and children's clothing. Dominican women care very much about their appearance, and children's appearance speaks to others of their mother's care. Siliana tries to keep her clothes inventory as assorted as possible. This loan will help with that. Siliana wants to build on her clothing sales to become a successful boutique--one that generates enough profit for her to purchase a home for herself.

This group of five entrepreneurs has successfully repaid one loan through Esperanza International; therefore, this is their second loan request. This is the first loan they are requesting for funding through Kiva. Their businesses include a beauty salon and two small cafeterias.

Thank you for supporting this loan!

loans.use: To purchase clothing items for resale

loans.name: Jeselli

texts.en:
Mrs. Jeselli P. G. of P6 Capucao, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental is a secretary of MARVIR Manpower Agency based in Ozamiz City. She is married to Jessie G. and blessed with a child. Her husband has been a private van driver for almost six years. Her husband’s salary is not enough to support their daily needs, and that’s why she engaged in food vending to add to their income.

Regarding the background of the business, she started a buy and sell business when she was 17 years of age and started with a capital of Php 5,000 from her savings. Now, her business still exists and is progressing.

As a 3rd-time loaner, she is applying the amount of Php 20,000 to purchase additional stock for her business. She is planning to open a little store someday and to give her child a better education. She is very thankful to Paglaum MPC for the privilege given to small micro-entrepreneurs like her to obtain loans, insurance and savings.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her business

location.town: Ozamis-P6 Capucao, Ozamiz City, Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: With passion and love of cooking, that is Mrs. Elizabeth L., 30 years old of Migcanaway, Tangub City. She is married and blessed with one child. She is presently engaged in an eatery business located at the city Food Court. Her husband is a casual government employee of Tangub City Hall. Mrs. L. is the one who cooks the foods and at the same time serves their loyal customers who are the City Hall employees, Teachers, Private employees and even students of the city. They also serve snacks and accept catering services. With the help of their parents, they were able to establish this business with an initial capital of only PHP5,000.00. As a coop member, she has already availed multiple cycle of loans. Now, she is applying for the amount of PHP12,000.00 under the Regular loan program to add to her capital in her existing eatery business. Her dream and aspiration in life is to give her child a better future. For the business, she is hoping that someday she can avail a car loan to be used in the business and for family occasions. She is also thankful to PAGLAUM MPC for the savings education she learned from us and for the Program and Services.

loans.use: Additional capital for their eatery business

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita A. sells provisions and bottles of wines in retail. She is married, has 2 children and she is 35 years old. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN100, 000 to purchase more provisions and bottles of wine to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and bottles of wine to sell.

loans.name: Perm

texts.en:
Perm N., 46, is married and has four children. Three of her children are students while the oldest one is employed as a garment factory worker with a fair income.

N. is engaged in pig raising which is the primary income of the family. She and her husband have been involved in the same business at their house and, together, they can make a typical income of US$4 per day. However, her husband is also a motorbike repairman in addition to his current business to earn more income for his family.

N. has requested a loan of US$1,000 to purchase more pigs and, with the amount leftover, she wants to purchase a small phone shop for her son to sell mobile phones in a local market. She hopes that with the several businesses she and her family members operate, she will be able to better her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and to start a shop for her son to sell mobile phones

loans.name: Eyaa

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et mère d’un enfant, elle réside avec sa famille dans le quartier d’adidogomé, l’activité génératrice de revenu qu’elle exerce est le commerce de produits de premières nécessités, son stock de produits vivriers a baissé, elle souhaite se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter divers produits de premières nécessités. Avec ce qu’elle gagne de ce commerce, elle contribue aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
This lady is married and the mother of 1 child. She lives with her family in the Adidogomé neighborhood. Her income-generating activity is selling staples. Her stock of foodstuffs is low so she needs to replenish it. She is asking WAGES for a loan to buy various staple goods. With the income from her business, she contributes supporting her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of staple goods for re-sale

loans.name: Leordy

texts.en: Mrs. Leordy L. lives in Brgy. Lopez Jaena, a village located in Sagay City, Negros Occidental. Having five children made life challenging for Leordy and her husband. The need to feed, clothe, shelter and educate their children made Leordy even more determined to help her husband support their family so that her children would not be disadvantaged. Having no idea where to get capital, Leordy was stumped until a friend invited her to join NWTF-Project Dungganon where she could have access to non-collateral loans to start her business. With her first loan, Leordy put up a small "sari-sari" or general store and was able to help her husband with the basic necessities of their family. Leordy discovered that she had the talent to run a business. A few years later, with the profits she earned from her general store and subsequent loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she was able to expand her business to include a small "carinderia" or eatery that sells cooked food to her neighbors. She now earns about PHP 45,000 per month from her various business activities. For her 8th loan, Leordy wants to borrow PHP 11,000 to add to her capital so that she can sustain the momentum of her businesses. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store and carinderia

loans.name: Norlan Jose

texts.es: El joven Norlan José López de 29 años de edad,  es transportista de taxi pues le ha trabajado a su hermano por cinco años, pero gracias al esfuerzo de sus ahorro logro recoger y poder comprar el taxi para trabajarlo por cuenta propia. Es soltero y reside junto con sus padres en el barrio Villa Venezuela en la capital de Managua,  sus planes es mejorar la vivienda de sus padres. Con este crédito quiere pintar el taxi y darle mantenimiento para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Da las gracias a la institución por apoyar a  hacer más rápido sus objetivos y poder comenzar atrabajar. A futuro espera lograr tener otra unidad de taxi para obtener mejores beneficios.

loans.use: pintar el vehiculo y darle mantenimiento

loans.name: Vera

texts.en: Vera is married with one child. She sells children's shoes at two locations - an open market and a small store where she rents space. Vera has been in this business for 10 years. A large assortment and low prices help Vera attract new and retain old clients. Children's shoes are always in high demand giving Vera the opportunity to develop her business further. Vera would like to borrow 17,000 UAH to purchase new inventory for the fall. Vera's goal is to make enough money to take care of her family.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Rasse

texts.pt:
Rasse nasceu no distrito municipal da caT. (a sul da baia de Maputo), tem 56 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 5 filhos quatros dos quais maiores idade e a ultima de 12 anos freqüenta escola na vila de boane. Rasse não teve oportunidade de freqüentar escola devido ao mito de que ˝ escola é para somente rapazes˝. Vive na casa própria com mais um sobrinha e dois sobrinhos órfãos de pais. 

Rasse é filha de pais camponeses e saiu da caT. para boane em 1969 logo após o casamento tradicional (lobolo) e passou a viver na vila de boane. É comerciante (vende hortícolas e cereais) desde o ano de 1970 e trabalha sem empregados. O seu marido é também camponês (sem emprego formal nem reforma) e ajuda a esposa na actividade, às vezes. Rende por mês aprox. 5.200,00mt que aplica no sustento da família.

 Nunca teve empréstimos com outras instituições e este é o seu quarto crédito no valor de 20.000,00MT para compra e venda de hortícolas e cereais na vila de boane em frente ao mercado do conselho executivo local.
