Tiene mas de 15 anos de experiencia; antes de que su hermano le prestara ese terreno ella sobrevivia haciendo dulce, Elotes Cocidos, Sopa de Mondongo.
Actualmente tambien se dedica a la crianza de Gallinas y al engorde de Cerdos; parte de sus ingresos provienen de Costa Rica, pues uno de sus hijos esta alla viviendo.
Ella actualmente tambien se dedica a la compra / venta de granos basicos, por lo que utilizara este credito para comprar mas inventario sobre todo de Maiz.
Su meta es lograr vender abarrotes y seguir con la compra/venta de granos basicos.
texts.en:
Julia C. is from El Chilincocal region, in Esteli department.  She is 49 years old, a single mother, and has 3 children.

Julia started out in this line of business with her family as her brother emigrated to the neighboring country of Costa Rica and lent her a plot of land so that she could plant on it.  Julia has more than 15 years of experience.  Before her brother lent her the plot of land, she survived making sweet pastries, cooked corn and tripe soup.  She also currently raises hens and fattens pigs.  Part of her income comes from Costa Rica since one of her children is living there.  In addition, Julia currently buys and sells basic grains and she will use this loan to buy more inventory, above all corn.  Her goal is to manage to sell groceries as well and to continue buying and selling basic grains.

loans.use: To sow basic grains

loans.name: Lino

texts.es: El señor Lino nacido el 10 de Diciembre  en Valle grande casado con la Sra. Ana  con 2 hijos ambos mayores, hoy viven en sombrerito trabajan en la agricultura junto a su esposa y sus hijos,  siembran arroz, maíz, también tienen una quinta de achachairu y plátano todo lo que cosechan sacan a vender al mercado de Santa Cruz, con el dinero del crédito desean comprar plantas cítricas para la siembra ya que vieron que hay mucha ganancias con estas plantas, como la naranja, mandarina, etc., el Sr. Lino es una persona muy trabajadora desde muy pequeño se dedico a esta actividad y ya tiene mucho conocimientos sobre la tierra y las plantas, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mr. Lino was born in the village 10 de Diciembre in the Grand Valley. He is married, and he and his wife Ana have two adult children. Now he lives in Sombrerito and works as a farmer alongside his wife and children. They grow rice, corn, acachairu ( a small fruit from the mangosteen family), and plantains. They plant and harvest all these crops and then bring them to the market in Santa Cruz. With the loan money they hope to buy citrus plants like oranges, mandarines, etc. to expand their farm. Mr. Lino is a very hardworking man, and he has worked in agriculture since he was a young boy. He has a great store of knowledge about soil and plants. He is thankful for the support offered by this institution.

loans.use: Purchase of citrus plants

loans.name: Myline

texts.en:
Myline C. is from the village of Quary, Pagalungan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 18 years old. Myline is single and has an infant. To make a living, Myline owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack food & biscuits.  Myline has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Myline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myline is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods & snack foods. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Myline from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products, like canned goods and snack foods, to sell

location.town: Quary, Pagalungan, Cagayan de Oro City

loans.name: Esperanza Estela

texts.es: Doña Esperanza Estela tiene su negocio que es la venta y elaboración de dulces.  Tiene más de 41 años en este negocio, por lo que no es el primer financiamiento que realiza, ya que le han sido de gran ayuda. Inicio este medio de vida, por su propio esfuerzo, ha sido admirable que ha mantenido este negocio a su edad, a pesar de todas las dificultades que enfrenta con los precios de los productos más caros. Esto no la desanima ya que solicita ayuda por medio de un financiamiento y poder comprar materia prima azúcar, coco, bolsas, colorantes entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Doña Esperanza Estela has a business preparing and selling sweets. She has more than 41 years of experience in this business. This is not the first time she has received financing and the loans have been a great help. Esperanza started as a result of her own effort, so it is admirable that she has been able to maintain her business at her age. Despite all the difficulties she has faced, including the cost of supplies becoming more expensive, she is not discouraged.

She is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as sugar, cocoa, bags, food coloring, and other items.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy sugar, cocoa, bags, food coloring, and other items

loans.name: Azarias

texts.en: Azarias is 41 years old. He has 5 children who are between the ages of 6 and 16 years old. He sells a variety of fabric and he is requesting a loan to buy more fabric. With the profits together with his savings, he plans to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Armandina

texts.es:
Armandina tiene 36 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su familia en el sector Urrunaga del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz. Uno de los distritos más poblados de la región Lambayeque, caracterizado principalmente por tener altos índices de pobreza, ya que las personas viven generalmente en zonas urbanas marginales que carecen de servicios básicos.

Se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir en general. Ella ofrece estos productos tanto al crédito como al contado y los ofrece principalmente entre sus vecinos y conocidos. Esta actividad es de mucha ayuda para la economía de su familia y se vale de ella para ayudar al mantenimiento de su economía diaria.

Armandina  desea adquirir más mercadería para ampliar su negocio. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a realizar su objetivo.

Armandina es una joven bastante trabajadora y empeñosa, las personas que le conocen admiran sus ganas de salir adelante y progresar.
texts.en:
Armandina, 36, is married living with her family in the Urrunaga sector of José Leonardo Ortiz District, one of Lambayeque’s most crowded districts, known for its high poverty index since its residents generally live in marginal urban zones that lack basic utilities.

She sells clothing in general.  She sells both for cash and on credit especially among her neighbors and acquaintances.  This activity is of great help to her family’s economy and she relies on it to help maintain her daily economy.

Armandina would like to get more merchandise to expand her business.  Because of this she has thought it would be convenient to request a 1000 new sol loan to help her reach her goal.

Armandina is a hard working, dedicated young woman.  People who know her admire her drive to get ahead and progress.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Ronaldo

texts.en:
Ronaldo C. is from the village of Estrada, Quezon, Isabela. He is 29 years old. Ronaldo is married and has one infant child. Ronaldo raises pigs for breeding. As a beginner in the business he only earns 3500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2011, Ronaldo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to do business. Ronaldo is requesting a  loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ronaldo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About ASKI: 

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco is 52 years old and has seven children.  Francisco is married and has three children who are still in school. She is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Francisco requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Francisco has been farming vegetables for nine years now and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Francisco would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela is 38 years old and has two children who are in school. Carmela is married.

Carmela is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Carmela requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer for her vegetable garden.

Carmela has been farming vegetable for seven years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Carmela would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Sorm

texts.en: Mrs Sorm is a 55-year-old village woman who has been a rice farmer since before she was married. Her husband is a local fisherman. She currently sells fresh fish that she gets from her husband or that she buys from her wholesale supplier and other fishermen. She runs her business in the market and is earning approximately $1.55 a day. The humble couple has three children, one of whom is single and the remaining two are already married. As the rainy season approaches, it is a good time for Mrs Sorm to begin planting her rice crop. Therefore, she is applying for a loan to pay for her field to be ploughed as she has done in previous years.

loans.use: to pay for ploughing costs.

loans.name: Prophète Plus Group

texts.en:
Prophète Plus is a community bank made up of nine micro-entrepreneurs whose chairman is JP. These members are united for the same goal to grow their businesses by loans received from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC. 

JP sells soft drinks in his area located in the eastern area of Kinshasa. He has been in the business world for years, selling the same product. After hard work and good management, he succeeded in making it thrive thanks to the accumulated profits. He is a loyal client of IMF HOPE RDC who has already received seven different loans and has repaid them properly. 

He intends to reinforce the capital with the next loan by adding some more crates of soft drinks. The business gives him a profit of $70.00 every week. 

JP’s ambition is to open a soft drink facility in his environment. He is 37 years old, married and the father of four children whose ages vary between 3 and 15 years old. All of them attend school.

loans.use: to purchase some more crates of soft drinks to resell at a profit.

loans.name: Noun

texts.en:
Noun, pictured here, is a construction worker. His wife, Thoun, stays at home and does housework. The couple lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penn City. They have four daughters.

Noun is requesting a Kiva loan to improve and organize his house by building a brick room. He has decided to request another Kiva loan for the purpose of laying brick and plastering the ceiling and wall to visually enhance his home.

loans.use: to enhance his home by building a brick room

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LA AMISTAD DE OLLANTAYTAMBO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 33 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanía, ella tiene una tienda donde vende mantas,gorros,chompas y muñecas, la socia trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,ella tiene una estación del distrito de Ollantaytambo que los trenes salen al distrito de Machupicchu,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de artesanías. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía al por mayor como materiales para hacer las muñecas.
 
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “La Amistad de Ollantaytambo” (The Ollantaytambo Friendship) Communal Bank.  The bank is in the Ollantaytambo district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

This member is 33 years old, married, and has two children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business of selling handicrafts.  She has a store where she sells blankets, hats, sweaters, and dolls.  She works from 9:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.  She has a station in the Ollantaytambo district where the trains go to the Machupicchu district.  Through this business she has gotten her children ahead.

This member wants to expand her business of selling handicrafts.  She is requesting the loan to buy wholesale arts and crafts like materials for making dolls.

She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy wholesale arts and crafts like materials for making dolls.

loans.name: Helene

texts.en: Helene is a 23-year-old single woman living with her parents and one sibling. She is from Lebanon. In 2007, she started to work as a beauty specialist. Her business is based in her home. In addition, she works as a freelance beautician. Her work is very important because she helps her father with the family expenses. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase her inventory of beauty products. In the future, she is planning to open a formal beauty salon in order to expand her business level.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of beauty products

loans.name: Perlibeth

texts.en:
Perlibeth is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 2 children.  Perlibeth has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.  Perlibeth has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Perlibeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: Lisbeth

texts.es:
Lisbeth nació en la ciudad de Urubamba (Cusco, Perú) y tiene 34 años de edad. Ella tiene una relación de libre unión de la cual tiene dos hijos. Actualmente, ella vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades. Su actividad económica principal es ser docente y su actividad secundaria es vender ropa por catalogo.  Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. El crédito que requiere Lisbeth es para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo ropa intima de mujer.

El Banco Comunal “Señor de los Milagros de Urubamba” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Urubamba (Cusco, Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Lisbeth was born in the city of Urubamba (Cusco, Peru) and is 34 years old.  She has a common-law marriage and has two children.  Currently she lives and works in the same city where she was born.  Her primary economic activity is teaching, and her secondary job is selling clothing by catalog.  She has done this work for many years and it is going very well.  

Lisbeth will use this loan to purchase merchandise, including women's underwear. 

The Señor de los Milagros de Urubamba community bank meets every 30 days in the city of Urubamba (Cusco, Peru).  Cusco is known for its tourism and commercial activities, including the traditional feast of Inti Raymi and because it is located near one of the seven wonders of the world, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise, for example, women's underwear.

loans.name: Saren

texts.en: Saren, 38 year old, is making flat baskets to sell with her husband, earning an income of $5 per day. They have three children, one is studying and the other two are working in the factory making $3.50 per day. Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $20 on school fees, $6 on transportation, $12 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy a motorbike for the family to use and for her to transport baskets to sell. In the future, she wants to repair her house, and send all of her children to study at least through high school.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her family to use and to sell her baskets.

loans.name: Mario Rene

texts.es:
Mario, vive con su mamá y sus hermanos, es soltero, es empleado en el pollo campestre, tiene un horario rotativo, y administra una tienda de productos de primera necesidad y su madre se encarga de atenderla.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar mercadería el cual le permitirá crecer y tener una mejor atención a los clientes y de esa manera obtener mejores ingresos para su familia, la compra especificamente sera en arroz, frijoles, aceite, pan y huevos.
El sueño de Mario es que su negocio crezca y que su familia viva bien.
texts.en:
Mario is single and lives with his mother and siblings.  He's an employee of the Pollo Campestre restaurant and has a variable schedule. He also runs a store of basic household goods that his mother is responsible for tending.

He will use the loan to buy merchandise that will allow him to grow and give his customers better service and, in this way, have better earnings for his family.  Specifically, he will buy rice, beans, oil, bread, and eggs.

Mario's dream is for his business to grow and his family to live well.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, bread, and eggs.

loans.name: Tuvshinbat

texts.en:
Tuvshinbat is 26 years old and lives with his daugther and wife in a house in Govisumber province in Mongolia. His wife sells goods at the local market. 

Tuvshinbat started his business in 1991 by selling Russian ice cream at the local train station. He followed his mother who was also selling ice cream. He buys Russian ice cream that costs between 100,000 MNT and 120,000 MNT from Ulaanbaatar City and sells it on the train and in the train station. He is well-acquainted with the railway staff members. 

Tuvshinbat bought a 6,000,000 MNT house by paying 500,000 MNT each month. He has already paid 4,000,000 MNT for the house. He would like to expand his business. He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to grow his business and rent a sales stall.

loans.use: To rent a new sales stall for his business.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert, aged 41, is a farmer and father of four aged between 19 and 8 years. He lives with the family in their hometown of  Litein South Rift Kenya. He has been in mixed farming for 10 years producing tea, milk and eggs for the local markets. Robert has made a loan request of 52,000 KES from Kiva parter Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says he will use the income to educate his four children who are all currently in schoo,l as well as to repay the loan. He says there are prospects for business growth despite fluctuations in market prices — especially for milk.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 50 years old and has seven children. Thelma is married. Two of her children are in school.

Thelma is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Thelma requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Thelma has been raising pigs for 10 years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Thelma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Salveri

texts.en: Salveri needs another loan to buy cosmetics to sell.  He operates a retail shop and was able to purchase a motorcycle with his previous loan.  He believes in multiple businesses and now wants to venture into cosmetics sales.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Veronica Natividad

texts.es:
Verónica Natividad es casada tiene un hijo, vive con el esposo y con el hijo de un año de edad en Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.
La VRC la florida está conformada por 12 socios y socias esta ubicada en el Cantón Chillanes a 5 minutos de la oficina.
Verónica se dedica a la Agricultura a la siembra de maíz y fréjol las compras y las ventas lo realizan en Chillanes cada semana.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes. Con la ayuda del préstamo mejorará el producto.
El sueño es poder dar la educación al hijo y pueda culminar los estudios. Los desafíos  que se le presentaron son los intermediarios.
En los tiempos libres le gusta escuchar música y disfrutar de las festividades de Santa Rita, se considera una persona tranquila, trabajadora y amable.
texts.en:
Verónica Natividad is married and has one son. She lives with her husband and one-year-old son in Chillanes, in Bolívar Province. 

The “la Florida” communal bank has 12 members and is located in Chillanes Canton five minutes from the office. Veronica makes a living in agriculture, planting corn and beans. She buys and sells in Chillanes every week. She is asking for the loan to buy manure and fertilizer. With the help of this loan, she will improve her products. 

Her dream is to be able to provide her son with an education and that he finishes school. The challenge she faces is with middlemen. 

In her free time, she likes to listen to music and enjoy the Saint Rita Day celebrations.  She considers herself to be a calm, hardworking, and friendly person.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fertilizer

loans.name: Edneyda Virginia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal "LAS LEONAS DE SAN JERONIMO", este banco se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de San Jeronimo, en la Provincia y Deparatamento de Cusco.

La socia  es contadora de profesión, la socia también vende productos por catalogos de belleza; ella se dedica a varias actividades como la preparación de chocolates, ella realiza figuras con relleno y sin relleno, fuentes de chocolate para coberturas, la socia tambien realiza manualidades; la socia desea en esta ocasion el prestamo para invertir en la compra de productos para elaborar los chocolates dulces, tambien invertira una parte en la compra de productos de belleza como cremas, perfumes, labiales por catalogos para tener en reserva. La socia invertira el credito en la compra d eproductos por catalogo y de mercaderia para su chocolateria.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the communal bank "LAS LEONAS DE SAN JERONIMO" ["The Lionesses of San Jeronimo"]. The bank is located in the district of San Jeronimo, in the province and department of Cusco.

The borrower is an accountant by profession, and she also sells products from beauty catalogs. She also works in various activities such as the preparation of chocolates. She makes shapes with fillings and without fillings, and chocolate fountains for glazing. She also makes handicrafts. On this occasion, the borrower would like a loan to invest in buying ingredients to prepare sweet chocolates. She will also invest a portion in buying beauty products such as creams, perfumes, and lipsticks by catalog to have in reserve. The borrower will invest the loan in buying products by catalog and in supplies for her chocolate business.

loans.use: to buy beauty products from a catalog and supplies for her chocolate business.

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en:
Pheap is 42 years old, widowed with two dependent children who are still in school. They assist her on the farm during their spare time. She has been farming her rice field as a primary source of income for about 25 years in a village located in the Ponhea Krek district. She supplements her income by raising pigs. She manages to earn less than 5 U.S. dollars per day.

With her current business, she is requesting her first loan with VisionFund. She will use this loan to buy more piglets for her pig raising business. She hopes to generate more income from this business and make a better living and also keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for her pig-raising business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Kibui

texts.en:
Kibui is a 70-year-old businessman, and he is married to Margaret who is a farmer. They are blessed with two children. He has been selling foodstuffs for the past ten years, which earns him a monthly income of about KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his fourth loan with KADET after repaying his previous loans successfully. Kibui will use the loan to buy foodstuffs for his business. With the anticipated profit he will expand the business. 

His hopes and dreams are to open a big retail shop and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs for his business.

loans.name: Alaa'

texts.en:
Alaa' is a 20-year-old young woman. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary.

Alaa' and her husband want to establish an olive and almond farm around their house. Alaa' wants to share with her husband in preparing well by purchasing olive and almond seedlings to cultivate on the farm, but Alaa' hasn't enough money to pay, so she needs to take a loan from FATEN. When Alaa' gets the loan, she will be able to share with her husband in purchasing the seedlings and preparing well the farm to get a better crop. This will increase the farm crop and increase their sales which will lead to an increase in the family income and offer to them better living conditions.

Alaa' is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase olive and almond seedlings

loans.name: Mwanamkasi

texts.en:
Mwanamkasi is applying for another loan to expand her existing business. She will use this 50,000 KES loan to purchase more stocks of Irish potatoes, green yams, cooking oil and charcoal for her business. In the future, Mwanamkasi aspires to continue improving her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Mwanamkasi has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of Irish potatoes, green yams, cooking oil and charcoal for her business

loans.name: José Haroldo

texts.es:
José Haroldo habita en el municipio de El Sauce una ciudad donde la cultura de ser un buen ciudadano se mantiene. 

José Haroldo Es un adulto de 62 años de edad cuenta con un hijo bajo su cargo, con lo único que cuenta es su buena moral crediticia, su responsabilidad y honradez en toda sus labores, sus principales ingresos que recibe es como maestro. 

Se presento a Ceprodel a solicitar su octavo crédito para mejorar las condiciones de vida familiar, se siente  agusto porque Ceprodel y Kiva siempre lo han apoyado en las diferentes necesidades que él ha presentado en su familia para poder salir adelante. 

Por tal Razón solicita en octavo crédito para la compra de un TV de de 21 Pulgada y un equipo de sonido esto será la de un buen beneficio para su familia que tanto ama y estima.
Se siente agradesido porque kiva y Ceprodel le financio un credito anterior para mejorar la salud de su esposa y gracias a ellos a mejorado mucho y espera en Dios seguir recibiendo estos privilegios.
texts.en:
José Haroldo se Llama la Joven, who lives in the town of El Sauce, a city that maintains the culture of good citizenship.

José Haroldo, a 62 year old adult, has a son who is dependent on him. With all that matters his good credit morals, his sense of responsibility and honesty in everything he does, he earns his principal income as a teacher.

He appeared at Ceprodel to request his eighth loan to improve his family’s living conditions.  He feels comfortable because Ceprodel and Kiva have always supported him in meeting the different needs his family has had so they can get ahead. Consequently, he is requesting an eighth loan to purchase a 21 inch T.V. and a sound system.  This will be a blessing for his family that he loves and esteems so much.

He is grateful because Kiva and Ceprodel financed an earlier loan for him to improve his health and thanks to them he has improved greatly and he hopes with God’s help to continue receiving these privileges.

loans.use: to purchase a 21 inch T.V. and a sound system.

loans.name: Elsy

texts.en:
Elsy owns a small store in her neighborhood where she sells foods such as rice, sugar and oil. Her neighbor gave her moral support to open this store because she realized there was not much competition in her sector of the community. Before opening the store she worked in a plastic factory but had to leave her children unattended at home. 5 years ago she decided to start this microenterprise because it would give her the flexibility to be with her family and would also provide for them. She is separated from her husband and is therefore a single mother of 3. She will use the loan to diversify and increase her product offerings.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy a larger variety of items to sell and purchase at wholesale prices

loans.name: Mworia

texts.en: J. Mworia 35 year-old community health nurse who runs a clinic in Meru, Eastern Province, Kenya. He wore a smile on his face when he heard the news that he can access a loan to improve the quality of services at his clinic. He runs a rural clinic that serves also as a point of referral for other clinics. So many clients now come to Mworia’s clinic that two other clinics that used to operate within the same area have had to relocate to different sites, due to their reduced number of clients. He intends to use the loan to establish a fully equipped minor surgery theatre, renovate, and create more space.

loans.use: Expand and improve health services

loans.name: Abdurrahman

texts.en: Abdurrahman lives in Kongowe area in Dar es Salaam. He is married with three children. He owns a shop selling soft drinks in retail and wholesale. He has another business of selling fruits and vegetables of which his wife is in charge. Soft drinks business has higher turnover in his shop, mainly caused by hot weather of Dar es Salaam. Demand for soft drinks is high. Abdurrahman cannot meet this demand. He is in need of $1200 as a working capital to meet the demand for cold drinks. The more sales he makes will enable him get extra income for paying school fees for his children and improve his income level.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks for his store

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Mrs. V., despite her young age, has become an expert in the manufacture of rosquillas (ring-shaped pastries popular in Nicaragua). She is originally from Somoto, a village to the north of Managua, famous for making the best rosquillas in the country. She would use the loan to buy raw materials (flour, corn, sugar, and so on). She hopes that the loan will help her improve her economic outlook and better her family's standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio P, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. V. es una empresaria jóven que a su corta edad es ya toda una especialista en elaborar rosquillas, es originaria de somoto, un pueblo al norte de managua que se ha caracterizado por ser la ciudad donde se elaboran las mejores rosquillas del país. Esta solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en materiales que necesita para elaborar sus productos (harina, maíz, azúcar, etc.). Espera que el crédito la ayude a mejorar su condición económica y a sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her pastries

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh (40) and his wife Huyen (28) are originally from a town near Hanoi in the north of Vietnam. They moved to Tanh Linh in hopes of being able to make a better living for themselves. Finding work was initially very difficult, so they asked for a loan in order to get started. The lender they received the loan from charged an exorbitant interest rate, which left them stuck in poverty.

Huyen runs a small grocery store in the front of their home and Thanh works as a day laborer. Huyen is able to earn between 10-15,000 VND (US$ 0.62-$ 0.94) per day. Thanh earns about 30,000 VND per day (about $1.85 US), but he is not always able to find work. With the loan from Mekong Plus and Kiva, they can save more of their money and not spend it paying interest on a loan. They are trying to raise 2 children, H. Thi Tuyet Loan (8) and H. Minh Cong (4).

loans.use: to expand their little grocery store

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Mrs. Comfort I.  said that she will be happy if you can loan her the amount of $400 because it will enable her to improve her business by buying more yams for sale. She is 58 years old and a widow with four children.  She started this business in 2002 and she learned it for three months before beginning. She has been a LAPO member for three years.

loans.use: To buy more yams for sale

loans.name: Thi Nhuan

texts.en: Ms Nhuận is 49 years old. She lives in Phú Mẫn hamlet, Yên Phong, Bắc Ninh. She used to buy waste material like copper, brass, and metal and resell it to recycling companies. Today she raises chickens. She has a peep of more than 100 egg-laying chickens. She sells the eggs, and this is the main revenue for her family. She wishes to have the money to buy more chicken feed. She has applied to binhminh cdc (SEDA) for a loan, and she plans to pay the loan back in 6 months.

loans.use: To purchase feed for chicken.

loans.name: Wahid Allah

texts.en:
Wahid Allah lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and educated and lives with his own family. He is a property dealer who rents and sells houses and land. He has good experience and has worked in this business for over 8 years.

Wahid has the responsibility for supporting his family and he wants to expand his business so he wants to take an individual loan to complete his necessary materials so that he can launch his business to make good income for his family.

loans.use: To complete necessary materials

loans.name: Lenin Augusto

texts.es:
Lenin is 23 years old and is married with two sons ages four and one. He works as a team supervisor at an electrical company. His house is constructed out of two different materials: half concrete, half lumber. In his desire to advance, he has decided to seek financing to rebuild his home. With the loan, he will build the walls of his living room out of concrete. His wish is to provide his small children with a more decent life.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Lenin L. tiene 23 años de edad, casada, y con 2 hijos varones de 4 años y un año respectivamente. Trabaja como Supervisor de Brigada de una empresa de electricidad. Su casa de habitación es minifalda, mitad de concreto y mitad de tabla. En su afan por buscar la prosperidad, decidió buscar financiamiento pra empezar la reconstrucción de su casa, con el crédito va a construir los muros de la sala de habitación de concreto. Quiere darle una vida más digna a sus pequeños niños.

loans.use: Build concrete walls for living room.

loans.name: Khikoyat

texts.en: O. Khikoyat is 51 years old, married and has seven children. She works as a vendor, selling children's clothing from a rented storefront every day of the week except Friday, when she rises at 5 a.m. to go to a neighboring city to sell her goods in its local market. After years of hard work, O. has managed to make her business stable and generate significant income for her family. O. would like to buy more clothing to sell, and has come to us for a loan of $1,000 to make that possible. She is a repeat client of IMON, has a positive credit history, promises to repay the loan in a timely manner and wants to thank everyone for their support.

loans.use: To buy more children's clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in additional merchandise.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en: Leah M. is from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania.  She is 31 years old, married, and has one infant child.  Leah also cares for five dependents, who live with her because they are relatives.  In 2005, Leah established her stationary business. She now requires a  loan of $975 in order to buy additional stocks of stationary equipment.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of stationary equipment.

loans.name: Guadalupe Argelia

texts.es:
Guadalupe started her business because she has always liked retail. Before getting married, her parents owned a general store in which she always liked to work. Furthermore, this business allows her to receive extra income so that she can give her children everything they need for school. With this income, at the very least she helps out with her children’s educational expenses; her son attends college while her daughter attends middle school.

Six years ago, she started selling only bread rolls, candy, pork rinds, tostadas, and drinks, but she now has a well-stocked store.

She currently needs a loan of $500.00 USD, which she will repay in 5 months, in order to restock her store with groceries. With your help, this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Guadalupe inició el negocio ya que siempre le ha gustado el comercio y en su casa antes D. casarse sus papas tenian una tienda D. abarrotes y a elL. le gustaba estar en el negocio, ademas D. tener un ingreso extra y asi poder darle a sus hijos lo necesario para L. escueL. con esto minimo le ayuda a su esposo con los gastos diarios D. las tareas D. su hijo D. L. universidad y L. otra D. L. secundaria.

Comenzó hace aproximadamente hace 6 años inicio vendiendo solo bollos dulces chicharrones tostadas y refrescos y hoy en dia cuenta con una tienda bien surtida.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $500 que pagara en 5 meses para surtir abarrotes en general. Con tu ayuda esto sera posible.

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Ziyodullo

texts.en:
Ziyodullo R. is 29 years old. He is married with four children. Ziyodullo is a strong and persevering person, intent on improving his family’s standard of living.

Ziyodullo is a farmer, and he has been in this business for four years. He grows agricultural crops such as tomatoes, cucumbers, onions, potatoes, and wheat. His brothers help him with the business. Each year Ziyodullo grows a sufficient amount of crops for his family's consumption and to sell the rest of his yield for a profit. By generating a stable income, Ziyodullo is able to support his large family; however, sometimes his income is not enough to provide for the most elemental needs of the family because he supports not only his wife and children but also his brother and sister.

So, he wants to increase productivity on his plot, which requires an infusion of capital in order to produce a larger crop yield. Specifically, he is seeking a loan in the amount of $1,000 over a 10-month term, and the loan proceeds will be used to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers. With the loan, Ziyodullo believes he will be able to improve the family's home and standard of living in a short period of time. He thanks you for your support because your generosity can change his life.

loans.use: To increase his crop yield by purchasing additional seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema E. is 20 years old. She is a married a woman with 3 children. She became a milk and maize seller in 2006. Every day, she works from 8.30am to 6.30pm at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

Neema now hopes for a loan of $350 to buy more commodities for her business.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Phann

texts.en: This is the second time for Mrs. Phann S. to ask for a loan to improve her living conditions. She is a fruit seller and farmer in Kork Village in Kampong Chhnang Province.  On her plantation, Mrs. Phann S. now faces an obstacle because she does not have enough animals to plow the rice field, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy two oxen in order to plow the field to cultivate rice. Mrs. Phann S. is a 56-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is a farmer while the other is a fruit seller. Previously, Mrs. Phann S. had obtained a loan from AMK to start her current business. She has fully paid it back.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy two oxen in order to plow the field to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Thi Huong's Group

texts.vi:
chị Hoàng thị Hường Ms 09010010 năm nay 32 tuổi, hiện nay chị đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con nhỏ. Gia đình chị có rất nhiều hoạt động chăn nuôi tạo thu nhập như : chăn nuôi gà đẻ trứng, vịt đẻ, ngan thịt, chăn nuôi lợn nái, lợn thịt, bán vật liệu xây dựng... Ngoài việc chăn nuôi ra, hàng ngày chồng chị còn là một chủ thầu xây dựng. Nên thu nhập của gia đình chị khá ổn định từ 250.000 vnđ đến 300.000 vnđ / ngày,chị đã tham gia vay vốn qua một chu kỳ và hoàn trả rất tốt, đồng thời chị rất thích hình thức vay, trả này. Vì nó rất phù hợp với mục đích cũng như thu nhập của gia đình chị. Chu kỳ này chị đăng ký vay mức 4.256.000 VND để mua thức ăn cho lợn, gà, vịt. Trong nhóm chị có các thành viên sau :

  • anh Lê đắc Chỉnh Ms 09010007 vay mức 4.256.000 VND để chăn nuôi.
  • anh Lê đắc Tuyên Ms 09010016 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để mua cám gà đẻ.
  • chị Lê thị Hằng Ms 09010012 vay mức 4.256.000 VND để đi chợ và chăn nuôi.
  • chị Nguyễn thị Toán Ms 09010018 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để đi chợ mua sắt vụn.( trả trong 25 tuần )
  • chị Nguyễn thị Hiền Ms 09010017 vay 2.006.000 VND để bổ sung mua cám lợn.( Trả trong 25 tuần )

loans.use: vốn vay chăn nuôi

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea S., 48, is a rice farmer who lives with four children in the Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 1990, she has been growing rice to earn a living and is able to make less than one dollar per day. Normally, her farm provides just enough for the family and she does not usually sell rice for extra profit as annual output is low. Farmers almost totally depend on the sky to farm, as in most of the provinces, there are no irrigation systems yet. Currently, the weather conditions are getting better, but still in some places there is only light rain. Her husband, Mao Hun, 25, works planting vegetables at home and sells at the market to earn approximately US$3 in profits per day. Besides farming, they also raise pigs. Chea S. would like to take out a loan of US$300 to purchase feed for their pigs.

loans.use: To purchase feed for pigs.

loans.name: Ruth Elena

texts.es: Doña Ruth tiene 46 años de edad, habita en un barrio que se llama Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua, con tres hijos de 15,18 y 22 años de edad, dos estudian el mayor trabaja, la Sra. Ruth vende variados platillos de comida, y fritanga desde hade seis años en su casa, su mayor dificultad es en el invierno ya que donde vende la comida no hay techo y las lluvias hace que sus ventas bajen, inicio con financiamiento en afodenic  ya es su séptima solicitud y ha sido de gran beneficio para su familia ya que gracias a la oportunidad que le dio con el préstamo de invertir ha podido ayudar a sus hijos a que estudien y subsistir ya que con su esposo se separo y todos los gastos lo ha tenido que cubrir ella, con esta solicitud quiere hacer unas mejoras en el techo ya que su casa es bien baja y quiere levantar el techo, va a comprar perlines entre otros materiales, y reparar una puerta para tener mejor seguridad para su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Ruth is 46 years old, and lives in a neighborhood called Laureles Norte in the capital of Managua, with three children who are 15,18, and 22 years old. Two of her children study and the oldest works. Señora Ruth has sold various types of food and fried snacks from her house for six years. Her major difficulty is in the winter since where she sells the food there is no ceiling and the rains cause sales to drop. She began with a loan from Afodenic and this is her seventh loan request. It has already greatly helped her family. Thanks to the opportunity she has with the loan to invest, she has been able to help her children stay in school and survive, since she and her husband have separated and all of the expenses have had to be covered by her. With this request, she wants to make improvements to the roof, since her house is very short and she wants to raise the roof. She is going to buy timber for rafters amongst other materials, and repair a door in order to have better security for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to repair her roof.

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Maria del Socorro García, tiene la edad de 36 años habita en municipio de monimbo ubicado en la ciudad de Masaya, junto a su esposo Y  hijos, su esposo  trabaja para compartir los gastos del hogar; ya que con sus propios esfuerzos a logrado mantener la venta de verduras desde hace seis años pero la mayor dificultad que tiene es la falta de financiamiento. Los sueños de doña Maria es darles una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos, y mejorar el negocio para poder obtener mejores ganancia y a la vez invertir  en la compra de mas productos con esta solicitud de préstamo en Afodenic, lo cual espera sea de mucho beneficios,   para incrementen sus productos.
texts.en:
Maria del Socorro García is 36 years old, and lives in the Monimbo municipality located in the city of Masaya with her husband and children. Her husband works to help meet the household expenses. Through her own efforts, she has managed to maintain the sale of vegetables for six years now. Her biggest difficulty has been a lack of financing. Maria’s dreams are to provide better living conditions for her children, and to improve her business to generate greater earnings. At the same time, she would like to invest in the purchase of more products. With the request for this loan in Afodenic, which she hopes is very beneficial, she will increase the quantity of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Horm

texts.en: Mrs. Horm K. is a villager in Lor village in Kampong Chhnang province. She and her husband, Mr. Hong Suor, are farmers who own a piece of land to cultivate rice. In the plantation, they get little revenue to earn their living. Thus, Mrs. Horm K. decided to ask for a loan to buy a plot of land to cultivate rice. She hopes to increase income and improve living conditions with this loan. She is 40 years old and the mother of six children, two of whom are construction workers while another is employed in a garment factory. One is a farmer while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel A. is a 40-year-old married father of four children, all of whom are enrolled in a community school. Gabriel and his family live in a farming community called Abofour, a suburb of Offinso in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Abofour is a forest reserve area where most popular occupation is farming. There is a very high rate of illiteracy among adults in this community, and most families are only able to provide their children with a junior high school level education; this minimal education contributes to the high unemployment rate in Ghana, which is becoming a challenge for the government.

Gabriel is a seasoned farmer, having been farming cocoa and cereals such as maize for over five years. Through this he has managed to build a two-bedroom house in the village. In addition to operating his farm, Gabriel sells grocery products in a kiosk in the community in order to generate additional income to support his business.

However, he has been having difficulties with his farm because there is a disease attacking his cocoa crops. Therefore he is applying for loan assistance to buy implements such as fertilizers, agro-chemicals and spraying machines. This will allow him to harvest more this year and in the years ahead, thereby increasing his profits so he can better support his family and his children's education.

loans.use: To buy farming equipment and chemicals

loans.name: Nakate Alisha Group

texts.en:
Alisha is 37 years of age and married with four children. She rents a one-room house in which six people live. She does care for additional family as well. She has three meals a day and her greatest expense in a month is that of feeding her family.

She sells used shoes in the market and she works six days in a week. She normally receives about ten customers a day. She has been doing this particular type of business for eight years now. The challenge she faces is that her customers are seasonal. She mainly makes big sales during festive seasons.

She has been a member of MCDT for over five years now and chose to work with MCDT because it was easy for her to join. Most of all she wanted some capital to increase her stock and that is how she will use this loan. She also wants to construct rental apartments to improve on her income and wellbeing.

loans.use: To increase her stock of shoes.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
Viviana es socia del Banco Comunal Paloma.
Viviana es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 4 hijos, Viviana vende cebiche de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Santa Elena, para lo cual cuenta con un triciclo. Además Viviana vende cosméticos por catálogos.
Viviana necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de otro triciclo.
Los sueños de Viviana son que sus hijos sean profesionales y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Viviana is a member of the Paloma communal bank. She is married, 30 years old and has 4 children. Viviana has a mobile stand selling ceviche in the Santa Elena market, for which she uses a three-wheeled bike. She also sells cosmetics via mail-order. Viviana needs a loan of 800 Peruvian Soles, which will be invested in the purchase of another tricycle. Viviana's dreams are to build a house and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a three-wheeled bike for her business

loans.name: Thy

texts.en: Thy K., 31, is married with two young children. She lives with her husband in Sa Anng district, Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make US$2.5 of profit every day. They grow vegetables like radishes, beans, and corn. Two of their children are students. Mrs. Thy K. would like to take out a loan to purchase a motorbike so that she can transport her vegetables to the market to sell them.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to get her vegetables to market

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formó mediante otro comité de la misma Zona a la cual pertenece este, San Lorenzo. Todas son vendedoras de las ollas Essen que la estan vendiendo desde hace ya 3 años. 

Por mas que vendan el mismo producto todas poseen clientela formada y cada una tiene una zona especifica que explotar. Poseen buen relacionamiento entre todas.  

En la foto falta una integrante la cual se retiro antes por motivo que debia retirar las ollas para hacer entrega a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This committee grew from another committee in the same Zone, San Lorenzo, to which this one belongs. They are all sales women of Essen pots, which they have been selling for the last 3 years. Even though they sell the same product, the each have an established customer base and have a specific area that they cover. There is a good relationship among them all. The picture is missing a member because she had to leave to deliver pots to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The loans have been used to increase their capital and purchase of the products that they sell.

loans.name: Bembeya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Bembeya est composé de 3 monogames et d’une polygame avec en moyenne 32 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le quartier Djaka kin de Kirango Markala (4ème Région administrative de la république du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens  de voisinage et d’appartenance à une même association traditionnelle des femmes du quartier.  
Elles  font l’achat et la vente de  poisson sous toutes ses formes (frais, frit, fumé et séché). 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de  leur clientèle elles ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir bien remboursés les trois prêts précédents, elles sont à leur 4ème  prêt solidaire.
Ce nouveau prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, 171kg de poisson frais dont une partie est vendue fraîche en ambulant dans les quartiers de Kirango tandis que l’autre moitié est d’abord séchée dans un coin de la maison à l’aide d’un séchoir traditionnel avant d’être vendue. Elles se ravitaillent en poisson frais uniquement sur les berges du fleuve Niger à Kirango avec leurs maris qui sont des  pêcheurs connus dans les zones de pêche de Kirango. Le poisson ainsi obtenu est revendu au comptant et à crédit dans les foires de Diamarabougou, Dougabougou et Siribala à une clientèle majoritairement composée de femmes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17500 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour l’épargne et l’augmentation de leur fonds de commerce.
Elles ont pour ambition d’entreprendre le petit élevage et acheter un congélateur pour pouvoir conserver  plus longtemps le poisson frais et vendre  également de la glace.
texts.en:
The group Bembeya is composed of three monogamous women and one polygamous woman who average 32 years of age and 3 children each. They all live in the Djaka Kin district of Markala (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali), and they know one another through ties of community and membership in the same traditional women's association in the area. The group members buy and sell fish in all forms (fresh, fried, smoked, and dried). Concerned about satisfying their customers, they decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. After having repaid the three preceding loans, they are on their fourth solidarity loan. This new loan will be used to buy 171 kg of fresh fish, a portion of which is sold fresh door-to-door in the Kirango area, while the the other portion is first dried in a corner of the house using a traditional dryer and then sold. Supplies of fresh fish are gotten only on the banks of the Niger River in Kirango from their husbands who are recognized fishermen in fishing zones of Kirango. The fish thus obtained is resold, cash or credit accepted, at the fairs of Diamarabougou, Dougabougou, and Siribala, to customers composed mostly of women. The group members each hope to realize an average monthly profit of 17,500 francs CFA that will be put into savings and used to augment their working capital. Their ambition is to embark on small-scale livestock farming, to buy a freezer in order to preserve fresh fish for longer, and also to sell ice.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Fati

texts.en: Fati U. sells provisions such as Milo, sugar, canned fish, and other good provisions in Abura. Fati has a junior high education. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a driver whose income is too low to support the family. Fati has been selling provisions for four years. She is responsible for feeding the children and clothing the family. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions to sell. She hopes to use the new profits to re-invest in her business.

loans.use: To buy provisions to sell

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en:
Mavis A. is thirty years old and the married mother of three children – all sons. She says they are all in the primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a commercial town in the Western region called Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso. Mavis is a hardworking woman. She works to support her husband financially. Her husband is a farmer while she trades.

Mavis sells drinks made form Milo (a milk beverage) and other provisions. She hawks (sells door-to-door) to sell the iced cocoa drinks with bread in her community and also treks to other markets to sell. Mavis buys groceries such as Milo, sugar, milk, etc. to make the beverage.

Mavis has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy more provisions to expand her business. She is hopeful to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to expand her business

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong R. (pictured with his wife) is 26 years old and owns a trailer-motorbike. He uses it to run a taxi. He normally picks up passers-by, tourists, and merchandise for a profit. 

His wife has had a job as a poultry seller. They have been married for years but have no children. 

Kong R.'s existing taxi is a small width so he can transport a few people only. He hopes to replace this taxi by using a Kiva loan to purchase a new one. This will help him to increase his income and better meet his family's daily expenses.

loans.use: To replace his existing taxi.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Cette femme est une infirmière, afin d’aider les personnes disposant de peu de moyens à pouvoir se soigner en ayant accès aux médicaments, elle a entamé la vente de produits génériques. Elle arrive ainsi à aider beaucoup de monde. Le stock de produits génériques dont elle dispose étant en baisse, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 4 cartons de produits comprimés, des produits sirops, des  injectables et divers produits génériques.
texts.en:
This woman is a nurse. She started selling generic drugs in order to help people with little means look after themselves by having access to medication. She thus manages to help a lot of people. Since her stock is low, she is requesting a loan through WAGES to purchase four boxes of tablets, syrups, injectables and various generic pharmaceutical products.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase generic pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For growing corn

loans.name: Esna Nicida

texts.en:
Nicida is 42 years old and is married with two children. She has a business selling vegetables and other grocery items at the Bellavista Market, a massive, chaotic marketplace near the center of the city of Pucallpa, where she and her family live. Nicida also sells french fries, hot dogs and fried chicken from a cart in front of her home in the evenings.  Nicida’s husband is an entrepreneur with an independent business.

Nicida has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for three years and is a member of the communal bank “Virgen de la Natividad.”  She plans to invest this loan of 3,000 soles in purchasing vegetables, olives, oil, pasta and other products for sale.  

Nicida’s goal is to have a good amount of capital in order to expand her evening food sales business.

loans.use: To purchase food products to sell at the market

loans.name: Jany

texts.es:
Jany  es una mujer extrovertida y muy colaboradora, ella tiene 23 años de edad,es soltera, estudia educación para nivel inicial; también se dedica a la costura, trabaja junto a  su tía en la confección de hamacas, hace flores y bisutería. Ella vive con sus padres  y les ayuda en los gastos familiares. Es integrante del Banco Comunal “Las Heroínas”, donde forma parte hace tres años, su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles y lo utilizó para solventar gastos del hogar, sus estudios y en la compra de materiales para confeccionar hamacas. 
Con este crédito de S/. 1,500, comprará telas para confeccionar hamacas, cabo y pretinas. La meta  de Jany tener sus propias máquinas para poder confeccionar las hamacas y poder exportar y también tener un local propio.

loans.use: Invertirá en telas para confeccionar hamacas, cabo y pretinas.

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es: Mayra es una mujer jovial y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa provincia de Coronel Portillo, tiene 22 años y es madre de una pequeña de un añito, ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas, paralelamente vende ropa de segundo uso, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es chofer de motocarro(propio). Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazareth” desde hace cuatro años, el primer crédito que obtuvo fue de 300 soles que invirtió en gaseosas, ahora necesita un crédito de 1200 que será utilizado para invertir en golosinas. La meta de Mayra es tener una tienda de prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Mayra is a cheerful and hardworking woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa, in the province of Coronel Portillo. She is 22 years old and the mother of a one-year-old daughter. She has a business selling snacks, and she also sells used clothing. She enjoys full support from her husband, who works as a driver with his own car. She has been a member of the "Jesus of Nazareth" Communal Bank for four years. The first loan she received was for 300 Peruvian soles, and she invested it in soft drinks. Currently, she needs a loan of 1200 soles, which will be invested in snacks for her business. Mayra's goal for the future is to open a clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in snacks for her business

loans.name: Chakiratou-Laï

texts.fr: A. Chakiratou-Laï est née le 07 août 1982 à Porto-Novo, capitale politique du Bénin. Célibataire avec deux enfants dont un à sa charge,  Chakiratou-Laï vit seule avec eux au quartier Midombo, à Cotonou capitale économique du Bénin. Chakiratou-Laï a été à l’école jusqu’au secondaire et tous ses enfants sont scolarisés. Chakiratou-Laï est spécialisée dans la vente de cartes de recharges téléphonique de tous les réseaux du Bénin depuis près de quatre ans. Chakiratou-Laï achète ces recharges auprès des distributeurs et les vend à Midombo et à Sainte Rita à Cotonou. Pendant la période de la rentrée, Chakiratou-Laï vend également des fournitures scolaires qu’elle achète chez les papeteries modernes. Chakiratou-Laï a obtenu déjà cinq crédits qu’elle a bien remboursé à ALIDé. Dans l’optique de mieux satisfaire la demande nombreuse de la clientèle en cette période de rentrée des classes et accroître ses parts de marché, Chakiratou-Laï sollicite un sixième prêt auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Chakiratou-Laï A. was born on 7 August 1982 in Porto-Novo, the political capital of Benin. Unmarried with two children in her care, Chakiratou-Laï lives alone with her children in the Midombo district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Chakiratou-Laï attended school up to the secondary level, and all of her children are in school. For about four years, Chakiratou-Laï has specialized in the sale of rechargeable phone cards for all of Benin's telephone networks. Chakiratou-Laï buys these cards from distributors and sells them in Midombo and Sainte Rita in Cotonou. During the time when the school year restarts, Chakiratou-Laï also sells school supplies, which she buys from modern stationery stores. Chakiratou-Laï has already obtained five loans through ALIDE (one of Kiva's field partners), all of which she repaid properly. With the goal of better satisfying the numerous demands of her customers during the start of the school year and increasing her market share, Chakiratou-Laï is seeking a third loan through ALIDE.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell school supplies

loans.name: Abelardo

texts.en:
Abelardo is a taxi driver. He earns about 50 – 60 soles each day. He owns his own car and will use this loan to repair his vehicle.

Abelardo is 38 years old and lives with his partner and two children. He is a client of Asociación Arariwa and part of a communal bank consisting of 26 members in Cusco. The group is called "El Amanecer", which means "Daybreak" in Spanish. He is from Cusco and lives in Cusco.

Abelardo appreciates, and thanks you for, the loan and promises to make the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To maintain and repair his car

loans.name: Brenda Elizabeth

texts.es:
la joven Brenda Elizabeth V. C. tiene 23 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Vive con su madre y estudia enfermeria los fines de semana.
Es comerciante individual, vende ropa de cama, ropa para damas y caballeros y sandalias, necesita un prestamo para la compra de ropa y sandalias para tener suficiente producto en navidad.
con las genancias que ella saca son para ayudarle a su mama en el hogar con alimentos y pagos de servcios publicos, tambien ocupa el dinero para sus estudios.
su meta es poder graduarse y ser una enfermera profesional.
texts.en:
Brenda Elizabeth V. C., 23, is single and has no children. She lives with her mother and is studying nursing on weekends. She is an independent merchant; she sells bed linens, ladies' and mens' clothing, and sandals. She needs financing to buy clothing and sandals to have enough stock available for the Christmas season. The profits she makes are used to help her mother with household expenses, like food and utilities, and she also needs the money to pay for her schooling. Her goal is to graduate and become a professional nurse.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bed linens, dress shirts, blouses, underwear, shoes.

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie S. is from the village of Cagay-anon, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Merlie owns and operates a business making and selling food, making "puto" (rice cakes) and other delicacies for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Merlie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es:
Rodrigo es un hombre emprendedor de 35 años, vive con su esposa (Jenny), que tiene 28 años, y con su pequeño e inquieto niño, Josué de 6 años, en su amplia casa que es propia y que logró construir con mucho esfuerzo.

En su juventud estudió agropecuaria, ya que siempre vivió rodeado de plantaciones en la selva, eso lo inspiró desde muy pequeño y así escogió estudiar esa profesión. Después de terminar su carrera volvió a su tierra a practicar todo lo aprendido; desde entonces han pasado varios años y ahora se dedica a brindar asesoramiento técnico en el campo a diferentes agricultores.
A su vez, también siembra café, plátanos y maíz en sus propias tierras, para estas labores cuenta con la ayuda del personal que contrata, además le gusta el trabajo de asesor, ya que puede ejercer su profesión en la zona donde nació y creció. Esta actividad le es muy rentable, además de las ganancias que le brinda la producción en su chacra, para el futuro tiene pensado adquirir más terrenos para sembrar y para revenderlos a mejor precio después de darles mantenimiento.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está seguro que será puntual con cada pago porque quiere seguir progresando y sabe que esto sólo lo alcanzará con honestidad. Ya tiene pensado invertir el dinero del préstamo en abono para sus tierras y también para el pago del personal que contrata para el mantenimiento de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Rodrigo is an enterprising 35-year-old man. He lives with his wife (Jenny), who is 28 years old, and with their small and restless child, Josué, who is 6. They live in a large house, which they own and and were able to build with a great deal of effort.

He studied farming in his youth, since he was always surrounded by plantations in the jungle. This inspired him at a very young age and that is how he chose to study that profession. After finishing his studies, he returned to his land to practice everything that he had learned. Since then, several years have passed and he now provides technical advice to different farmers in the countryside. At the same time, he also plants coffee, bananas and corn on his own lands so he also has the help of the workers that he hires. In addition, he likes working as a consultant so that he can practice his profession in the area where he was born and raised. This work is very profitable, in addition to the earnings from his small farm. In future, he plans to acquire more lands to cultivate and to resell them at a better price after doing maintenance.

This is Rodrigo's first loan with MFP and he is certain that he will be punctual with each payment because he wants to continue making process and he knows that he can only achieve this with honesty. He already plans to invest the money from the loan in fertilizer for his lands, and also for the payment of the staff that he hires to maintain his lands.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Gansuh

texts.en: Gansuh D. lives with his wife and two daughters in Zavhan province, Mongolia. His two daughters, aged 17 and 19, live and study in university in Ulaanbaatar city, the capital of Mongolia. He operates a photo studio called "Mongol Photo." In his studio, customers have the chance to dress up in Mongolian traditional clothes while having their photos taken. He started his business in 2008 with a loan of 3,700,000 tugrugs (~2,595 USD) from XacBank, a Field Partner of Kiva, and has worked hard to build a stable operation. Gansuh has used his earnings to support his family and afford his two daughters' education. He is requesting a 4,000,000-tugrug loan to purchase Mongolian traditional clothes and some equipment for his business.

loans.use: To purchase Mongolian traditional clothes and some equipment

loans.name: Leonor Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora Leonor del Carmen López Hernández, Labora como Supervisora Técnica de Computación en el Instituto Manuel Olivares de Managua, ella tiene un  hijos a su cargo, y  este se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casada, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante un año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido un créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  ella es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc y perlines, para reparar parte del techo de su casa de habitación por lo que el anterior se encontraba en mal estado.

Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos. 

Leonor dijo que gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por ceprodel ha podido mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Leonor del Carmen López Hernández works as a Technical Supervisor of Computing at the Manuel Olivares Institute in Managua. She has school-age children and is married. She has worked with loans from CEPRODEL for the past year and in this time period she has invested the loans in improving her housing, thanks to the financing from CEPRODEL. She is an excellent client. The loan she is requesting is to invest in buying construction materials such as zinc and metallic pieces to repair part of the roof of her house, which has been in bad condition. This will provide greater security and better living conditions for her children. Leonor said thank you for the financing from CEPRODEL which has enabled her to improve her housing.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to improve her housing and addition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sell spare parts

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es un joven entusiasta y muy trabajador de 30 años, vive con su pareja, Flor de 27 años, y sus 2 hijos: Leonel de 4 y Nahomi de 1 año. Su casa es propia y está ubicada en el pueblo de Huaylahuichan en la ciudad de Tarma.

Desde hace 15 años, junto a su esposa, se dedica a la siembra de papa, maíz y arveja, con sus ganancias lograron compraron terrenos donde sembraron gran cantidad de maíz como vemos en la foto. Además están ahorrando para que no les falte nada a sus hijos en el futuro ni ahora. Mientras su esposa se encarga de contratar operarios para que limpien y cuiden sus sembríos, él y su hermano, viajan a vender choclo en un mercado de la ciudad de Lima. 
Dentro de sus actividades agrícolas lo que a veces lo desalienta es que los productos, por temporadas, pierden su valor y cuestan menos, sin embargo asegura que no pierde, pues siempre le quedan ganancias.
Para su futuro anhela tener su propio vehículo para trasladar sus productos a la capital y dejar de pagar el transporte; también quiere trabajar independientemente de su hermano para obtener mayores utilidades.

Este es el octavo préstamo que tiene con MFP y considera que desde que accedió a los créditos y es parte de un banco comunal está progresando mucho, por lo que ya no quiere parar su ritmo de labor diaria. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en su negocio de compra y venta de choclos.
texts.en:
Juan is an enthusiastic and hardworking young man; he is 30 years old and lives with his partner, Flor (27) and their two children: Leonel (4) and Nahomi (1). His house is located in the town of Huaylahuichan, in the city of Tarma. For the last 15 years, along with his wife, Leonel has been planting potatoes, corn, and peas. With their earnings, Leonel and Flor have been able to buy two pieces of land where they have planted lots of corn (as we see in the picture). In addition, they are saving so that their kids will want for nothing, neither now, nor in the future. While his wife is in charge of hiring farm hands who clean and take care of their crops, Leonel and his brother travel to sell the corn at a market in Lima. In his activities, Leonel is disappointed that sometimes, products lose some of their value according to the season; however, he assures us he doesn't lose anything, as he always makes a profit. In the future, Leonel would like to have his own vehicle to transport his products to the capital city and in that way, stop paying for transportation. He'd also like to work independently of his brother in order to increase his earnings. This is the 8th loan Leonel is receiving from Kiva partner MFP and he believes that since requesting credit and becoming a part of a communal bank, he has gotten ahead quite a bit and does not want to stop his daily work rhythm. He will use the loan proceeds to invest in his corn business.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in his corn business

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es: María Dolores G. de 47 años de edad, reside en el municipio de San Francisco goteras, ubicado en el departamento Morazán. Vive junto a su esposo y una nieta de 8 años de edad, la cual está a cargo por completo de María. Ella posee una venta de ropa para niños, mujeres y hombres, así mismo vende zapatos. Ella comercializa sus productos desde su casa y así mismo los vende de forma ambulante entre sus vecinos, y personas de otras colonias. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más ropa en diferentes estilos y colores, de manera que pueda obtener mayor clientela, así mismo comprar más zapatos. Todo esto lo hace con el deseo de ver prosperar su negocio y así mismo su economía familiar, ya que su esposo es empleado de una empresa privada pero a pesar de esto sus ganancias en muchas ocasiones no dan abasto con todo los gastos, razón por la que María ha decidido solicitar el préstamo a Integral, con la esperanza de poder mejorar su negocio y solventar todo lo que a su esposo se le dificulta. A pesar que María cuenta con una familia pequeña, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora la cual se esfuerza día con día por tener una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Maria Dolores Garcia, 47 years old, lives in the outskirts of the town of San Francisco, which is located in the Morazán area. She lives with her husband and 8-year-old granddaughter, for whom Maria is completely responsible. She sells clothing for children, women, and men and also sells shoes. She sells her products from her house and also sells them as walking vendor among her neighbors and people from other towns. She is seeking a loan through which she can buy more clothing in different styles and colors; in this way she can acquire a bigger clientele, and she will also buy more shoes. She does all this with the desire to see her business and also her family economy prosper, since her husband is an employee of a private business, but in spite of this, his earnings often aren't enough to cover all the expenses. For this reason, Maria has decided to apply for a loan at Integral, with the hope of being able to improve her business and pay for everything that is difficult for her husband. In spite of the fact that Maria has a small family, she is a very hardworking woman who tries hard every day to have a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing to sell

location.town: San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán

loans.name: Helping Hands Group

texts.en:
